title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Raycons better up their game if they wanna compete.
author: Dawson
content: Before I bought these I had raycons. Raycon earbuds are absolute trash. The feel was cheap and they broke after dropping them. The sound was eh but absolute trash. I had to use the warranty to get a new pair and same issue. I had to eventually buy a new pair and I decided I wouldn't ever buy raycons again and since these were on sale for $60 I decided to give them a shot. I knew JBL was a great speaker and headphones brand so I wanted to give them a try. Omg they are the best earbuds I've ever had. They're so easy to connect to ur phone and you can change the sound profile from the app. The sound cancellation is like nothing I've ever had even better somehow than my gaming headphones I think. The bass is unreal!!! The sound clarity and everything is incredible. Best earbuds I've ever had. They are durable too. They feel like good quality and the case is perfect. It feels good it snaps shut and has a good satisfying feel and sound when it does. It fits perfectly in my pocket and the charge life is so fricken long I can go a week without charging it and it still has life. I've had these for about a month and only charged them maybe twice. I'm so happy with the way these are id highly suggest buying these. Especially over raycon earbuds. I'm so happy I helped people not waste their money on that crappy brand. Someone I talked to even canceled their order to buy a pair of these and thanked me because these were on sale for way cheaper. But even at base price for only a few dollars more why not buy quality? If you want the best earbuds I'd say on the market ....buy these. It's cheap for the experience and quality your getting.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing sound quality
author: Amazon Customer
content: This review is representative of my first impressions after receiving the item.Fit - 4/5: While I've had better fitting earbuds in the past, I would say that these aren't problematic at all, but not perfect either. The buds fit fairly snugly in my ears, and its quite nice that they've included a few tips. They don't seem to move around if I shake my head, so I have decent confidence that if I take them to the gym or on a run, I wouldn't have problems. That said, they don't quite fit perfectly, but everyones ear is a bit different so others might find it better or worse.Sound - 5/5: All I can say is wow do I love the sound that these produce. The level of bass is far beyond anything that I've had from my other earbuds (Jabra Elite 65t and Jlabs JBuds Air). The app includes equalizer settings that actually make quite a lot of difference (unlike other headphone apps I have used) and I am blown away by how much bass can come from these headphones. I have also noticed with other wireless buds that they tend to be on the quiet side, not reaching the same volume that my larger Sony headphones can, but that is not at all the case here. These get LOUD. As someone who plans to mainly use these for workouts, this is exactly what I hoped for.Battery - 5/5: So far I have not had a chance to use these until they die, so I have to disclaim that. However, if the battery matches up or comes close to their claims, which I expect they will given it is a reputable brand, then I will be impressed. My other buds max out at around 8 hours, so getting almost 4x the total battery life is excellent. 8 hours without recharging is very impressive.Look and feel - 3/5: The case looks nice and I think the aesthetics are fine. But the buds themselves are polished smooth, which makes them a bit tricky to handle with your fingertips. Once they're in, its no problem. But a matte finish or some texture would have been better for usability.I'll update this review if I find any reason to, but I am extremely impressed by the headphones, especially for the price point. Highly recommend!

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars JBL for the win.
author: Amber
content: Affordable, and great all arounder. Noise cancelling is great, they fit in my ears well which I usually have trouble with. The quick start guide helped a ton figuring out all the controls, which is a must for me as I find I have a lot trouble figuring these types of things out. I think there is even an app that you can change the commands which is pretty cool! So they get an A plus for adjustability in that regard.I love the color, I chose navy but there many to choose from. I havenâ€™t used them much for phone calls yet, but they pick up the wind a lot so Iâ€™ve chosen not to use them for most of my phone calls when Iâ€™ve had them in.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great sound, comfortable in the ears
author: Rusty Squeezebox
content: Took a chance and bought these on prime day, pleasantly surprised with the quality compared to the jlab buds I've been using for years. Again very happy with the quality but more importantly for me is the battery life, these are very comparable with the higher end jlab buds that will last me the entire work day and have enough juice in the case so that I'm not having to charge them multiple times a week. These are amazing in both categories. And lastly you can listen to each bud independently which is a must for people like me that usually only wear one. So In the off chance one dies you just pop in the other one and your good to go for another 8 hours.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars At 50% or more off, these are great.
author: Dru Ha
content: I have one pair for work and one for home/going out. I wouldnâ€™t have spent $100 on each pair but at $50 per pair theyâ€™re a good deal.The ANC is pretty impressive for little earbuds. Makes the background sounds in an IHOP at 9:30 on a Sunday nearly disappear. They also eliminate the sound of snoring dogs and humans.Took a recent trip on an airplane and opted to bring these instead of my Sennheiser Momentum 3â€™s. Iâ€™m an audiophile on a budget. They canâ€™t compete with the over-ear Momentum for sound reproduction. But for earbuds theyâ€™re a great product at the sale price.There is a JBL app you can download to your smartphone but the controls are reasonably intuitive. I have big fingers so I probably miss the sweet-spot for function control more than the average person. Iâ€™ve found the bass to be a little lacking but I think thatâ€™s due to the EQ setting Iâ€™ve selected. You do have some EQ presets to choose between in the app.They come with three sets of the rubber earplugs for various sizes of ear-canals. Medium worked for me. I can use them to sleep, travel, shut out the loud noises in restaurants, and for Zoom calls.Consider the color you want to stand out against your bedding when they fall out if falling asleep with them in.I like them enough that I bought a second, dedicated pair for work.The ANC has three settings but so far I havenâ€™t found one that totally mutes audio output from your device in the â€œambient-awareâ€ or â€œtalk throughâ€ modes. Thatâ€™s a feature I like on my Momentum. It can be accomplished by the extra step of just pausing playback with a tap on the right, then tap the left to toggle through the three ANC modes.They work great with an iPhone as well as Windows 10/11 computers.Much greater clarity the the JLAB go, which donâ€™t seem to have any functional ANC. I should have spent the extra money at the get-go.Buy them when on sale. Theyâ€™ll probably be fine for you.If ANC and a variety of EQ options are the most important features for you, spring for the current $300 - $400 Sony over-ears. I have a pair of those in the house-too. Their ANC is better but for the music I listen to the Sennheisers are #1. However I would recommend the Sonys for over-ear for the average listener and these for travel, etc. itâ€™s a lot harder to lose a big set of cans than earbuds so I donâ€™t want to invest too much in these little guys.JBL has always served me pretty well for the price in the pro-audio and live sound amplification area so I had some confidence in the name when I bought these.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Right earbud stopped workingâ€¦
author: Zoe
content: I bought these JBL earbuds in March (itâ€™s July now) as a cheap replacement for my lost AirPods and I absolutely fell in love with them. These things really get me through the day with their ambient sound control, great sound quality and omg talk about battery life! This being saidâ€¦.About a month ago my right earbud started having connectivity issues with my Bluetooth (while my left earbud functions normally) and now has completely lost the ability to gain charge. So Iâ€™ve basically been down to one earbud which doesnâ€™t allow any of the ambient sound controls and is honestly kind of annoying!I really never write reviews for anything, but Iâ€™m genuinely devastated because I loved these JBL earbuds so much and I really needed these to last me longer than 5 months. I hate leaving a bad review, but I donâ€™t want anyone to potentially face this issue!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wow, these are good sounding earbuds
author: Mike
content: There are review sites around that test headphones and earbuds and as far accuracy in frequency response and imaging, these earbuds outrank most other brand's more expensive earbuds.I have the JBL Tune 600BTNC headphones which are a great over the ear headphones and these earbuds sound just as good and even a bit clearer. That's hard to do. Both, these 230NC and the 600BTNC have bass between 20Hz and 100Hz elevated by 3db to 5db, the 230NC being a bit more accurate. That's Ok because I like my bass a few decibels higher.These earbuds have really good punch as well as ultra low bass down to 20HZ. Comparing these 230NC to your subwoofer is a great way to see how good or weak your subwoofer is. Since these 230NC earbuds are accurate from 20Hz to 60Hz within 1db or +4db above 100Hz, most subwoofers can't provide the bass these earbuds can.The clarity in the midrange and treble is great, and without elevation to make music sound bright and fatiguing.I have tried the JBL Club Pro Plus and Tune 125TWS and neither would seal correctly or be comfortable to wear more than 10 minutes. Mainly because of the big club at the end of the actual ear piece. Those earbuds don't fit good in every ear because they are big. The 230NC doesn't have club at the end of the earpiece but a small thin stalk like most "wired" earbuds that fit everyone good. These 230NC with their long thin stalks fit my ears good and seal good, plus they are actually more comfortable than my 600BTNC headphones. The Club Pro Plus actually hurt my ears and left them in pain for an hour after only wearing them for 10 minutes.These 230NC earbuds sound great, seal good, and are comfortable enough to wear for hours. I don't see doing any better than some $300 earbuds or headphone for sound quality.The one thing they fall down in and so do my 600BTNC is that they use the lower class active noise cancelling instead of the adaptive noise canceling. Honestly they sound great even in a noisy plant with the active noise cancelling.For the price slashing Amazon does to the retail price, they are a bargain IMO.The only thing I wish they had was function to test if they are sealed correctly like the Club Pro Plus had in it's app. That way you know you are getting the maximum bass response that these earbuds can produce. I simply test using music with ultra low bass that I'm very familiar with.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars A satisfactory pair of earbuds with a decent attempt at noise cancellation
author: Tonigiri
content: In this review, I will compare the jbl 230 nc wireless earbuds with some of the best wireless earbuds of 2023, based on four criteria: noise cancellation, sound quality, battery life, and design.Noise cancellation: The jbl 230 nc wireless earbuds have active noise cancellation, which works well in most situations, but may not be effective in very loud environments. The Sony WF-1000XM5 wireless earbuds are the best in this category, with outstanding noise-canceling performance that adapts to your surroundings and personal preferences. The Bose QuietComfort Earbuds 2 are also excellent, with adjustable noise cancellation levels and a transparency mode. The Apple AirPods Pro 2 is another good option, with effective noise cancellation and spatial audio support.Sound quality: The jbl 230 nc wireless earbuds deliver a decent sound quality, with a balanced and clear output. However, they may not satisfy audiophiles who prefer a more detailed and dynamic sound. The Technics EAH-AZ80 wireless earbuds are the best in this category in my opinion, with a superb sound quality that rivals some of the best over-ear headphones. They have a rich and balanced sound signature, with deep bass, clear mids, and crisp highs. They also support high-resolution audio codecs and have a dedicated app for EQ customization. The Sony WF-1000XM5 wireless earbuds are also great, with a dynamic and engaging sound that can be tweaked via the Sony Headphones Connect app. The Bose QuietComfort Earbuds 2 are also impressive, with a top-notch sound quality that is well-balanced and natural. Keep in mind that the jbl 230 nc sits in a very different price point than the earbuds above so it's still punching way above its weight in this regard.Battery life: The jbl 230 nc wireless earbuds have a battery life of about four hours, which is average for wireless earbuds. They come with a charging case that can provide an additional 12 hours of playback. The Sony WF-1000XM5 wireless earbuds are the best in this category, with a battery life of up to eight hours with noise cancellation on, and up to 24 hours with the charging case. They also have a quick charge feature that can give you an hour of listening time with just 10 minutes of charging. The Apple AirPods Pro 2 are also good, with a battery life of up to six hours with noise cancellation on, and up to 30 hours with the charging case. They also support wireless charging and have a fast charge feature that can give you an hour of listening time with just five minutes of charging.Design: The jbl 230 nc wireless earbuds have a simple and sleek design, with a matte black finish and a jbl logo on each earbud. They are lightweight and comfortable to wear, with three sizes of silicone ear tips to choose from. They are also water-resistant, which means they can withstand sweat and rain. The Apple AirPods Pro 2 is the best in this category, with a sleek and ergonomic design that fits snugly in your ears. They have an open design without tips, which means they don't block out the outside sound completely. They also have force sensors on each stem that let you control music playback, calls, noise cancellation, and voice assistants. The Beats Fit Pro wireless earbuds are also stylish and comfortable, with a winged design that keeps them secure in your ears. They have an IPX4 rating for water resistance and have touch controls on each earbud.Conclusion: The jbl 230 nc wireless earbuds are a decent pair of headphones for casual listeners who want to escape the noise of the world. However, they are not the best in any category, and they face stiff competition from other models that offer better performance and features. If you want the best noise cancellation, sound quality, battery life, or design, you may want to consider other options such as the Sony WF-1000XM5, the Technics EAH-AZ80, the Bose QuietComfort Earbuds 2, or the Apple AirPods Pro 2. At this price point however, which is often lower (I bought mine on sale for 50% off), the jbl 230 nc is a no-brainer and will give you a value you can't say no to.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Had high hopes, jury is still out.
author: Shonna
content: I bought these to replace my skullcandy sesh Evo. I had the skillcandy for over a year & recently I lost the left bud & then the right ear bud decided it was gonna be finicky about charging. Like the sensor wasn't connecting properly anymore. It was getting super frustrating because I only had 1 ear bud left & when I wanted to use it it would either be dead or only give me a few minutes. After watching many reviews on YouTube & reading them here I decided I'd get these JBL ones as they had good reviews & *bonus* they were on sale for $49.00. I am on day 3 of using them. Around my house I normally only wear 1 ear bud so I can still keep an ear on my kids. I used the right ear bud all day yesterday, sticking it back in the case when not in use. Last night I went to use the left ear bud & it didn't automatically connect when I took it out like the right one. When I had both out it connected so I put the right back in the case. When I woke up this morning I went to use the left one & the app said it only had 20% battery even though it was in the charger all night. In messing with them I realized even in the case the left was still connected & playing. I finally got it to connect to the charger & work properly. But I feel like it shouldn't be this difficult. It's not rocket science placing the ear buds in the case. I am using these for music, podcasts, & watching shows. The sound is great. I haven't made calls with them. They fit comfortably in my ear, I like the black sleek color. I am just hoping I don't continue to have charging or connection issues as I will use these EVERY SINGLE DAY all throughout the day.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better noise canceling than JLAB
author: Courtney
content: These headphones are what I've been looking for in a pair of headphones for SO LONG! I love them they connect instantly, the durability only time will tell. The comfort, they are extremely comfortable ðŸ˜Œ.Volume control I'll group the rating of the different "be aware" controls here the ambient be aware is like your traditional be aware you can listen to music while also hearing your surroundings a little but but the voice be aware setting turns your music down and allows you to listen while also hearing most everything around you with good clarity. The noise canceling I'll tell you how good it is: I ride public transportation a d our roads in the city is not good so it makes the bus rattle when it goes over the bumps and it canceled that loud noise out to about 20-30% of the original sound. I got the black headphones. And the weight they are very light :). All around I love these headphones and I will be keeping them for a VERY long time.If you are on the fence on if you should get these headphones: get them, you will not regret it

content: I think I spent at least $100 on these back in September '22. I wanted to replace a former set of earbuds with something more substantial and higher quality. First, the left earbud stopped charging altogether (no light shows up even after cleaning the contacts). Then the charging case went entirely dead after just charging it to 100%. So I'm figuring it's the end. Sadly.I had figured a mid-priced brand would be a nice middle ground (somewhere between Tribit and Bose lol). I am not a power user and am very careful with my earbuds, so maybe this was just as long as these were going to live. I will keep buying JBL, but have to unfortunately add my voice of disappointment on these earbuds.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars 4 Stars because after 1 year, left earbud won't hold charge.

content: They were pretty good. Great at blocking sound and great sound quality. title: 3.0 out of 5 stars They are okah
author: The drawers are like mesh and donâ€™t slid in all the way. I thought they were going to be wooden drawers.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Best battery life, Great noise cancelling, awkward fit in case
author: N8
content: I have only used wired headphones for years. This is the first time I've ever purchased Bluetooth wireless ear buds - so, know going forwards that I don't have anything to compare these to.That being said, I do have a few pairs of Bluetooth wireless headphones, and I'm making some assumptions, based upon these.So, the first thing I'll say is that the Noise Canceling feature in these is downright amazing. I mean, for something so small to be able to block out so much noise is just quite unbelievable.In addition, the Ambient Aware mode is quite amazing as well, as you can literally hear everything around you, while still hearing the music quite clearly - you can tell that a lot of R & D went into these.The Talk Through mode is also good - although I think it makes the music so low that you really can't even hear it - but it is handy in case you need to have a conversation. I've had a conversation with Ambient Aware mode turned on, and I can hear the other person just fine.Okay, here is where I'll start making some assumptions. I don't have another pair of BT earbuds to compare to, so I'm assuming that other companies would create apps similar to the ones for their BT headphones when making apps for their ear buds.The JBL app is my favorite one. It's very easy to get into, has some settings you can change (like what each ear bud does when you touch it certain ways), as well as allows you to change the audio mode that you've enabled.Now, I have a pair of Anker BT headphones, and they are really comfy, but the app is nowhere near as feature-rich as the JBL app is.I guess if there is anything that I don't like about these it would be the inability to turn them off without using the app. You can set them to time out after a set amount of time, so they would turn themselves off at some point, but I think that is a waste of the battery, so I use the app to turn them off.Another thing I don't like is the case - the ear buds fit into it in a very awkward way - I'm always having to twist my wrists to get them in correctly. I think this was a major design flaw, but it's minor compared to all the other benefits of these.One thing I absolutely love on these is the battery. I've used these for about an hour, turned them off (via the app), kept them outside of the case, and come back to them a month later, and they are still at the same battery percentage as a month ago - unbelievable.I should also mention that the battery lasts a fair amount of time when actually listening to them. I use these when working out, and they last plenty of time for me to run and lift weights.I've never actually tried to figure out exactly how long they last on one charge, but if I'd have to guess, it's probably upwards of 5 hrs at least.To save battery power, I usually put mine in a ziplock bag, along with the case - so that the battery gets to run-down without being recharged all the time. I only put them back into the case when the battery is actually low.The case also charges very quickly (as do the ear buds as well).So, overall, I'd highly recommend these ear buds. They have some minor issues that I've discussed, but in my opinion, the pro's far outweigh the con's for these.If you found this review helpful, please click on "helpful" or the thumb's up.Thanks.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just Perfect

content: I was looking for some backup earphones in case the Bose I have run out of battery, to my surprise. This JBL model left me very impressed, battery life is amazing and even more the crystal-clear sound is better than other expensives earbuds . I really recommend them.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not good for motorcycle use, but excellent sound quality.
author: Jeffrey Jenkins
content: I bought these in an attempt to improve upon the mediocre sound quality of the "MiPeace" earbuds I've been using on my motorcycle for about a year now, and in that respect the JBL did not disappoint - these really are quite good sounding (almost as good as my old Etymotic ER-6 wired earbuds). Sitting on my bike with the engine running but not moving the active noise cancellation seemed to work very well - I couldn't hear the engine at all, actually - but once I started moving things weren't quite so rosy. It seems the active noise cancellation is just a tad too slow to respond to wind buffeting noise because the music is horribly distorted as if one is listening to speakers through the spinning blades of a fan. Unfortunately, with the active noise cancellation turned off the silicone cup style earplugs don't do near as good a job of passively blocking ambient sounds as the silicone triple-rib style earplugs on the MiPeace (or the Elgin's I replaced these with), so I reluctantly returned them.

author: bob bulla
content: I have two sets of another brand that cost four times more without the quality and features. Best sound and when fully charged they last approximately 5 days. After purchasing the first set I purchased another setfor backup in case I lose the first ones.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best I have owned

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great Sound, Weird Quirks
author: Love

(So great for shopping during the holidays, you can block out all the crowd chatter and repetitively Christmas music!)- Ability to switch noise cancellation modes is easy! (So you can optionally listen to people speak while cutting out a few decibles like fan noise.)- Build quality is solid!- The JBL app works flawlessly!- They connect to phone and other devices easily, total plug & play!Cons:- They tend to disconnect more often, which isnâ€™t that annoying per se â€” except it makes a beep sound to alert you that something is wrong. (The Apple earbuds just turn off, so thereâ€™s no jarring loud beep in your ears.) This is especially annoying when it happens in the middle of a song.- This one is weird â€” If you hold the two earbuds in your hand, and they touch in a certain way, it makes a loud chirping noise. (Almost like the feedback of two microphones being too close together.)- Theyâ€™re kind of bulky, and fall out of my ears more often than the Apple AirPods did. Even after changing the rubber tips. (The bright side is that because theyâ€™re so bulky, theyâ€™re easier to find on the ground.)- Though you can use the JBL app to find your earbuds, it doesnâ€™t help you find the charging chase.Conclusion:- For $50, Iâ€™ll keep â€˜em! The sound quality is truly excellent enough to look past the weird quirks.And if they get lost, as most earbuds often do, it wonâ€™t break my wallet to do so. (The Apple ones are comfy and have less quirks, but kind of overrated at that price point.)So I would buy JBL earbuds again â€” though I might look into the smaller models, that maybe (hopefully) arenâ€™t as prone to pop out of the ear like a cartoon bean.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Disappointing
author: Ken
content: There are several things I like about the JBL 230. The sound quality is pretty good and the noise cancelling is excellent for this price range. So, if you're in a noisy office or work environment, these may work for you. The battery life is great, and the JBL app provides a good equalizer for customizing your sound. I love the blue color, and the touch controls work, even if finding that "sweet" spot takes a bit of practice.What I don't like is that every time you put the earbuds in, they start in the "Ambient Aware" mode (sounds around you are amplified). It's great, if you want to hear what Margret down in accounting thinks about Bob's new haircut from across the room, but I hate it. I'm typically putting in earbuds to block out the sound around me, not to make it louder. Plus, the Ambient Aware function uses battery life. I'd much rather have the ability to start in a "normal" (non-amplified) setting, but that's not available. You have to start with them active and either open up the app to turn it off or set the buds to use a touch feature to turn it off (meaning you can't use the touch feature to control your music, change volume or anything else).My second gripe is around the microphones and wind. Any slight breeze makes it impossible for you to be heard at the other end of a phone call. I'm often outside and I simply can't make phone calls if there's a breeze. Likewise, driving with the windows down while on the phone is a no-go. The wind drowns out everything else. If you happen to have Ambient Aware turned on (remember, it's the default?), it amplifies that wind noise in your ears, as well, even if you're not on the phone. This is a real deal breaker, and everyone from Apple to Samsung and Sony do a much better job of limiting wind noise on phone calls with their buds.There are other minor things. The buds are very lightweight, which is good, but they stick a little too far out of my ear, so they're always getting knocked loose. They sit in the case with the speakers facing outward, so you always have to turn them around when taking them out or putting them away, since most people are designed with their ear canals going *in* to their heads (this design makes zero sense). The app is slow to load. You can't do anything in the app until it finds and connects to your buds, so you have to have at least one bud in to use the app for anything, which is weird (I can't even view the app right now to tell you about it because my buds are at home, so the app won't open), and many app features aren't accessible unless you have both buds in.I really wanted to like these, but the inability to use them in 90% of the cases I want them just makes them worthless to me.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice sound quality, terrible case

content: Usually I wouldn't take off an entire star for something as seemingly mere as the case, but I am with these earbuds. This case is so slippery. The charging lights on the case have began to malfunction. I like these earbuds, but I would recommend storing the case in a pouch or something with a little more grip to it.As for the earbuds themselves, they're great. I've had them for a year now and they work wonderfully. The audio quality is great, not the best but worth the price. They fit into my ears wonderfully and don't slip out easily which is quite rare for me. The Bluetooth range also seems to be quite large and I never have issues with that.One other thing is that the battery has definitely dwindled rapidly in the past year, but I use these earbuds everyday for at least a few hours, so that's to be expected. I don't mind charging them more often. The earbuds themselves still last about five to seven hours on a full charge, which is absolutely perfect for me.I like these earbuds a lot. I've never disliked a JBL product, really. I just wish the case wasn't so slick.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Ambient Aware white noise
author: Adam
content: Edit: Dropping original 5/5 for both earbuds to 3.5/5. Connectivity problems occasionally. I had the microphone just straight up gave up in the middle of a call and had to restart my computer to get it back to work again, unpair and pair didn't work. Occasionally, they randomly disconnect for a second or so, like every couple of hours on average. When that happens, there's a chance for one ear bud to be slightly delayed than the other, and has to unpair and pair to fix.If you use both earbuds all the time, then it's great for $50-60. 5/5Comfortably fit in my ears and don't fall out much when jogging. They'll still fall out when the moving is too much, but that's unavoidable in any earbuds like this. ANC works wonders. The sound quality is good for the price. Microphone is hit and miss like every other earbud out there, but generally works well.If you ever use just the right earbud, then it's awful. 0/5The ambient aware gives out a very audible white noise all the time. And it will automatically be turned on if you only use the right earbud. You cannot turn it off because the ambient aware setting is on the left earbud only. You can only turn that off in the phone app. But if the earbud is not connected to the phone, then you can't change it.One work around is to go to the phone app and let both earbud to have the ambient aware on off functions, but you will lose the right earbud's play/pause function. And you need to turn it off every single time you use it.The connection chime and setting change chimes are extremely loud and I can't find a way to lower the volume. So that's further annoyance. This applies to both single and both earbuds modes.I personally hate these and will be returning the earbuds. Such a shame.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Purchased for watching TV without disturbing others.
author: brian
content: This is my first Bluetooth listening device, thou not my first JBL product purchase. That would be a pair of L26 speakers, I purchased on lay-a-way, when I was 16, back in 1976 for $875. That would be over $6000 in 2023 dollars. Later I purchased JBL's J2050 Book-Shelf speakers and later still JBL's Media 100 Desk-Top speakers. I guess you would say, I would recommend JBL products, since I've had a 48 year relationship with their brand.I was on the brink of returning the JBL Tune 230NC TWS True Wireless In-Ear Noise Cancelling Ear-Buds but decided to contact JBL Customer support, to find out why I was unable to connect my ear-buds to my TV. I submitted a fairly detailed explanation, sufficient for their support staff to realize I was already paired to my phone. So I learned that ear-buds come in single-pairing and multi-point-pairing. The JBL Tune 230NC TWS True Wireless In-Ear Noise Cancelling Ear-Buds are single-pairing, which is just fine for me. These ear-buds can be very immersive, watching TV or Listening to music. The noise cancellation does a nice job of muffling surrounding noise. I had taken them with me on walks to listen to music or books-recordings and I became a bit concerned at how much of the sound around me was deadened. You then have to keep your head on a swivel.As these are my first ear-buds, I don't know if this is common but while out for a walk, the microphone ports, built into the ear-buds, pick up and transmit the sound of the wind scouring the microphone ports.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars perfect!!!

Overall, i would def recommend these for anyone looking for good affordable ear buds! (hopefully ill take care of my new pair now lmao)

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good inexpensive earbuds.
author: nekoBasu
content: I recommend these as an inexpensive earbud set.I like that they're red, so that stand out on my messy desk.I needed a new set to of earbuds, and decided Apple wasn't getting any more of my money in this space. I'm not thrilled with the longevity or support apple provides for their airpods pro.I found these on a list of of good cheap earbuds, and I'm happy. They work fine at the gym. out of the box, with the default rubber ear tips, I ran a mile on the treadmill this morning and I didn't fiddle with these once (for fit). They stay right where they're supposed to, which is not something I can say for airpods pro or another pair of earbuds I'd been using at the gym.These are not audiophile grade headphones. if you want that, keep looking. They do isolate pretty well. The base on the bass boost eq setting is just ok. But the sound is balance enough that it's not overly "tinny". I hate cheap speakers, and these don't sound too cheap. So while it's not the finest sound ever, it's still far from junk.Technically, coming from airpods, there are two downsides I've noticed (both survivable).1 - with my fingers - the buds themselves are very hard to remove from the charging case. If I never had owned airpods, I'm not sure I would know this. on the other hand, I think they seat really nicely in the case, and thus they always charge. The airpods famously don't always connect inside their case and sometimes aren't charging when you think they are. I'm ok with it, and I assume I'll eventually learn the "trick" to pulling these guys out with ease.2 - these were very easy to pair to my iphone. HOWEVER, unlike airpods, once these are paired to a device, they CANNOT be paired to another device unless they bluetooth connection is disconnected from the first device. e.g. with airpods, you can go back and forth between a macbook, an iphone, and an ipad, simply by selecting the airpods from the device. With these, if I was using them with my iphone, and then I want to use them with my ipad, I need to turn bluetooth off on the iphone for a moment until the buds are "free", and then I can connect them to my ipad. Sub-optimal, but not a deal breaker for me./a few pluses.1 - I can side-sleep with these in and they don't hurt. yay.2 - I love that the usb charging plug is integrated into the case. last thing I need is more cables.3 - again, for me, they fit well. Snug, almost to the point of being too big, but they don't bother me. I'm really impressed that they just stay put while I'm running and I don't need to constantly push them back into my ears for fear that they'll fall out./I haven't really had these long enough to have an opinion on the battery life.I haven't tried using these for calls yet, so no opinion on the microphone.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars UPDATE: First Impressions
author: MayBae
content: UPDATE:My AirPods are dying and have been constantly dropping Bluetooth with my phone, so I borrowed these from my daughter to wear for the day. I have had the right bud in for 7.5 hours and the battery percentage (which actually does show up on my phone screen in the control center) shows that I still have 40% battery life left. I also have not dropped Bluetooth once (!) and they still feel comfortable and light in my ear. Iâ€™m pretty astounded, actually. My AirPods would have died hours ago. The only issue I had was when I received a phone call. My phone rang, as well as hearing the ringing through the earbud, but when I answered, it did not automatically connect to the earbud at all. I had to talk into the phone normally. I also have noticed a distinct difference in the bass level between these and the AirPods. I donâ€™t know how much of it has been the slow death of the AirPods, but these sound so much better than the first time I tried them. 10/10. Do it.Old Review:I heard these were a pretty decent earbud set for the price and decided to try them out as a backup set. Iâ€™m coming from AirPod Pro (1st Generation) and prior to that, the Jabra 75t.I have to admit, this isnâ€™t bad for a $25 set of earbuds. One of the reasons I switched from the Jabra 75tâ€™s (aside from the fact I had to get warranty replacements TWICE), was because I wanted to be able to use each earbud interchangeably and Jabra did not have that at the time. Iâ€™m actually quite surprised that JLab included the functionality for this price point. The charger being built into the bottom of the case was a nice touch and I appreciate that both earbuds go in the case magnetically, as well as the lid being magnetic as well. It paired easily with my iPhone 15 Pro and my daughterâ€™s iPad.These are definitely lighter than both my Jabras and Pros. They fit in the ear nicely and I could see myself being able to wear them for a while (doing most things) and not have them fall out. My ears must be different sizes because my Pros consistently fall out of my left ear, but stay pretty good in my right ear.There isnâ€™t an app for these, so while you can change songs, adjust volume, and use Siri by pressing the buttons on the earbuds, you wonâ€™t be able to tweak any part of the sound. You also will not be able to check the battery percentage and will have to go off the audio prompts it gives you. These also do not have noise-cancelling capabilities (which I honestly wouldnâ€™t expect at the low price).So, hereâ€™s where Iâ€™m taking off one starâ€¦the sound. Iâ€™m not an audiophile. I donâ€™t typically listen to music so the majority of my use is podcasts, audiobooks, or YT/Twitch vids. The sound is a bit muted (â€¦not an audiophile) and not quite as clear as my Pros. For that reason, I likely will not use them unless I need to charge both my Pro earbuds at the same timeâ€¦and both my Jabraâ€™s are dead, haha. They would be fine in a pinch, but not something I would choose if my Pros are available.I also cannot speak to the battery life as I havenâ€™t used them for more than a couple minutes, but what they promise (32 hours) is extremely impressive. I ended up giving them to my daughter to use as she only has over the ear headphones. I will say itâ€™s a great first set of earbuds for kids as you do get a lot of great features in a lower priced set.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Superior Sound and Comfort in a Compact Package!
author: Pobles
content: The JLab Go Air Pop True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds have completely exceeded my expectations! From their sleek design to their exceptional sound quality, these earbuds are a true game-changer in the world of wireless audio.First and foremost, the sound quality is outstanding. With Bluetooth 5.1 connection and three EQ sound settings (Signature, Balanced, Bass Boost), I can customize my listening experience to suit my preferences perfectly. Whether I'm in the mood for crisp vocals, balanced tones, or powerful bass, these earbuds deliver every time.The dual-connect feature is a fantastic addition, allowing for seamless connectivity and ensuring that I never miss a beat. Whether I'm using one earbud for calls or both for immersive music listening, the connection remains stable and reliable.The IPX4 sweat resistance is a lifesaver during intense workouts or outdoor activities. I never have to worry about sweat or rain damaging my earbuds, giving me peace of mind to focus on my fitness goals.Comfort is another highlight of these earbuds. They fit snugly in my ears without causing any discomfort, even during extended wear. Plus, the charging case is compact and lightweight, making it easy to carry around wherever I go.Overall, the JLab Go Air Pop True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds are a phenomenal choice for anyone in need of high-quality audio on the go. Whether you're working out, commuting, or just relaxing at home, these earbuds deliver superior sound and comfort in a compact package. Highly recommended for their exceptional performance and value!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars What's not to love?
author: Amazon Customer
content: Where do I even start! Coming from airpods, switching to android and getting raycons then subsequently losing them- these are amazing. They fit well in my ear, have awesome mic and audio quality, and great batter life. I have 2 sets, one for.my steam deck and one pairs to my MacBook for work calls. Both work fantastic and have awesome sound quality. There is even a USB-A (the big USB connector) built right in! You don't need any additional cords or chargers, just a charging port! The more expensive brands could stand to take a page out of jlabs' book. I would happily do a video review for jlabs, and will be exploring their other products as well!!!

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars There may be better (lightning?) deals on buds out there, but these are decent for the price
author: Xmetal
content: Feb 2024: I am not sure if my current issue is fixable but maybe a day or two ago i noticed the right bud is not working ... it seems to be normal when i put it in the case but it never turns on anymore. The left bud is a-ok. Really this didn't last (note: i did get these used-like new and i have used them a bit) as long as I'd hope but it doesn't change my opinion. For the price (say $19.99) you can do better .. even if you have to wait for say a lightning deal on something like the TOZO T6's for $22.99 or something ... BUT ... i'd not say "these are horrible, avoid" ... the sound isn't the best like i said but they are small and really comfortable ... and while they dont have the best sound ... i have heard FAR worse ... just a little EQ'ing and these sound decent for relaxing music (one of my main uses) .. for podcasts or something ... that doesn't matter as much anyway (EQ'ing them) .... I will update this if i find its an easy fix but even a few resets hasn't gotten the right but to turn on yet.April 2023 Update: well ... I see these are $23 now ... I dont think they are worth that much (just a few $1's too high, dont get me wrong) ... but I got mine used-like new for $12.50 and I have seen them say at the $16 or so range ... you know .. these aren't 'great" but they are not that bad. I think say for podcasts or whatever they are fine ... you can just find better for music (even "jlab signature" and eq'ed on top). having said that ... I have used these at night for sleeping and they fit great. I HAVE gotten use to being careful with the built in cable (still not a fan of that though ... if a cable breaks you can replace it... if this breaks, your charging case cant charge the earbuds).I hate to act like any of the buds I still have are "not comfortable" but for me, comfort wise, these are up there. As long as you dont expect these to be top quality buds (NOR worst of the low price buds, again dont get me wrong) .. I think people may like theseUpdate 2+ condensed) After using these for a bit, and even counting the best EQ option (Jlab Signature) and a v-shaped EQ on top via Wavelet (app) these still do not sound as good as some other pairs i have, however using them for side sleep (whatever side faces the pillow DOESN'T have an earbud in), these do a surprising good job at passive noise cancelling for me. While they also dont sound the best... they dont sound "bad" either ... you can some real no-name duds below $20, .. these are decent for that sub $20 price range to be clear.I gave these 3 out of 5 stars but really its maybe between a 3.5 TO MAYBE a 3.75 to be clear ... maybe more toward 3.5 in my book though. I'd say look at TOZO first for deals ... but I still recommend these.They are comfortable to me too ... like they dont feel too big ... just right.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Update: 1) I did notice one day when it was REALLY humid the controls seem to get wonky ... like sometimes my presses weren't "registering" and then others would which would mean i'd do a function (change track for instance) when i wanted to change the EQ mode instead... it doesn't alway happen but it has once or twice in constant use since i bought these.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------i have to say the default tips + the size of the buds combo are nice ... I have ( .. even just to test THESE) been using these sleeping at times rather than my TOZO T6's and while i love the T6's i haven't found the "perfect" eartips for them that fit me (so to speak) ... at times with these Go Air Pops ... I hardly notice they are in my ears ... I didn't even open the little bag with the other tips to make sure (note: bought "used - like new") I got the other tips, yetmy one con that I REMEMBER typing this update is the sound quality ... .ok for the price on "JLab Signature" EQ but bang for your buck ... counting deals on Amazon ... you may be able to do better.So far Battery Life seems decent enough ... a little shorter than I expected but like i said i am using these for sleep and i count that time that I am sleeping so .... yeah battery life is good for the price, I'd say--------------------------First I want to mention this is all based on my first impressions after a few hours of use, only â€¦ things may change later. Bluetooth Earbuds I have are TOZOâ€™s T6â€™s and NC2â€™s (two pair now), Fiilâ€™s T1XS with app support, and Edifierâ€™s TWS1 Pros and Earfun wise the Air Free Pro 2â€™s, (Returned due to a number of issues) Earfun Free Miniâ€™s and to be clearâ€¦ Earfun Freeâ€™s that were sent to me unexpectedly after they saw my review of the Free Miniâ€™s (thank you Earfun) â€¦ point being is that I have experience with a number of earbuds even if I do use some more than the others (no real particular reason).Right away I noticed these opinionsPros- Fit â€“ to be clear none of the buds I have are really â€œuncomfortableâ€ in any way but these just fit good, with the default tips â€¦ or what I am guessing is the default tips (comparing them to the default TOZO T6 tips, they seem the same size) â€¦. Unless my ear starts to itch or something, I HARDLY notice the Go Air Pops are in my ears. I love my TOZO T6â€™s (form factor wise the nearest on the list I mentioned, to the same form factor as these)â€¦ but these just seem to fit a little better.Update a few days later (after writing the prior paragraph) â€“ these while they have fallen out from time to timeâ€¦ these are very comfortable. When using them for sleep (whatever side of my head faces the pillow if â€œside sleepingâ€ doesnâ€™t have an earbud in) â€¦ they are more comfortable then the TOZO T6â€™s I have used for the same thing before and with these there are times I barely know they are there, and I really like that.- Build quality â€“ I will not say these have â€œgreatâ€ build quality .. that just seems to be overstating it but these do not feel as cheap as the Earfun Air Free Miniâ€™s. Some ultra budget earbuds have a quality where it just feels like the cheapest plastics and materials were used â€¦ not the case with these buds, even if they donâ€™t scream â€˜high end qualityâ€ either.- Battery Life â€“ I am not going to act like I have counted or even really paid attention but these seem to last awhile and even after falling asleep for a bit with theseâ€¦ I cant say I have ever woken up to them NOT playing â€¦ since I bought them I had to charge them once and (just in case, I probably didnâ€™t have to) then a second time, just to make sure the case was fully charged at that point, but I just had no idea the caseâ€™s charge then and it could have been say 70% or something and the second charge was un-needed.Iâ€™d say I am â€œimpressedâ€ by the battery life being good.------------------------------Pros/Con (??) â€“ This may be my least favorite sounding earbud I have but â€¦ from what I remember of the Earfun Free Miniâ€™s â€¦ they do sound better than they did â€¦ and I love TOZO but I can not compare these with the TOZO A1â€™s which I donâ€™t have â€¦. say comparing these to the TOZO T6â€™s seems sort of unfair as the A1â€™s (TOZO brand wise) are more of the equivalent to the Go Air Pops. They could sound the same for all I know.I do notice a difference using the built in EQâ€™s (note too that no matter the headphone or earbud I tend to have an EQ setting or app with a â€œUâ€ to a â€œVâ€ setting applied) â€¦ but not much â€¦ I do agree that the Bass Boost mode CAN muddy things up at times â€¦ the Flat EQ setting â€¦. makes it a lot flatter sounding (no matter what I listened to) than I was expecting â€¦ I mean FLAT sounding â€¦ NOT â€œneutralâ€ like Iâ€™d describe the TOZO T6â€™s for example.The best setting between the three is Jlabâ€™s Signature sound which boosts the Bass and the Treble in a V like sound signature. Like the Fiil T1XSâ€™s many EQ options and customization, for instance are nice to have, in my view â€¦ the default sort of â€œVâ€ signature THEY offer is also the best THEY sound. If I am not mistaken .. the â€œJlab signatureâ€ sound EQ setting IS the default and it does sound the best, like I said.After a few days and a â€œside-by-sideâ€ comparison to the TOZO T6â€™s I have (some of the others are in a higher price bracket â€¦ I am trying to be fair here) the T6â€™s do sound â€œsharperâ€ and â€œcrisperâ€ â€¦. sort of hard to describe if you donâ€™t get what I am saying â€¦ however, forgetting these I got â€œused-Like newâ€ for $12.50 â€¦ Iâ€™d sort of say they are worth $19.99 (typical price) â€¦ but Iâ€™d HONESTLY spend a tad more for the T6â€™s â€¦.if someone did ask me about these â€œgo air popsâ€ ...â€yes or no, at 19.99?â€¦ no commentaryâ€ â€¦ Iâ€™d say yes â€¦ if you note the conâ€™s (below)----------------------------------------------------------------Cons- The built in charging cable. - I do have to admit I KNEW about this before hand and this was not a surprise â€¦..A) the length â€¦ I mean many earbudâ€™s cable that comes included IS short, but this seems extra short. I may pickup usb â€œextension cableâ€ to use with these buds which ACTUALLY may solve the other issue â€¦. anyway I just do not like how short this is, where depending on how you are ABLE to charge this, the case has to be dangling somewhere with all the weight of the buds and the case on the built in cable. To keep it as a built in cable I know they HAVE TO make it small or double/triple the size of the case itself â€¦ that makes sense to me â€¦ but Iâ€™d just rather have a say separate USB-C port + cable for instanceB) I didnâ€™t even think of this at first but with the prior Jlab model that didnâ€™t have a top on the case (not sure whoâ€™d like that design idea) â€¦ but the built in charging cable the way Jlab has it, has the bottom (even when itâ€™s tucked into the case) pins exposedâ€¦ .this seems like a really bad idea for dust/dirt/etc to me but for the record I have only just gotten these and NOT had issues with this yet â€¦ just something that seems like an oversight or something.- Max Volume - this may or may not always be an issue but especially if you have audio that is not normalized (the default level of the source audio is too low vs what it should be) ... the max volume of these earbuds may not help.I never truly paid attention to reviews saying how loud certain buds are, but I do notice that compared to some earbuds, the MAX volume of these or even "on tick down" from max is what i have it on a bit (note: sometimes i do have a black Honeywell fan on next to me) .... when some other buds ... say oh 70% to max (guessing, but it's close) is good for me volume wise. Again this is not always an issue with good source audio or if your not in a loud/noisy place-----------------------------------------Summary (again based on first impressions)I think if you count lightning deals there may be better options when others go on good sales, but these arenâ€™t bad. I can â€œdeal withâ€ the sound not being the greatest, but that charging cable A) being so short and B) the pins being completely exposed I do not like and maybe a deal breaker for some.I canâ€™t say I 100% recommend (I mean counting deals there are better options out there .. even for a LITTLE BIT more in price)â€¦ nor can I say I donâ€™t recommend (even with issues like I said) â€¦ they arenâ€™t bad â€¦ as a backup pair or if you are just curious about theses â€¦ Iâ€™d say go ahead and give them a shot.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Big ticket sound, low ticket price
author: Nicole Washington-Pare
content: These are some of the best ear buds I've owned and we're super affordable. The sound quality is amazing, the case is compact so it fits in my pocket or purse easily, and the charging cord is built right in so it's super simple to charge. I also love the bright pink color!

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars For $25 they're pretty decent, but there could be room for improvement.
author: Nightweeb92
content: I've mostly ever bought Skullcandy headphones as they were generally my "go to", I went through about four of their sets before getting fed up with their odd spec listings at certain prices and annoying customer service and warranty.I needed something decent but cheap. The go air pop ended up being a popular choice so I picked them up. Generally I mainly use them for commutes and mowing the lawn (my ears start ringing after long periods of time with a lawnmower so I listen to music to avoid it).The price is great, getting these on sale is even better. They're super light weight and the fit is perfect and they stay in my ears pretty well if I'm not doing extenuous activities that make me sweat, otherwise I'm often pushing them back in, but I do sometimes have a small hassle getting them out of my ears and sometimes the case itself too. They fit in my ear a little too well that I sometimes have to get a good pinch grip to get them put, sometimes it feels like I'm not even wearing them.The build is about as expected, made with a higher grade plastic, they don't particularly feel expensive but they don't feel like dollar store cheap either, they look pretty decent ..though for the case I do wish there were a few changes. For one being the USB cable, instead of having a proprietary cable, they should just have a USB-C charging port instead. Additionally, it would've been nice to get maybe another 1 or 2 LED battery indicators in the front instead of the single one to let users know how much battery life is left in the case.On the inside they should add a recessed section to make it easier to pull the buds out of the case, I sometimes don't have good grip and the buds feel slippery, so I feel like I need to twist the buds to get them out. As for the flip top, they could make the recessed lip a little deeper, the case itself is decent but it's a little too slim that you sometimes fumble with keeping It open to get the buds out, it's sometimes just as slippery as the buds.The touch controls are pretty straight forward and easy to get used to.Sound is good ..if you're mostly into bass heavy stuff, they have a bit of clarity and some detail, but they're not something an audiophile would approve, they're just good general consumer quality. The original go air pop don't have an app so the only customizing users are limited to are the three built-in EQ settings, jlab signature/balance and bass boost.The Jlab signature sound is balanced with a slight bump in bass and treble, they're recommended as a universal sound that sounds good with just about anything. But to me it lacks clarity as some frequencies sometimes tend to mask or overpower other frequencies causing a loss in details.Balanced, is basically a flat meant for things like listening to audiobooks and podcasts, there's more focus and emphasis on boosting vocals while everything else remains relatively flat.Bass boost, is more for people who want more bass ..on top of what already feels like a more than enough bass sound from the Jlab signature sound. It's more meant for working out, but it does have a tendency to overpower the mids and highs most of the time and is the least detailed.Overall sound is good, stick with the Jlab signature sound and that's all you should really need. What the regular go air pop lacks is an EQ to help bring in more details. The Go pop+ is the same model but with a USB-C cable attached and allows connection to the Jlab app for custom EQ.One small gripe I have in color is that they don't have a mint color available for this set (or maybe not yet).And my other small gripe is this only support SBC audio encoding and not AAC which is a step up in audio quality. Yes that means the Go pop+ too only supports SBC. At this price I can't expect this to have something like LDAC support, but the inclusion of AAC would've been nice.Despite my gripes and nit-picks, for the price these are pretty decent and I'd recommend them if you're looking for something decent but cheap, I personally recommend going with the updated Go pop+ as they're the same as the go air pop but with app support and USB-C.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars ðŸ˜I'm obsessedðŸ˜
author: Amethyst
content: TikTok did it again I finally caved and honestly these are the best 20 bucks I've spent. I'm super picky with ear buds and I mean very hard to please me on ear buds if there's one thing I like it's my music. These sound extremely clear. The base is on point. And the earbuds have it's own app to control your ear buds byðŸ˜­it even has it's own equalizer in the dam appðŸ˜ðŸ˜­. title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good little ear buds
author: Minnie The Moo
content: These are nice little ear buds. Very easy to use and setup, the sound quality is decent. Iâ€™m not terrified about losing them like I was with the more expensive ones. They fit snugly (but not too tight) and I havenâ€™t had any issues with them falling out. The only reason that I didnâ€™t give them 5 stars is because I find them to be a bit difficult to remove from the case. I also donâ€™t love how you charge them. It would be easier for me if you could just plug a cord into the case as opposed to plugging the case directly into the c block as the plug in attached to the case is stiff and difficult to pull out from the case. These are the only issues that I have with these ear buds. In all fairness I also have neuropathy in my hands so this is probably a specific issue for me personally.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars im in loveeeee <3
author: DaSchale B.
content: iâ€™ve been in the market for some quality earbuds and i saw someone do a positive review of these online, so i ordered a pair of these. so imagine my surprise when i got them, and they literally did not have the earbuds in them (lmaooo)i found the jlab support number on amazon and was able to call them, and get the situation rectified within 20 minutes . they were really quick and concise with everything, and they ended up sending me a completely new unit !theyâ€™re really cute, and the sound quality is SO GOOD. i listen to a lot of rock and heavy bass music and everything is crystal clear and no weird buzzing from the bass !! there is the tiniest bit of sound that bleeds through them, but i donâ€™t mind that .for the price point and the quality you get, you canâ€™t really beat that !

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good Enough
author: Catherine Green
content: I'm not good at discerning audio quality, but these earbuds are ever so slightly worse quality than my expensive headphones. But like for the price, that's to be expected. They're good enough for when I don't want to use the bulky headphones.They also don't have a great range. They'll be fine if I walk across the room, but if I start going behind objects or down a hallway, the sound will start to skip a bit. But again, they're fine enough for the price. If you use them with your phone and carry it with you, they'll be fine.I saw someone else say these made their ears itch. Mine itch a bit while using these too, but my ears are sensitive. I only use 1 earbud at a time anyway, so I just switch them out for the other ear when it starts to get itchy after an hour or two. I think that might just be earbuds in general that do that, but I like that I can easily switch them out.I really like that they automatically connect when you remove them from the case, you don't have to turn them on. If they don't detect any paired devices, they automatically enter pairing mode which makes them super easy to use.The magnets in the case are strong and it's a bit hard to take the earbuds out sometimes.For the price, these are great. I hope they last me awhile.Edit: After 2 months, I still like these earbuds. I rarely have to charge them. Occasionally while using them with my TV, the audio starts getting choppy. Putting the earbuds back into the case to disconnect them, then taking them out so they automatically reconnect again seems to fix the problem. Again for the price I think they're adequate for me.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Durable!
author: Kim Bueche
content: OMG! Not only do these things work amazingly but they are super durable! My husband, halfway through a load of laundry started freaking out because he could hear the tink tink noise of his earbuds that were left in his pocket in the washing machine. I stopped the machine and drained the water enough to pulled them out from the bottom of the machine as they are literally completely submerged in water. Took a paper towel wiped them off and they hooked back up and have been working for the past few months just fine! Definitely would recommend for any buddy who is either forgetful or any men that work in construction that need Bluetooth earbuds to make phone calls or listen to music while theyâ€™re driving machinery.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars So happy!
author: Kathryn Ashley Childs
content: I was so skeptical about buying these because of the price. Being an Apple and tech snob I thought there is no way these could be great like all the reviews said. My AirPods quit working after a few years and at the time I wasnâ€™t wanting to shell out hundred or more dollars for new ones. I ordered these to wear around the apartment while I clean and when I exercise at the gym. I got them in the mail very fast. When they came I fell in love with the lavender color so much Iâ€™ve tried to make it my new signature color for everything lol They are beautiful not only in color but also design. I was being kinda bummed about it having an attached USB cord but once I started using them it has become one of my favorite things about them. When I turned them on and added them to my iPhone fairly quickly and they continue to connect without any issues. Super easy. They fit amazing and come with different size ear pieces. The sound quality for the price that I paid is outstanding. They arenâ€™t completely as loud as probably more expensive brands but I can definitely afford new AirPods Proâ€™s but I have remained more than happy with these and they have lasted me for longer than I thought and saved so much money. Love them!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great earbuds for the price.
author: David
content: I've bought like 5 of these already. Not because they broke or got lost or anything like that. I've got one stashed in my car, my backpack, two of my jackets and one for my PC. They got good sound, but if you're an audiophile you might wanna look elsewhere. I usually use one earbud when walking around or doing chores, so that lasts for a few hours. If I feel like that battery is gonna die, I switch earbuds. I never have to worry about battery life. If anyone is wondering what the difference is between the Black and Midnight colors are. They are basically the same. Midnight is like 5% lighter than black. You won't notice till you put them side by side. The transparent case one is just the coolest thing ever.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Too large for smaller ears
author: LoPas
content: I read reviews saying these were good for small ears but I have not had the same experience. I cannot get these to comfortably fit and stay snug in my ears despite trying all the pad options. I currently use airpods but those often pop out when I smile so I was looking for something more snug.I love the color and sleekness of the case but they leave a lot to be desired. Sound quality it OK. I am used to airpods stopping whatever is playing when removed from your ear. These don't do that so every time you remove it to have a conversation or it falls out, your audio keeps playing. Also, if you need to adjust the buds in your ear, you will likely hit the track forward or back button.They are certainly more affordable than many options but I will keep looking for something with a better fit.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars 5V 1A Charging
author: Kindle Customer
content: Overall I like the product.I started using then when I found a pair in my stuff after movingThe sound quality is better than I would expect for less than $30, so I bought a new pair when one of my earbuds slipped out and fell beyond my reach.The battery life is phenomenal, because I just used it for the past couple of weeks without actually charging it.I plugged it in every night to my USB-C wall block, not realizing that the case is limited to a 5V 1A connection. It's in the documentation, it's my fault for not reading closer, but the case will not charge if you plug it in to fast charger.In my defense your older case that used USB-A was compatible with 5V 2A chargers.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars The first set of EarPods that cost less than 100 bucks and sound worthy
author: Kaila
content: I absolutely love the sound quality of these AirPods and the ease of use. I love the fact that the case has a built-in charger, so Iâ€™m not having to attach one more thing, I can just plug and go. The best part is that the case holds such a great charge that I really donâ€™t have to plug it in often. Same with the AirPods in itself, they hold a really great charge quality and fit perfectly in my ear. I use Them daily when I go for walks in the gym or in my car on the road. I definitely recommend these.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good for the Price
author: April M.
content: I lost one earbud of the same brand while doing yard work. I saw these that were the same brand and smaller in size, which I needed for my smaller ears. Sound quality is great. Pairing to my phones and speaker is easy. I love the new flip top lid! The only issue it that they seem to lose connection when in use. The music will cut out in one ear or both at random times. And sometimes not at all even though my phone/speaker is in arms reach. The range distance is not as far as my last pair, but for the price, not bad. Also, I got the lilac color so it is easier to see in the grass when dropped!

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great value for the price point
author: Jim
content: I bought these when I couldn't find my airpods.Pros: Good fit. Great sound. Great bang for the buck. Great battery life.Cons: if you have short fingernails, they are a struggle to get out of the case. They have a tendency to drop connection with each other and you have to delete them from Bluetooth, tap each 7 times quickly, then reconnect. No USB port. Just a 2" cable built into the case which is annoying if you have your charging brick plugged in somewhere not easily accessible. I usually get long cables from an outlet behind my bed.Overall, despite the little quirks, they have better sound than my airpods. For the price and sound quality, would buy again.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly good!
author: SJT

The battery life has been amazing and they were super easy to set up and figure out controls. The noise cancelling works pretty well, but I will say I haven't used it in that busy of places. Sound quality is also really good for the price. I would highly recommend if you need earbuds and don't care for the price of airpods or other similar things.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome Earbuds - Fast delivery

The fit is good and there are additional ear piece adapters included in the order. All-in-all I am very satisfied with this purchase - the price was good, the quality is very good, ease of use is great, and delivery was fast. No complaints at all.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic sound and I love the color

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Love these!

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Small for fat or normal fingers

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good sound, easy charge

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Wish I could get to actually review these earbuds
author: MrTAD
content: I was excited to own my first pair of wireless earbuds, and as soon as they arrived I charged them up! Next step was to get them out of the case and try them out. That was a bit more difficult then I expectedâ€¦had a tough time getting them out of the case. The buds kept slipping out of my fingers. Didnâ€™t expect that, but eventually got them out. Oh, kudos for the built in usb plug on the case although some people may not appreciate the â€œoldâ€ usb a plug. I didnâ€™t care, so I was happy to just plug the unit into a charger.Now to actually test the buds out. Simple connect to Bluetooth, fired up a music streaming app andâ€¦.then spent a half hour trying to fit the buds in my ear! Eventually had to switch the ear pads to a smaller size, and was ready to go!Listened to a few tunesâ€¦sounded ok, but a bit â€œthinâ€ and a little bright. But I had the next day to really give the buds a listen! Turns out, bad decision. Next morning I started to listen in earnest, various genres of music, at different volume levels. Everything was going great until I got the bright idea of testing out the buds while mowing my lawn! Yeah, bad, really bad moves. Lost one of the earbuds somewhere in my back yard! Spent hours crawling all over the yard with my cellphone trying to â€œconnectâ€ Bluetooth to the missing earbud! Itâ€™s gone, now days later the battery in the earbud has surely died, to be found nevermore!Hence the 3 stars for initially sounding ok but being a pain to fit them in my ear! Oh and I also learned listening to one earbud is no fun!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Still works after a month in the yard

content: I dropped my earbuds in their case in my parent's yard about a month ago. Today I was helping my mom with some yardwork and I happen to look down and noticed a different color of green. It was my earbuds! My dad had just mowed right over the top missing them by millimeters.I opened the case to finde the earbuds were dry and in perfect condition even after multiple storms and an EF1 tornado last week (Kansas is fun). I paired them with my phone and they still have a full charge!These earbuds are truly amazing. I don't know if the case with charge again, but since losing them I already replaced them so I can always have set in the case charging and one in my ears.More than I'd expect for the price!

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars works as expected

Saw the review on there and decided to give them a look. After reading the reviews, make the choice to go with them.They work as expected, nice clear sound, charges quickly and easy on the ears.
