title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Work well.
author: Ivan Perez
content: These headphones work really well. Iâ€™m going to compare the to the 1st Gen AirPods as thatâ€™s what I have to show what I like and donâ€™t like.First off, you need to download the app to pair to your device. Annoying but whatever. After you make the settings to your liking you donâ€™t have to use it again, the headphones just pair.What I like about them is that each side has a button that has its own dedicated functions depending on how many times or how long you press it. And you feel the click feedback. You can adjust the volume which you cannot do with the AirPods I have.The headphones also have very nice Noise Canceling in them. You can set it for sound to Passthrough but even then itâ€™s low and muffled compared to the AirPods. I use my headphones at work and because I drive for a living I so NOT like the noise canceling since I need to hear around me driving in busy NYC. Even with the sound passthrough itâ€™s not enough. I have to take them out. Thatâ€™s most likely because of the silicon tips that the regular AirPods donâ€™t have.Speaking of, Iâ€™m not a fan of the tips. But thatâ€™s just a personal presence. Thatâ€™s one thing I love about the AirPods. They donâ€™t have tips, and they are comfy and do not fall out most importantly.One thing about the AirPods is the mics LOVE to just stop working. Iâ€™ll be outside with them in and still holding the phone to my face because the caller canâ€™t hear me. Mad annoying with no clear solution for it. Iâ€™ve tried them all it doesnâ€™t work. They work when they damn well please. I didnâ€™t have this issue with this set. tThey worked every time. Granted not enough time has passed to see if they stop functioning like the AirPod ones but so far so good. You can hear clearly and you can be heard clearly.They work like any other BT headphones. The case charges them. You charge the case with a USB-C cable. I donâ€™t think it has wireless charging but thatâ€™s fine. The battery life Iâ€™m not even sure what it is. I was never concerned for it. Or had them die. To be fair I donâ€™t leave em in as long as AirPods because as I stated earlier I need to hear and I feel like they impede that for me so I remove them.I do recommend these for people who use public transportation which is why I gave them to my fiancÃ©. The noise canceling works great. If you donâ€™t need to listen to your surroundings, I recommend these headphones.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for the price
author: DocBrown
content: Iâ€™ve been reluctant to go wireless, mostly because of sound quality issues of Bluetooth. But I really like the idea of being free from wires while at work, I already have phone/meeting headsets that are Bluetooth and love them. These went on sale Cyber Monday for a good price so I thought Iâ€™d try them.I found them a little bit of a pain to setup. The â€œQuick setup guideâ€ was lacking information. Once I downloaded the full manual I figured out what I was missing and then got them setup and working with my phone. Sound is very clear and bass is excellent and not muddy. It does take a little tweaking of the EQ in the Smart Control app. Noise cancellation is very good considering its passive. These are generally comfortable but can cause a little fatigue if in for long periods. Iâ€™m in and out of meetings everyday so generally this is not a problem for me. I have found that I cannot position them the same in each ear. Everyoneâ€™s ears are different but unfortunately the only way to know is to try them. Battery life is good, though I stick them in the case when I leave my desk and the charge tops off on its own. Being Bluetooth, they do drain my phone a lot more than wired buds. I canâ€™t comment on failed bub issues yet, itâ€™s too early, so weâ€™ll see.I didnâ€™t intend for these to be used with phone calls but ended up taking a few calls while wearing them. I was surprised at how good the voice sounded. Warm and no distortion. The person I was talking to said it was pretty good. She had no trouble hearing me.A few complaints in the reviews I noticed of which have fairly simple solutions.1) Lack of bass. Make sure you are using the correct size ear adaptor and that it is snug in your ear. This is critical. They have the medium on out of the box. They seemed fine, but after a couple of days I took a chance and tried the large. Wow, dramatically better. I also found you have to wiggle it just a little to get the maximum effect. Also download the Smart Control app to get a bit more bass from the EQ. I suggest trying the Sound Check component of the app.2) For the units that are prematurely dying, I wonder if the contacts are dirty. The full manual specifies they do need to be cleaned from time to time. Also, they do have a 2 year warranty but you have to contact a Sennheiser partner.EDIT: I mentioned above that I got a little fatigued with them in for a while. After pulling out a couple of hunks of ear wax with the right ear bud, I decided to try some ear wax remover. Not only do the bud fit better, they are more comfortable. Something to think about if you are experiencing discomfort.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great sound at a good price
author: Ben W.
content: I recently lost my AirPods on a trip and was looking for something to replace them. I didnâ€™t want to pay what they wanted for the AirPod pros and I wasnâ€™t really impressed with the sound quality of the AirPods, so I went looking for the best sounding sub 130$ wireless earbuds I could find. I settled on the CXs and received them today. Iâ€™ll get to the sound quality at the end but first let me go over some other aspects. The set up was extremely simple, there are clear directions, I just pulled them out of the box removed the very obvious and labeled plastic covers on the battery contacts and then charged the earbuds for about an hour. Once they were charged they paired with my iPhone no problem I also downloaded the app which worked without issue. The fit is slightly less comfortable then the AirPods however they are not uncomfortable and feel quite secure. These buds lack ANC however I donâ€™t think that will be an issue as they are very effective at blocking outside noise. The touch controls are intuitive and work smoothly. So far I have used them both together and one at a time and have taken them in and out of the case and have no issue with connectivity, you do have to reconnect to the app if you disconnect from Bluetooth however the app does have to be running for the earbuds to work, only if you want to run the equalizer also reconnecting to the app is very simple. The only â€œissueâ€ I have had so far is when I updated the firmware; everything went fine however be prepared to have your phone and earbuds tied up for about 40 minutes while the firmware updates; during this process the app needs to stay open and the earbuds need to be close to the phone. Itâ€™s a little nerve racking because I was worried if for some reason the update was interrupted it could brick the earbuds, that being said it went fine just took a long time(the app does give a fairly accurate countdown so that helps a little). So how do they sound? There is no doubt these are the best sounding pair of earbuds I have personally heard in my life. Iâ€™ve owned the AirPods, the Jabra 65t, first generation beats, and a couple different Chinese pairs; none of those are even in the same category. These where the first earbuds Iâ€™ve had that do not sound like music is just being pumped into my ear canals; the music sounds like itâ€™s naturally coming from the surroundings. Every instrument and vocal track are clear and separate. The bass and treble sound great and balanced and if you really like pronounced bass you can turn it up in the equalizer and it thumps. Itâ€™s really hard for me to overstate how awesome the sound is, I listened to a few songs that are now in lossless Dolby atmos on Apple Music and itâ€™s nothing short of incredible. The best metaphor I can think of is all of my old earbuds were like Standard definition and these are 4K. So if your looking for the best sound for your money and probably the best sound for under 200$ these are the way to go.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Solid choice for ear buds
author: Crotorious
content: I've used these ear buds for almost 2 years and strongly considered re-buying them once I started facing issues. When it comes to sound quality, they're good, and the latency is small, but you'll notice it's there. The best part of these ear buds has to be the battery life; these things last all day, and can be fully charged back up twice with the case. Though if you're looking for something with strong noise cancellation, you might want to consider looking for a different pair of ear buds, as these are really only capable of blocking out most speech. Overall, they're a pretty good pair of ear buds, but I do have a few problems with them.First, when they get to low battery, the text to speech voice will say "Recharge headset" just frequently enough to become mildly vexing. This is my primary complaint about these ear buds.Now mind you, I haven't treated these ear buds very well, they went through constant abuse and were used in sub-optimal environments the entire time I've owned them. The next two complaints are likely a result of my poor treatment of these.Second, after about two years of use, their connectivity isn't as great anymore; the range in which I can use these has dropped considerably. I used to be able to walk in my backyard without issues, but now I can barely leave the room without the connection dropping constantly.Lastly, the left earbud has recently developed a problem with connecting to the case; it seems the leads just don't connect half the time. This occasionally causes small inconveniences with the left ear bud turning on in the case and randomly hijacking the audio output of my pc, or it just doesn't end up charging and I'm stuck with a single ear bud until I manage to get it to charge again.Overall, this is a pretty good product. I'd recommend it to anyone who needs a pair of long-lasting wireless earbuds and doesn't need the best sound quality or noise cancellation.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Only really lasted 8 months
author: Jake Boop
content: Edit: originally rated 1 star as the earbuds that I received were open-box/used. I donâ€™t think itâ€™s fair to Sennheiser that my 1 star rating remains on here because that was a fault of Amazon. These earbuds sound great. Absolutely great. The connection seems to be good so far as well (Iâ€™ve seen a lot of negative reviews saying otherwise). They are very comfortable for my ears, Iâ€™m a Tool Maker/machinist and wear an earbud in one ear I all day and other earbuds that Iâ€™ve tried get uncomfortable or start to fall out but I have had no issues with fit at all. As far as the features on the app: the equalization is only a 3-band eq which is a shame, Iâ€™d much rather at least a 5 or 7-band eq but itâ€™s better than nothing for sure. The side tone feature is supposed to use the mic to feed into the speaker, allowing you to hear outside talking, but it doesnâ€™t seem to really work at all. I havenâ€™t tested a phone call using them yet so maybe my mic is defective but I really wouldnâ€™t care because I donâ€™t need it. Overall this is a great pair of earbuds for the price.Original review: This item came in with the packaging already opened with another piece of tape over the original seal. The earbuds were covered in earwax and ear hair. Disgusting. If I wanted to buy an â€œopen box/usedâ€ I wouldâ€™ve selected that option instead of paying full price for it.Edit 3/14/2023: it's been 8 months and the connectivity issues have been becoming a decent problem. I take them out of the case and they won't connect, so I put them back it and take them out again and usually they'll connect after the second try. But lately I've been having to re-pair them to my phone. I'll take them out of the case and instead of the usual "power on..... connected" notification, it's just silence. And it's not as simple as just re-pairing them because they won't go into pairing mode unless I reset them. The battery life is also taking a dive.I started out really loving these, now I've been very disappointed because they're just such a hassle to deal with. With all of this, especially only being 8 months of use, I'm going to have to update my review from 5 stars to 2.Edit 7/17/2023: the right earbud just stopped working all together, it'll power on but refuses to connect to BluetoothEdit 1/24/2024: I've been trying to get as much use out of these just to justify the amount I spent on them before I replace them but all it has really given me is issues with connectivity and reliability. I expect any earbuds at this price range to last years, I should have no problem getting the same life out of earbuds that you would expect from a phone. I wish I would've just either returned them or thrown them away a long time ago. I'm going to start looking into replacements now. Adjusting my 2 star rating to a 1 star.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Comparison with Momentum TW
author: Steve Kranyec
content: I have a pair of CX's that are about 1.5 years old, and another set that I just recently purchased. In the middle, I have a pair of Momentum TW 3's that are ~6 months old. The TLDR here is that instead of repurchasing the Momentum, I got another pair of the CX's.I'm not an audiophile, and I mostly listen to audiobooks and make calls with earbuds, so I'm not going to be speaking to audio quality at all. For me, it's fine.My six month old Momentum's have a dead left earbud. Possibly this is anecdotal, but if anything I was more gentle with the Momentum's than the CX's, and the CX's have lasted three times as long. Yes, I drop them. Yes, the dead left Momentum died after the most recent drop. I'm not saying that earbuds should survive infinite drops, but in my experience, the CX's are more durable.I did really really like the ANC on the Momentum's. It killed the battery life, but when you need ANC, it was great to have. The pass-through audio was also awesome. It was almost like having a mini-hearing-aide.The CX's have been substantially less finicky than the Momentum. They connect quicker, I've had to reset them fewer times, and they seem to have better range.Between the (substantial) difference in price and the areas where the CX's are superior, I my opinion, the CX's are the better option. If dropping $150 every six months on earbuds is within your budget, I fully endorse the Momentums. For me, I need to have two working sets around at any given time as I wear them a substantial amount of my waking hours, so I'd rather swap to an overear model when I need ANC and go with the cheaper and more durable option.Quick recommendation -- splurge on the foam eartips. If you're like me and wear earbuds an unhealthy amount of time, they're substantially more comfortable. They do wear out, and they're not cheap, but the added comfort for long-wears is huge.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good sound, Horrible mic for calls
author: billyillyilly
content: The good, these ear buds have a decent battery life, sit well in the ear without falling out (held with just the rubber insert), have good (not great) sound quality. A perfect example of the sound is with FFDP "A little bit off" which has extremely clean sound on a quality system. These ear buds lack the clean treble when the high hat hits and the deep tones of the bass. If you just want sound without worrying being an audiophile they're good.The bad, no noise cancelling... at all! During phone calls the mic is good in a quiet place. if there is ANY background noise, they will pick up that noise over your voice. I tried them multiple times in different cars and no matter the amount of road noise it drowned out my voice making conversations almost impossible unless I yelled. In an office environment the sound of the keyboard while typing would make conversation hard to understand for whoever was sorry enough to be on the other end of the call.I've been a Sennheiser fan for a long time and have had many of their headphones (still use some old wired buds CX100II for listening to music at work and love them), these are the first that I am returning due to be unusable for conversation.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 2.0 out of 5 stars Not quite what I expected
author: Michal D. Wisteria
content: So I'll start with the positive. The headphones are comfortable, the sound is great, and the battery life is pretty good too (supposed to be 9.5 hours, I got around 7). The bass felt great, skipping songs was a breeze, and the sound quality when answering calls on them was decent as well.The less great parts. After 6 1/2 hours or so, one headphone would die, usually the left one. Then the right would reconnect, and I could keep listening to things for a bit longer. But the biggest reason for the 2 star review is that my right earbud broke after about 11 months. I took good care of these headphones; they were usually in their case or in my ear. Last week I noticed the right earbud had no sound. I thought I just had to restart them and reconnect, but after a few tries of that I heard just hints of sound for half a second when moving the earbud in the ear, so I knew the audio wasn't working. But all the other features were. I could still pause, skip songs, etc with the right or left earbud. I went on my order page on Amazon and found the support section. There was a link to a product support site for Sannheiser... It was 404, page not found. There was a phone number too.... It was disconnected apparently. So now I have just a left side, good-sounding earbud.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars no complaints
author: Kindle Customer
content: Use them everyday for 6 weeks. Sounds great. Does not fall out while running.
product_attributes: Color: WhiteSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Warranty service is excellent!
author: YourBuddyRob
content: I bought these for the bass sound, and they delivered. What prompted me to write this review was the excellent customer service I received when I had an issue with one of the earbuds a year and a half after buying them!
product_attributes: Color: WhiteSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great sound, good physical construction outside. Elsewhere, not so much
author: Ben
content: I've owned a few pairs of earbuds, all wired. I prefer over-ear headphones, but needed something small, portable and more discreet for work.These looked decent and my past experiences with Sennheiser sound quality also helped make my decision at the time.Sound quality is excellent, overall noise isolation is pretty good for no ANC, bass mids and highs are all present and clear. I do own several pairs of studio/reference headphones, which these obviously don't compare to, but they do manage to make a good account of themselves. Battery lifespan is excellent too and despite no wireless charging (not that it was a deal breaker in my case) the case charged very quickly. Just would have been nice if the charging cable was longer than the dinky one supplied.I used the smallest set of ear cushions, these are decently comfortable for up to a couple hours but do start to press against my ears for longer periods.Construction quality of the case and buds is decent, not too heavy but not feather light either. It's a shame that doesn't go into the internal electronics.First off, the Bluetooth connectivity is not a win. These would repeatedly disconnect themselves when bringing them out of "sleep" always one or the other bud. The Sennheiser Smart Control App does allow customization of the buds controls and a graphic equalizer. But it would keep proclaiming it needed a update, even though it was the most up-to-date version.Now these, when they paired, sounded great. After using these for nearly a year, the right bud suddenly had an internal fault and produced flakey, weak sound. That was not a Bluetooth issue, but rather the hardware either failing on a circuit level or a wire becoming loose due to a cold solder joint. I've owned plenty of headphones that are more cheaply made than these with worse sound quality but still function as intended.Looking up this problem seems to be inherit with the CX True Wireless, with complaints occuring anywhere from a few months of ownership to nearly a year or more. Replacements from Sennheiser have been described as having a repeat issue after a similar period of time, or are merely DOA.Shame, this isn't the Sennheiser I knew. Time for a different pair from a different manufacturer. Why bother going through the hassle of dealing with Sennheiser support only to get the same problem again eventually?
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good BT earbuds
author: Photographer
content: I generally prefer over the ear headphones, but I use earbuds only when I am exercising or doing yardwork. I bought a pair of name brand earbuds that was on sale during BF. Long story short, I had to return it because the sound quality was unacceptable.Rather than trying to find a diamond in haystack so to speak, I picked Sennheiser as it is a brand that I have good experience with. Furthermore, I opted for a higher price point than the rock bottom price I was hoping for.I forgo noise cancelling since I don't need it most of the time. Sonically, this pair of earbuds is very good, bearing typical Sennheiser sound of open and balance. It is still no match for my over the ear headphones, but it is also significantly cheaper. Sound quality is by far the most important aspect, other features are distant seconds and thirds.BT connectivity is, however, not Sennheiser's strength. It took some work to get it connected to all of my devices; I have a pair of Sennheiser over the ear BT headphone that behaves similarly. All of my cheaper BT earbuds have no BT connectivity issues. This weakness is not a showstopper.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Sennheiser knows headphones
author: Baron
content: I had some Klipsch ear pods I had to return. Sure they had the metal case and metallic earbuds and all those sizes earbud tips but internal quality was bad a constant buzzing sound from a bad chip so I ordered a second pair still bad so returned both of them. I started think what headphones do I she that just simply worked no gimmicks no flash just pure bonafide Hi-Fi then j realized Sennheiser of course. When I bought these they had just come out no Amazon reviews but I took the chance cause I love my HD-25s and I havenâ€™t looked back. Iâ€™m an engineer a job that requires focus by my office is smack dab in the middle of a factory floor full of loud noise forklifts , bulldozers firing up for test, people grinding metal , all of that on top of the normal office chatter and these headphones cut right through that while I work at my desk and get work done.Now yes these are 100% plastic but they donâ€™t feel cheap and that plastic also means they donâ€™t feel cold touching your skinYes they use standard ear bud tips which I was apprehensive about cause Iâ€™ve had issue with those falling off or coming off in my ear but these are designed with an aggressive ridge to keep the tips attached to the headphone.No wireless charging but who cares itâ€™s USB-C just plug it in at night and go about your day they last all my work dayAnd the sound is probably as good as it gets from reasonably priced Bluetooth earbuds so yeah no bass boomy but thatâ€™s inherent in the form factor bass requires big drivers and lots of power which kills your battery life and adds weight.Could you get better sound sure but why itâ€™s Bluetooth off your phone into tiny battery powered earbuds so your quality is limited already so this is probably that sweet spot where diminishing marginal returns kicks in where you have to spend way more money or buy big Bluetooth headphones to get better soundIf you buy these as earbuds for work or travel where portability and battery life trumps fidelity then youâ€™ll love these if you expect fidelity similar to much pricier wired headphones youâ€™ll be disappointed but only because your expectations were unrealistic.0
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Comprehensive rating: Sennheiser puts sound first (as usual)
author: Scott Herron
content: After years of using cheap-o headphones and dealing with cable noise, listening to music with the headphones feels like i'm hearing each song for the very first time. I'm hearing details in songs I never heard before, it honestly made me tear up. Incredibly clarity, customizable EQ, AMAZING sound for 100$. You could easily get something with comparable sound that costs twice as much. The sound is why I bought these. Sennheiser is a sound-focused brand. However, there are some places where these headphones cut corners that would not be a problem if you bought 200$+ dollar headphones.Security: I'm a dancer, and I want my headphones to stay on while I'm working in the studio. However, the earbuds aren't the most secure in my ears. They fly out during chainÃ©e turns, sometimes even just as I'm walking they'll fall out.Comfort: Not the most comfortable for hours of listening. After 2-3 hours of extended use, my ears ached. Changing up the plastic tips didn't help.Noise cancelling: I heard the ANC takes the edge off the sound quality, which is why I bought these and not the active noise cancelling ones. You can definitely tell. I can hear each step I take as I walk thudding in my ears. It's a little odd.Delay: I've tried to use these to watch tiktoks on my phone, and I've noticed a delay in the screen and the sound. I can see the person on my screen moving their mouth, but the words come out into my headphones a little later. It's not the worst, but it's noticeable.Overall: Great for audiophiles on a budget. The app allows you to customize, so there's something to love for everyone, whether you love a sparkling, bright treble or you're a total basshead. For sitting down and listening while you're at your computer, these are an excellent choice. If you're mainly wearing these for working out, maybe something else would suit your needs better. I do equal parts both, which is why I like these a lot. mp3 files can massacre the music quality, and bad headphones can make the sound even muddier. These are an excellent buy. I've had them for about a month, will update if something changes or I have issues.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great sound quality, hounded by connectivity/app issues
author: Eric Notmyrealname
content: Great sound quality, hounded by electronics/connectivity issuesIâ€™d give this 3.5 stars if I could. Having owned multiple headphones/earphones over the years this is product is in-line with Sennheiser â€“ great sound quality for the price (they lowered it), but you pay with electronics/wiring issues. This maybe the last Sennheiser product I get for a while, but not in a good wayâ€¦Goal: Portable â€œdo everythingâ€ earphones with good sound quality. I wanted to be able use them around the home: smartphone music, binging Netflix, work computer for Zoom calls, etc. Iâ€™d been using whatever generic thing $40 could get; this time I decided to splurge past $100 (purchased at was $130 w/ points).Pros:â€¢ Sound quality. Iâ€™m not an audiophile, but Iâ€™ve owned 10+ headphones/earphones, different brands. The sound is lively, bass is strong without being overwhelming.â€¢ Case â€“ form factor is great! Fits in my pocket, doesnâ€™t looks scuffed after many months of use.â€¢ Battery life â€“ lasts for many hours before needing a charge. Could probably use it 2-3 days of regular use before getting a warning.â€¢ Mic works â€“ gets the job done.â€¢ Sennheiser app â€“ you can change what device it connects to and adjust EQ settings.Cons:â€¢ Connectivity: atrocious. Iâ€™ve had to soft reset / hard reset this too many times. Bluetooth isnâ€™t a new technology. This should be â€œset it and forget it.â€ * About 5% of the time, only 1 earphone connects. Disconnecting and reconnecting doesnâ€™t do anything and I have to do a soft reset. * When using the app, it sometimes refuses to disconnect from the current device so I can connect to what the device I want. Real fun 3 minutes before your Zoom meeting! * Sometimes doesnâ€™t â€œrememberâ€ how to connect to specific device(s). Iâ€™ve had to delete all pairings and reestablish connections twice so far in 9 months.â€¢ App: clunky. Randomly asks to update the firmware â€“ no, Sennheiser! When I open this app, 99% of the time I want to switch devices! Do it right the first time!â€¢ Features: this thing lacks soooo many features that exist on $40 earphones today. For this product not to have things like wireless charging, noise cancellation, connecting to multiple devices, the only thing I can think of is a paywall (greed: wanting to upsell a more expensive product).
product_attributes: Color: WhiteSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great Sound and Comfort
author: Robert Thomas
content: These have great sound quality for the price. Unfortunately, they lack a microphone and also do not perform well with my Meta Quest headset due to an inherent delay.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Sound is good, shape is awkward
author: Jennifer C.
content: These earbuds have a really good sound. And I love that there is an equalizer in the app so you can adjust it to sound the way you want it. They offer a lot of cool features that apparently not all earbuds have. You can change what the different taps do, but they are capable of answering your phone, raising and lowering the volume, fast forwarding, rewinding, or skipping tracks of songs, pausing and playing - all just buy tapping on the earbuds. Even though it is not one of their advertised features, they also do a very good job of noise canceling as long as they fit in your ear properly.So here's the downside that I found... These earbuds are large and square. Most ears are pretty round. I realize that all ears are shaped differently, but I have a hard time believing that these fit comfortably in most ears. If you're just sitting still at your desk or in the car, it's not too bad. But if you smile really big, they come loose, and If you lean over, they fall out of your ear entirely. When the Stem is seated properly in your ear, The big square part rubs uncomfortably against the outer ear. For this reason alone I am debating whether to return these, or Just suffer with it since I mostly use them in the car or at work. These could be great earbuds if they were more organomically designed.One last note - I don't have a lot to compare it to. But they advertise that the battery life is superior on these, and i'm not convinced. Now I admit I had them running for most of an 8 hour workday. But I had to switch between the left ear and the right ear while one of them was charging in the case, i'd use the other one. So from my experience, I could not run both of them for 6 or 8 hours continuously.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good headphones, but one always stops working
author: Gabriel
content: These headphones have been great. I've had them for more than a year and one of the earbuds randomly stopped working. Looked up how to fix this and it seems to be a fault of the headphones themselves. With only 1 working it's impossible to pair to new devices. Will keep using the 1 till it stops working completely.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars I like them, but Iâ€™m not an audiophile
author: Matt Hersman
content: I have had these for a long while now and theyâ€™re one of the better pairs of earbuds Iâ€™ve had. I have had pretty shoddy luck with headphones, but I had heard good things about this brand, so I thought Iâ€™d give them a go. Their sound is overall above average from what Iâ€™ve listened to. Theyâ€™re not super bassy like the Beats and Raycons Iâ€™ve had, which in some ways are better. I think a lot of peopleâ€™s problems with these is that they arenâ€™t proper Audiophile material like some of Sennheiserâ€™s other products, but if youâ€™re looking for wireless buds, you probably arenâ€™t really looking for the greatest sound on the market.I like the software that these use. The app lets you tweak the bass, mids and highs a bit so you can get get the sound a bit more to your liking. It also lets you switch between sources more easily than some other Bluetooth headphones.I will say that these arenâ€™t the most ergonomic earbuds ever, they fit just fine normally, but if you try to sleep with them, or put any pressure on your ear with a hat or something, they really dig into your ears, but thatâ€™s a non issue to most people.The noise cancellation is decent, but Iâ€™m pretty sure thereâ€™s not any tech behind it like with the AirPods, I think these just plug up your ears so you donâ€™t hear the outside noise, and they do that pretty well.The case is pretty good too. Itâ€™s a bit thicker than the AirPods case, but itâ€™s not as huge as some others, feels high quality, and holds a charge very well.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not worth the hassle
author: Kl
content: The headphoneâ€™s sound great. They fit well and comfy. But the hassle of figuring out how to charge these things properly is awful. Most the time getting them to sit right in order to charge is a choreâ€¦a real chore. If you can finally get them to set and charge then great but if not you have to deal with the battery life (27 hours is a lie). Not at all a great price, donâ€™t understand how people can say its great value when they donâ€™t work properly half the time wether it be charging pr pairing issues. Senheiser is being lazy with the earbud route.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 2.0 out of 5 stars This one doesn't live up to the Sennheiser name
author: Nicky
content: I had a Sennheiser full over-the-ear headphones some years ago and was satisfied with it. I bought this one on Black Friday and have been using it for several days. I now have three pairs of earbuds: Apple AirPods, SkullCandy and this one, which took me the most time to pair and connect.1) The small paper guide conveniently didn't mention that a small film on the mental contact must be peeled off. The charging case showed green light after a couple hours charging but I couldn't get them to connect. It was only after researching the questions section that I learned about this step (so apparently others were confused too).2) The shape of the earbuds make it difficult to grab and pull them out of the charging case. Each time it takes more than one try.3) No indicator light on the front of earbuds themselves to show the battery level. My SkullCandy (much cheaper but equally good sound quality) has indicator light on the earbuds. It would become red to tell me to put it back in the charging case.4) To connect to a device for the first time is confusing. A YouTube clip tells me to watch the little light in the back to blink red/blue to indicate it's ready to pair/connect. But when I tried to connect with a second device (after disconnecting from the first one), it didn't blink. The guide shows to put fingers on the earbuds (after inserting into the ears) to put it in paring mode. The SkullCandy doesn't require any additional step: after the earbuds are taken out of the case, a voice tells you that it's ready to connect.5) It won't let you switch from one device to another easily. When I turn off the Bluetooth on my iPad and tried to switch to my cellphone (with earbuds still in my ears), I can't connect right away. I wound up having to put them back in the case and then take them out to connect to the second device (unlike SkullCandy, which stays in pairing mode and lets you connect to the 2nd device right away).All in all, It's not worth the value compared to a cheaper but better product like SkullCandy.Added 12/27/2022: Now that Iâ€™ve used for more than three weeks (bought on Black Friday), I should downgrade the rating from my initial 3 stars to 2 stars. I finally managed to connect it with my laptop after several attempts but it seemed random and I still donâ€™t know how it happened. And it happened several times that one of the earbuds would lose sound for no apparent reason while I was using them. I would need to take them out of my ears, put them back into the case, took them out to reconnect again. Or sometimes only one earbud got connected with the device after taking both out of the charging case. I would not buy it again.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Superb for old or poor quality audio of movies and Youtubes
author: Geoffrey N.
content: This was my first pair of Bluetooth buds ever so I had to really study the online information & reviews. I use these for content consumption at home so don't need all options available like sport buds, remote charging, outdoor or loud environment noise cancelling, etc. Those features cost extra money so I got a great price on these for exactly what my needs are. When they were brand new on the market they cost a lot more. A lot of news channel interviews are with guests not in the studio. They're at their home or office so the sound is of poor quality. I listen to a lot of news in Spanish so with the other factors mentioned it's hard for me to understand. Sometimes there will even be a music overlay which really makes it hard for me to understand. These Sennheisers clean it all up. Just beautiful.Amazon shipped 'em to me in South America right to my door with no problem whatsoever.
product_attributes: Color: WhiteSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good at first
author: Nathan
content: So, I have bought alot of earbuds. In the last year I've probably got 5 pairs, because most of them share the same issue. Connection problem.Eventually most earbuds will start disconnecting from my phone, ToZo, ILuv, Senheiserner, ect ect...These earbuds are no exception.Now for the first two weeks these earbuds were perfect, they had great sound, great connectivity, the app worked without issue.But after week two, they started not connecting to my phone, sometimes they would cut out randomly, and I had to restart them. For cheap earbuds, this is expected. Not for $100 pair. However I had bought so many, I was tired of it and gave these the benefit of the doubt.Here I am a month and a half later and the issue alas only gotten worse. I don't know if it's Senheiserners fault, or the particular pair I got, but either way I couldn't put up with it any longer, thankfully Amazon offered me a full refund, and I intend on buying the "Google Pixel Buds A-Series" (the ones I was originally going to get)I really wanted these earbuds to work, and I took perfect care of them. I didn't let them over charge, I never dropped them or tossed them once. So I know for a fact that fault wasn't mine own atleast.If you want good earbuds of a similar price, I dunno, this is the most expensive pair I've owned.If you want good earbuds of a cheaper price try the Mpow M30 Plus, I've had that pair for almost two years and they have failed me only twice in all that time (and it was my fault). Or maybe I genuinely just got a bad pair, I don't know. I know when these earbuds worked, they were excellent.I have had great experiences with Senheiser in the past, this is the first time they've let me down.Hopefully this is the last negative Earbud review I ever have to make, we'll see Goggle Pixel Buds A-Series, I'm coming for you next, don't fail me too.
product_attributes: Color: WhiteSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Comfort vs Sound
author: Sebastian
content: They sound great, really good bass and midrange at the price. Big fan of the design as well both in regards to the earbuds and the case. As great as they sound I ended up going with a different pair for one reason, comfort. These feel terrible. Theyâ€™re on the heavy side due to the thick build( which allows for bigger batteries) and keeping them in your ears is a chore. Once I did get them to stay, I found myself taking them out after 20 minutes because my ears were sore.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

author: Salguod

For her, using these for phone calls is essential as she needs her hands free to be â€œhands on.â€ They performed well on both audio dimensions. Problem for her was that these phone did not fit well and are generally larger than many others available. She couldnâ€™t keep them in. So simply sated, they are excellent phones that might not fit everyone.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great value for money pair of earbuds.
author: Yash Tike
content: Sennheiser always makes some great audio products, and this one is no exception. It is priced pretty competitively, and gives great bang for the buck. The battery life is good, sound quality is great, and passive noise cancellation is also fairly decent, but might have to turn the volume up if in a crowder place. The only gripes I have with it are that the bluetooth drivers are not great, and I have faced several connectivity issues. They are also quite a bulky pair, and fit a bit awkwardly in the ear because of their shape and size, so you do start feeling the fatigue after a couple of hours in listening sessions.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars For the price probably best in class
author: Chris Park
content: I use these daily at work to listen to music and take calls while my hands are busy. I assume the mic is good on these considering the other end never asks twice or asked me to repeat what I've said. I usually have on a single bud while using and that works fine for both listening to music and calling. The battery life is fantastic. I get better mileage out of it compared to the Galaxy buds. Personally I think these are more comfortable than the Galaxy buds and the sound quality is superior to the Galaxy buds. That might not be the case for everyone. The Sennheiser CX is a bit bulky, so angling and fit I could see not working out for everyone. They are snug for me and generally a great fit, however I have had an instance of it falling off once or twice. The best part is price in my opinion, beats the Galaxy buds in sound quality and is cheaper. Personally I like it's design, but it being a bit bulky they aren't the most discreet. Good value in my opinion.
product_attributes: Color: WhiteSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Useful for listening to music at work
author: Jeremy Davis
content: Iâ€™ve used these earbuds for about a week now. Sound quality is very good, however the bass is a bit lacking, which I was expecting when I purchased these.The noise cancellation is passive, which was something I was actively looking for in earbuds. I work in an environment where I communicate frequently with coworkers, so I didnâ€™t want too much bass or any active noise cancellation.The battery life and charging time has been stellar. I can wear these from 7:00 AM to 3:30 PM without much concern for the battery life. I usually charge them while I eat lunch, which essentially ensures they will last me the whole day.These headphones do utilize an application to update firmware. The app is pretty standard. Itâ€™s easy to use, and it lets you customize the sound balance. It is a bit annoying that you have install an app and a firmware update for these.Touch controls are relatively standard as well. The app does let you customize these controls, but since I have a smart watch, the only touch function I use is the play/pause single tap.Overall, I am very happy with the product.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not what I'd expect from Sennheiser...
author: Cody Groat
content: I bought these after I lost my JBL Live 300's. Was looking for something equally as good but for a bit cheaper. Stumbled across these and looked at some reviews. Flossy Carter's review is what gave me the go ahead, but boy was he wrong on this one.These are extremely cheaply made (case and earbuds feel horrible to the touch), the earbuds are uncomfortable to wear for more than 30 minutes, the sounds quality is nothing as you'd expect from Sennheiser. And the horrid app is nearly unusable.Normally I'd excuse the sound quality when you can set your own equalizer, but the app to do that doesn't work half the time. When you launch it, it just flat out doesn't connect to the earbuds. It will show them for a second but then say connection failed. If you get pass this, the app is extremely slow and buggy. Even if the app worked, the equalizer only includes bass, mids, and highs so you can't fully customize it to your liking.For some good points about these earbuds. They are lightweight and don't move around easily in your ear. The magnets to secure the earbuds and close the case feel great. The touch controls are very responsive. The sound queues and tones are clear and easy to understand. And the battery life is good + it charges quickly.So give these earbuds a pass and go with the JBL Live 300's. Much better sound quality, and an app that works. They are $150 retail but frequently go on sale for $100 (I got them for $75 on amazon). You'll also be getting auto play/pause, and a slightly better water resistance rating at IPX5.
product_attributes: Color: WhiteSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bang For Your Buck
author: Josh B
content: I like a good sounding headphones/earbuds. I think most of us do, at least anyone looking into something like Sennheiser.That being said, I usually go to Bose, because they have fantastic sound, and, they are the most comfortable for me. The wingtips really help keep them in my ears, and since they're soft silicone, it's comfortable.I typically don't like in ears with this design. They annoy my ears to the point that I just can't wear them for more than an hour. These on the other hand are actually quite comfortable. They aren't the most comfortable thing on the planet, but I find myself able to wear them for hours at a time without feeling any fatigue.The noise canceling does leave a little to be desired, but it's definitely present. It doesn't suck the world out like a nice pair of over ears or a really, really nice sent of ANC in ears. But, for the price point, they weren't so far away from things double, or even almost triple the price. They're great.The best thing about these earbuds, though, is their sound quality. They sound absolutely fantastic. Now, if you're a basshead, they probably aren't quite for you. But if you want to hear the nice boomy bass, punchy kids, and sparkly highs; these are fantastic. You can hear the low end a bit better with the bass boost profile, you can even EQ them in app to your preferences. But for me, the take home with these was the solid sound signature. I could hear all of the lower undertones of sound work in the high end, while getting a nice clear sounding low end. Again, if you're really looking for that low end - low kids punch, these probably won't do it for you. But if you want all aspects of your song to stand out equally, these are great.At this price, if you're thinking about getting them. I say go for it. An absolute 10/10, again, especially at the price.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars neat!
author: Ghoul
content: i have small ears, so theyâ€™re pretty uncomfortable after wearing for a little while, but i think if you have some more room, theyâ€™ll be a great choice! i usually get an hour or two before i need to take them out. (taking breaks is good for me anyway lol) i think the square shape is really cool looking, but itâ€™s just not very comfortable.also the app and the equalizer is pretty awesome. skullcandy has a feature on their app where they play different tones and give you a preset based off your hearing, but sennheiser has a system where you play music you like and click what sounds best. i think itâ€™s more intuitive and it makes the setting more relevant.the noise cancelling is CRAAAZY. iâ€™m so serious about that. other earbuds iâ€™ve used have noise cancelling, but i can still hear a little bit (someone closing a door in my house, my tv if i have it on at the same time, water running from a sinkâ€¦). with THESE? i canâ€™t hear ANYTHING! not even my breathing! itâ€™s sooo awesome, iâ€™ve never experienced anything like it!!the case and earbuds is also nice quality in terms of material. i think theyâ€™ll last me a long time.MUCH better than the raycon + skullcandy sets i was using before.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars UPDATE: Filled with problems, waste of $130...AVOID!
author: Gio Arenas
content: Initial set up (WITHOUT the app, which I'll get to later) was easy and they quickly paired with my Tab S7. I tested it with different types of music (rock, hip-hop, spanish, etc), as well as some podcasts. While the sound quality across the board is good, it didn't outperform a $50 pair of Enacfire E90 earbuds I had before they stopped working. When it comes to bass, the old E90's actually did BETTER than these. The comfort is decent, and aren't heavy enough to fall off your ears. Unfortunately, I can't say anything about the battery life since these STOPPED working less than 24 hours after they were delivered!Oh and about the failure, I mainly blame their (stupid) "Smart Control" app for this. Like I said before, the earbuds worked fine and paired quicky...until I used this dumpster fire of an app. At first, I was able to link the earbuds with the app and then I tried to update the firmware since it was available. Big, BIG MISTAKE. Even though the earbuds were (supposedly) at 90% battery and were recently charged with a fully charged case, I was instructed to put them them back into the case in order to start the update. After doing so and waiting an hour, the earbuds have refused to go into Bluetooth pairing mode.***UPDATE 08/22/2021***After contacting Sennheiser support via email, they suggested that I get a replacement pair, which is what I did. After getting them, I have to say, I now LOVE these earbuds! I don't know why, but this pair sounds a LOT better than the first ones I got. I can now safely say thay sound better than anything else I've tried, including my old E90's. Pairing was simple and fast, using a single earbud was effortless, and the range is fantastic.While I didn't get the 9 hrs of battery life that was advertised, the most I've gotten so far is about 7.5 hrs, which is still great for true wireless earbuds. Regardless of what you listen to, these earbuds sound amazing and have a great amount of bass. While a few have said that these are too heavy for their ears, it wasn't the case for me. I work in a warehouse where I'm constantly on the move, and I NEVER experienced a moment where I felt like these were going to fall off. That being said, I stand by my previous comment where I say that these won't fall off your ears, even if you're moving around. These are rated as IPX4 water resistant, which I'm going to say is legit since the warehouse does get hot and as a result, I do get pretty sweaty.***UPDATE #2, 09/10/2021***I once again find myself HATING these earbuds! After working perfectly for a few weeks, the left earbud of the REPLACEMENT (2nd) pair I got stopped working. Just like the 1st pair, I tried multiple resets, both soft and factory, and I get no audio from left side whatsoever. I also checked my devices' settings and can confirm that they work perfectly and are not the issue. At this point, I probably won't bother contacting support again and will just get rid of them. $130 in the trash thanks to Sennheiser!
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Sound
author: jarrod424
content: I was gifted some Airpod Pros last Christmas and I really didn't like them. To my ears they sounded overly bass-heavy and I prefer a flat EQ. They also had all kinds of connection issues with my phone (an iPhone, no less). So I decided to try these Sennheisers out as a replacement, and I'm really glad I did. The clarity and overall sound quality is leaps and bounds better than the Airpods. And the battery life is far superior as well. I take long walks every day with these, and only need to charge them maybe once every other week? Phenomenal.My only two gripes would be 1. the size of the case, which is somewhat bulky when shoved into a jeans pocket, and 2. the rubber tips that are included. Although they do provide 3 sizes (small, medium, large), I found all sizes of the Sennheiser tips to be too shallow for my ear canal, causing the buds to fall out rather easily. However, I replaced the tips with some slightly deeper ones (from an old pair of $30 sony's), and now they fit perfectly with no issue.

content: Update: both of my earbuds still work. I had to re pair the earbuds to each other again. Pretty easy to do, annoying. Every now and then I might have connections issues but reconnecting the earbuds to my phone and turning on and off the media audio works. Both earbuds volume still works great. title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic Sound Quality in a Low Price range
author: halfcentaur
content: I actually own the first MOMENTUM true wireless and used them for years at work. They have superb sound quality, but there were a lot of issues I had with them. They were large with annoying battery leakage and fast battery depletion. I bought these in April when I started a new job because I would be taking a train regularly. I wanted something affordable but didn't want to sacrifice the sound quality that I was enjoying before, with a much better battery quality. These really haven't disappointed. They're not quite as good sound as the MOMENTUMS, but they are still very good for $70. I reckon most other brands you'd have to be spending at least $150 for this quality of sound. The battery life is incredible on them and they're my daily use when I'm commuting. The touch controls are great, much more intuitive than the MOMENTUMs. Their size is a massive improvement over the first MOMENTUMS, they do not stress my ears nearly as bad. Couldn't have been happier with this purchase. Sennheiser is the only audio company I purchase from, and they have rarely missed for me. At this price range, it's an automatic recommendation if anyone ever asks. With the MOMENTUM line is was always harder since the price range was generally extreme.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 2.0 out of 5 stars Painfully Mediocre
author: Lui
content: Where to start. The (8 HOUR MAX) battery life is valid for only one of the earbuds, the other dies in half the time causing the other to also start spewing its "Battery Low" message until you set it back to charge. They say 27 hour only because you get about 3 Charges from the case, which is also Sad. The material they're made of (including the case) provides ZERO grip so you'll most likely have them simply slipping out of your grasp AND your ears. They refuse to stay in even during something as simple as a light walk, you'll find yourself constantly having to push them back in place. As for the connection, it's Horrid. As many other reviews state, sometimes one bud doesn't connect and you have to factory reset them about three times in a row to fix the issue. The Range is hot garbage. Doesn't even extend down a 12 ft. hallway. My 7+ year old Skullcandy Hesh headphones have a longer range. A joke to be sure. The $15 earbuds that I bought to use at work were an infinitely better investment. Don't bother with these at $89.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Impressive for my use!
author: Terry P.
content: I cannot comment on noise cancellation with these earbuds because I donâ€™t care about that. For my use on my iPad Air for listening to music and YouTube videos of all kinds these are perfect. I can EQ them nicely. I have a musical background with degrees in performance and theory and have a good ear. These suit me just fine. My hearing is a bit lessened at my age 68 but not much. I can hear vocals, instruments etc with excellent detail in the mids, highs, lows. I am currently listening to Angelina Jordan exclusively right now and it almost sounds as if she is here with me. I know her well as my dearest friend and have an intimate knowledge of her voice in person. Through these Sennheisers her voice sounds great. Sennheiser has done it for me. I am totally satisfied. She and I compared them the other day to a pair of very high end buds given her by the record company as a gift. The ones she had were at least four times the cost of these Sennheiser but neither she nor I could hear much difference. Of course her hearing is much better than mine but still she agreed with my assessment. Hope this is helpful.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sennheiser signature open sound
author: Soren
content: Sennheiser is known for making headphones that are open in their sound. This means that when they are on your ears or in your ears, you feel like the sound is outside of your ears instead of right in your eardrum. This creates a soundstage with more depth and clarity. These are not the headphones to bump your trap music to. These are headphones to enjoy great acoustic music, classical music, jazz, watch movies, and enjoy some rock music. With rock music, it should be understood that you will get a nice open sound, but that you will not be getting the blistering loudness that comes with other headphones, especially wired headphones. In some ways this is a better things, especially in regards to your long term ear health.I am 2 days into enjoying them, so I will update if the charging and individual earbud dying issue comes up. It is stated as having a 2 year warranty, so all of these issues should be covered if you ever encounter them.As it stands, the price is right and they often get discounted another 20% for Black Friday, Cyber Monday, and Prime Day.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Really? Just meh.
author: Robbo
content: Liked that they are half what the big guys stuff cost and that these are â€œadjustableâ€ with an â€œ equalizerâ€ app.But in reality, i couldnt get better bass out of them to satisfy my aging ears. But maybe you will have better luck. I have both those AND these, and i still use these. So read into it what you will. Great buds for the money in the long run. Did need to be â€œre-pairedâ€ more than once, which was very frustrating.
product_attributes: Color: WhiteSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great for audio
author: Thomas Camp
content: The audio for movies or pod casts is fantastic, but bass is not great for music. I prefer Bose for music but these are much better fitting on my ear..
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars I feel like I owe Sennheiser money...
author: Carlos Valencia
content: I'll start by saying that I got these earbuds for $80, and for that amount of money these are hands-down the absolute best option under $100, even without ANC.Even at their list price of $130 they'd definitely be worth it, but for $80 I feel like I owe Sennheiser money!It all comes down to sound quality. I'm no audiophile, but I've owned a pair of Phillips Fidelio X2HR for a while now and the Sennheiser CX sound just as good if not better. Except the CX are tiny wireless earbuds! It's unbelievable.I listen to all kinds of music and was blown away by the amount of detail that comes through when listening to classical music, you can hear different instruments come from different directions. It's really cool.I think the sound is perfectly balanced right out of the box, but you can customize it within the app. Bass heads will probably enjoy the bass boost function but personally I think the bass sounds fantastic in the neutral setting even with hip hop and EDM.I don't really plan on using the earbuds for anything else other than listening to music, so I can't comment on call quality but for $80 I am positive that this is the best option for that price.If I had to mention any negatives it's just that I wish these were just a little louder, but other than that these earbuds are incredible.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars All around great
author: JC
content: I was looking to replace my cheaper bluetooth headphones and couldn't decide on which ones to get. I knew I wanted Sennheiser, though, being that they are up there as a pinnacle of sound quality. I am not disappointed that I went with these. For the price of these, the sound quality is "bussin'," as the kids say. I honestly don't even know what to expect from a higher dollar bluetooth headphone. I really enjoy the equalizer that's on the Sennheiser app. It has many presets and also allows you to create your own preset based on what sounds better in certain situations and certain genres of music you are listening to at that time. My only complaint is the noise cancellation. Actually it's not even a complaint because these headphones don't claim to have noise cancellation. But if that is what you are looking for, you may want to look at some other options. If you are looking for a decently priced, higher quality, name brand set of headphones, I think you've found them here.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Decent but not as great as expected
author: Mary Colon
content: I did some research before purchasing these but it was my first foray into buying ear buds (been using my nose headphones for years now). I primarily wanted ear buds to listen to podcasts and music while cleaning. These look really nice (better than apple ones, to me) and have some good features. I like the charging case and it seemed to keep a charge for a long time. I only tested them for a week or so, but I didn't need to charge the case much in that time period. The bad- the worst thing to me was that they kept falling out of my ears and even the smallest cover for the ear bud part wouldn't fit in my ear. That might be just my ears but it actually would start hurting if they were in for longer than 20 min or so. And they fell quite often. I also found when trying to use them for a call, the person on the other end couldn't hear me. (Only tried that once, to be fair. ) I don't think the quality of sound was very good compared to other headphones or ear buds. I ultimately returned these and have gone back to my way more comfortable bose.
product_attributes: Color: WhiteSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good Quality for the Price
author: Kate
content: These headphones sound great. I listen to music and podcasts all day as a painter and the battery doesn't die on me. The only issue I've been having recently is that one of the headphones (the left) sometimes doesn't want to connect via bluetooth every time. I have to mess with disconnecting and reconnecting them or leaving the right one in the case for a while to get it to work again. I have had these for a couple years now.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Sennheiser
author: Robert
content: Took a while to get them to pair but once I got them working they sound great.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Sounds great, but too heavy for my ear
author: Alan
content: These are Wonderful earbuds. Sound fantastic. Great bass and long battery life with more charging available in the carrying case. The one and only problem is that after an hour or two my ears start hurting because they are HEAVY for my ears. I have switched to a much cheaper around the neck ear piece that is much lighter and sounds almost as good. It is a no name brand model but it is much easier to wear for extended periods of time. But for Audio Quality, the CX is pretty darn good.
product_attributes: Color: WhiteSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

content: I really enjoy these headphones. The battery life is fantastic. The sound is great and crystal clear. The microphone has no issue picking up my voice. The only complaint I have is if you are working on your car looking down, chewing, or smiling a little too much. The headphones will fall out of your ears which is a bit of a nuisance. I had beats before this that had loops over the ear and that's the only thing I miss from them.Go for it but wait for the sales!
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lots of bass, but clear
author: Rhyno
content: I just received these and I gotta say, I'm enjoying them greatly!These have a bass heavy sound (which being a bassist myself, I like very much, kick drum & bass guitar really come alive) especially for more modern metal & pop music. They're loud enough or my taste for sure. I honestly sounds like a well mixed PA system in my head. Double kick rolls sound really cool. I played a since wave sweep through these on youtube, and these hit every frequency. 20hz made me slightly disoriented lol.Getting them connected was a breeze, they've paired right up with everything I connected them to.The comfort is just fine for me with the factory equipped earbuds. I cannot attest to phone call quality, or how well they stay in place during activities since I only have them for listening at home. The touch sensitivity for the track & volume controls works nicely.Great headphones!!
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars They broke, butâ€¦
author: Trevor
content: I had these for a year and used them heavily. The sound quality isnâ€™t the best, but you can tweak it using the app. The bass is too punchy and the sound isnâ€™t crisp like $200 earbuds. Duh lol. Honestly though when I first bought them, I was in love especially since these are my first Bluetooth earbuds. Iâ€™m glad I got a good year out of them. They broke when I was working out and my sweat got inside causing it to malfunction. If you are looking for cheap Bluetooth earbuds that are decent then you came to the right place. All in all, so many memories and I appreciate the entertainment these things gave me. I used them during classes, around campus, hanging out with friends in study groups, on the city train/ buss, so theyâ€™ve been everywhere with me. I bought new and more expensive earbuds so ya climbing up the ladder of quality

product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty great pair of earphones.
author: Fernando Morales
content: This earphones definitely were worth the money. App that was suggested also helped to make the experience better and things went pretty smooth once I was able to figure out the equalizer. There is a sign up option to get a more user experience friendly equalizer which is great but it doesn't take that long to sign up and get into it. You can use one at a time as well and they have a long distance before they start to break up in signal. The bass is great and it isn't over the top. The feel of them and weight of them is perfect so no issues. It even latches into your ears pretty well so I had no issue at the gym with them. Had another set from JLAB that sucked compared to these and the sennheiser set just never had the desync issues.I highly recommend these.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 2.0 out of 5 stars Too many connection issues
author: Sierra
content: I've had these for a few months now and I've noticed I've had a lot of connection issues with my earbuds from the start. I use them every day and too many times have one earbuds connection been much weaker and the volume is drastically lower than the other (happens with both ear buds) and turning them off and on again and returning them to the case isn't enough and I'll have to repair my earbuds. I've had to do this every few weeks, sometimes even a few times in a week and pairing them has proven to be much more difficult than it should be. Often it said the earbuds couldn't be paired even though they were turned on and full battery. Another thing, my left earbud will die almost an hour before my right one does, and I make sure to clean them well so they charge.My left earbud also has the most connection issues as recently I'll hardly tap it or move my head and the earbud will lose connectivity and buffer a lot. I never listen to my earbuds with more than half volume as I don't need it because the sound quality is pretty good, but that means I know my speaker isn't blowing out and there's just issues with the manufacturing of this product. I never had these issues with my galaxy earbuds, and am quite frustrated. Other than these issues, they have good quality and potential. Hopefully it's just my earbuds that are like this and not the product as a whole.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 2.0 out of 5 stars Problems With Connection
author: Hydromantes
content: I recommend that you do not buy Sennheiser earbuds. Like all manufacturers, they will change the name of this model if they have not already done so to deflect their products from bad reviews so I can't trust anything they make.I've used these for over a month now and they keep disconnecting. I use them for several hours every day and this happens three or four times each week. If there is no audio for a few minutes, they disconnect but they will re-connect with a single click which is a minor inconvenience. However, they also just stop working randomly and will not re-connect at all. That could be a problem connecting with Bluetooth, but often one earbud will continue working when the other earbud is dead and must be re-charged. That proves that it is not a Bluetooth problem but a problem with the earbuds. Even after recharging, the dead earbud will not always re-connect easily. Frequently I need to remove them from my Bluetooth list then re-pair them which is a major inconvenience. I used to have a pair of wireless Sennheiser headphones that also would not stay connected. It seems Sennheiser doesn't know how to make something that will connect to Apple devices, which is too bad because they sound great and I like the controls.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

content: I generally trust the Sennheiser brand to deliver outstanding sound quality. That didnâ€™t happen with this product. title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Decent but disappointing overall
author: Scott Spencer
content: I've decided it's a bad idea to reply too much on reviews for headphones. Everyone has different hearing, individual preferences and varying levels of ability to detect (or even care about) audio fidelity. First impression out of the box: Well-made and beautifully packaged. It took me far too long to figure out why they weren't charging; turns out there was plastic film over the terminals, which I don't believe the documentation mentioned. (The documentation is pretty lame, btw...) Once over that hump, as soon as I got them connected to Bluetooth and to the app, it asked for a firmware update; this took an incredibly long time. First impression of the sound: crisp, clear, not quite loud enough (for me), but the low end is sorely lacking. Treble perhaps too bright. The EQ inside the app is pretty clever and helped improve the sound, but I was still hoping for more...ooomph...presence...<insert other audiophile words>. (For reference, I was listening to Spotify Premium (highest quality) over Bluetooth.) Phone call performance is excellent. Fairly comfortable/good fit. Overall, these are probably better than I'm making them sound. I anticipate using them for everything except critical listening; for that I'll keep using my over-ear ones.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars left ear dead in 3 months

content: Can't get any support, left ear dead in 3 months. Can't return it.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best quality earbuds for the price

content: These earbuds are fantastic.The sound quality is probably the best I have had in earbuds, whether they be wired or wireless.I will warn you if you intend on using them for working out be sure to pick a size up from what you think you should wear cause then they'll stay on a little better and won't fall. I was sort of doing a handstand test with them lol if I was in a handstand and they fell, I had to go a size up.Also I was absolutely SHOCKED with the call quality. I was in a busy mall and my dad called me. I was able to walk through the mall and has a solid 30 min conversation where we could hear each other clearly.Speaking of, the passive noise cancelation is BALLER. Like incredible for Passive noise canceling.If you're looking to buy some new headphones but don't wanna pay TOO much, these are really solid.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars I use these daily and couldn't imagine going on without them
author: Ted S
content: These headphones are amazing! I use them daily and love them for calls in particular. I have very bad hearing and these ear buds keep me from having to crank the volume up on calls. They also pick up sound very well which is great because I'm usually working on something when I get a call. The sound quality for music is fantastic as well. Unlike a lot of other brands, these ear buds are great for all types of music, not just loud bass-driven music as the mid-range is well represented in the mix when playing music. I prefer to listen to music with these headphones over all of my other headphones and speakers as the quality can't be beat. Sennheiser makes fantastic headphones, on par with industry leaders. I cannot recommend these particular ear buds enough. They're so great that I would not want to go a day without them.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars does its job well
author: very trustworthy buyer hehe (thumbs_up_emoji)
content: great deal and quality. connects to bluetooth super fast (faster than others that i've had). long battery.only complaint is that the commands are independent for each earbud (L/R). double tap L vs double tap R is not the same thing, which is great with both earbuds in, BUT not great when you like to use one. if i'm using my left one there's no way to skip a song with the earbud button, and if i'm using my right there's no way to rewind. not a huge deal but slight annoyance. i don't know of a workaround for this.otherwise great.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars I had hoped for an upgrade from the earlier CX 400BT model
author: D. Briscoe
content: I have had the earlier CX 400BT model for 18 months. I thought there might be improved sound and other features based on reading the descriptions, but after trying this CX True for a few hours I returned it. I tried several sizes of the ear adapters but none of them helped the problem I had with the sound quality. This CX True seemed to have murkier sound to me. I was surprised that the sound was not at least identical, but I had been hoping for improvement. Other features did not seem to be an improvement either. I didn't notice any improvement in the bluetooth connection. Also I preferred the older model's use of voice saying "Volume Max" instead of this CX True version just making a beep when the maximum volume is reached.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Complete Garbage Profiting On the Sennheiser Name
author: User
content: I should have taken this as a bad omen when my first pair died a week after purchasing them. They are the only headphones that I've ever had just cease operating. I returned them, and my experience with my second pair has been a complete nightmare.The- Inconsistent battery life- Drastically different EQ on left and right sides- Poorly designed charging caseAre just a few small issues I've had. The main issue is that sometimes one or both headphones will stop working or desync from my phone for no reason and with no solution. I have gone months (Multiple times) with only one headphone working while the other one blinks red and green like a Christmas tree only to fix itself randomly months later. Again, this has happened several times with both headphones. Sometimes for days, sometimes for months. They have also reset any settings that I had changed in the Sennheiser app, so that's useless.And to add insult to injury, they sound just as good as the $30 TaoTronics I had a few years back. Not bad... But you won't be catching any fine detail in your music. Definitely not worth the asking price.Just don't buy these. They are complete e-waste, and I have read similar problems in others' reviews. They are a total waste of money. Get some Anker SoundCores or something. You'll probably have better luck with a pair of Bluetooth earbuds from the dollar store. At least they will properly sync.
product_attributes: Color: BlackSize: SmallStyle: True wireless earphone

title: 2.0 out of 5 stars Just a Miss

content: I really wanted to like these but I just can't. First off the ear tips are all too small except the biggest set which is too big and folds up in my ear making it uncomfortable. I've had numerous connection issues with them as well. The app is about as bare bones as can be. They will work with my phone, but getting them to connect to my switch is a pain, and when trying to use them when connected to my Surface pro they just don't work at all. And that was pretty much the final straw for me. Picked these up when they were on sale for $50 and they're not even worth the hassle for that cheap. It's a shame because I like the case and form factor of the buds themselves.

content: While not necessarily bad in performance, it definitely doesn't meet the standards that I've come to expect from Sennheiser.
