title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Updated to 4 Stars Based on Customer Service/Fixes for several issues
author: James
content: Leaving my original review below but changing my review to 4 stars based on the customer service. I reached out to Anker about my issues below and their CSR was very responsive. She walked me through a number of steps and when resets, etc. did not fix the connection problems, she gave me a RMA and shipped me a new unit as well as some foam eartips. The foam tips did WONDERS. I am surprised that they do not include them as an option in the box from the get go (maybe people like me are a very small minority) but they worked really well in keeping the buds in place. They will still come out in extended use (still waiting on a spirit x version of these) but I definitely don't have the same fear that they will fall out at an inopportune time. I still have a few connection issues from time to time and the lack of physical buttons can often be rage inducing so I'm not giving these 5 stars but they are a really good value for the money and from a company that stands behind their product.Original review below:Anker has provided so much value to me over the years (to date, I've bought the soundcore life 2, life q20, spirit X, curve, and an untold amount of cables :D) and I want to love these earbuds so much. There's so much promise and so many features but the sum of it all falls short for me.First off, they look great - as soon as I bought them (my first set of wireless earbuds), people in my office were asking what they were because they looked really sharp. When I am sitting down at my desk and have both of these in, they are really good at blocking out exterior noise which is why I bought them (I work in a refashioned warehouse and the HVAC system and the industrial refrigerators we have create a ton of looping, irritating noise). The ANC is pretty solid for my needs and the sound quality for the podcasts I listen to seems really good.However, the problems arise when I am not using them in that ideal scenario (seated, both buds in). When I have one bud in, the touch controls don't seem to work as well and I have to try a few times for the command to register, if it does at all. This might be a minor quibble as I'm not sure how many people are going into "mono" mode but since it is most of my day, it can make the headphones borderline unusable for me. In the same vein, I do like the app (Android) but I hate the widget - whenever I flip to it to switch the hearing modes, it never says the buds are connected...even though they are in my ear and playing music. It defeats the purpose of using a widget because I then have to unlock my phone and do it through the app. Now, I wouldn't have to do it through the app ... if the touch controls worked properly when I had one bud in. It's a cycle of frustration!Finally, the biggest problem for me is that the buds simply do not stay in all the time. especially when I am walking. I have tried several of the covers that they provided in the box and while I get a good seal for listening, I can feel the bud start to slip out of my ear as I am walking. I start panicking that it's going to fall and slam on the stamped concrete floors of the office and I'm going to be out the money I paid for these. If Anker made a spirit X version of these that hooked above the ear, that might be a better choice for me. For now, because of the above frustrations, these have been relegated to just at home use for my wife and I when we are not being active and can have both buds in.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very impressive buds for the price
author: H. Fox
content: I'm nothing close to being an audiophile, but I use earbuds and headphones of several different brands a lot, in and out of the house. As a 65+ senior with a mild but annoying tinnitus problem, I use my AirPods Pro every time I watch TV at home because, without them, it's very difficult to catch all of the dialogue of almost every program I watch. They sync with my LG TV very well so I don't have to adjust TV settings for video/audio syncing.But this is a review of the Soundcore by Anker Life P3 Noise Cancelling Earbuds, so why am I talking up the AirPods Pro? Simple. They make for a great comparison. I've owned earlier versions of the Anker Soundcore non-ANC buds that were less expensive, and it showed in their performance. But, I gotta say, the P3 ANCs are way, way better. I don't fly a lot, but recently, on some very long flights from Florida to western Canada, the P3s really shined. The constant noise level in most airliners is terrible and completely wears me out even after short flights. I was skeptical about using earbuds instead of headphones, but I literally couldn't believe my ears when I popped the P3s in and was instantly transformed by the quiet! Their noise canceling performance might not be the very best, but I've tried other brands including Sony, Sennheiser and Bowers-Wilkins and the P3s are truly nearly as good - including my AirPods Pro, which are my all-time favorites for both overall sound quality and ANC. The shocker, of course, is that the P3s are a fraction of the cost.To my problematic ears the sound quality of the P3s isn't quite there, but they are way more than just satisfactory. I would have given them four-and-a-half stars for that aspect, but Amazon won't let me. All around, the P3s are just plain awesome, and at their price point, they're amazing. Oh, and by the way, they work very well with my LG TV also. If I couldn't, or didn't want to, afford the AirPods Pro, the P3s would make me very happy as an alternative.Now for one quibble. The P3s charging case is just plain terrible. Not because they don't protect the buds or charge them properly, but because, in my experience, they're constantly popping open and dropping the P3s at the worst possible moments. The case is SO easy to accidently pop open, that if dropped a mere few inches onto a firm surface, mine would flop open and invariably the earbuds would just fall out. This made for some especially exciting moments on said airline trip to Canada. I nearly lost the P3s several times when they'd fall out of a pocket, or my backpack, and the case would pop open and scatter the buds in different directions. Just try finding two black earbuds on black carpet under your airline seat a couple times - not a pleasant experience. Heads up, Anker! I love a lot of your products, but you could do seriously better designing a case for such great earbuds.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty decent product for the money.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great for price, very strong bass (maybe too strong)
author: eqrweqe
content: I revisited these after my Sony WF-1000XM4's started experiencing battery issues and the company wouldn't replace them.Putting them in is still a trick I'm learning to master. I still don't quite get the "lock" movement, but once they're in they stay in about as well as any other bud.For the price, the sound quality is essentially the same as the XM4's. Both earbuds needed some fussing with the EQ to get the best profile. The major difference is that while Sony lets you control the bass boost, this one goes full throttle. I had to heavily boost all the other frequencies in the EQ while reducing the lower frequencies to near zero (see screenshot for my recommendation) just to get it to a level I would consider acceptable. Some will like how ungodly strong it is, others will not.Noise canceling seems to be about on par with Sony, but the ambient sound is definitely much worse. The XM4's were clear as day whereas these still sound quite muffled. But the XM4's are a few bennies whereas this is 60 bucks, so you can't really complain too much.Touch controls are responsive, though you might get some accidental presses here and there. The only thing I wish these had was a sensor to automatically pause when you take the earbuds out, but I think I'll live.Bottom line, for 60 bucks these are really good earbuds that can compete with the best, with a few caveats here and there.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good value for price - with a catch
author: StephenH
content: Briefly, I find these earbuds well worth the price and recommend them. My review is not a comparison of the product to others but the value of my purchase. * Noise cancellation is so-so overall. It's not "true" noise cancellation but rather smooths out ambient sounds. For example, the outdoor setting is reasonable for reducing wind noise but does not eliminate it. However, I do not find stark differences between the settings. The app has been updated since my purchase a couple months ago, and my initial experience with noise reduction was better before the update(s). Users can hope for Anker to do more tweaking to improve this feature.* Fit and finish is good. The case seems sturdy and would probably easily withstand a few drops. I like the tip selection and customizing them did improve my experience, although not as dramatically as perhaps advertised. I have slept with these earbuds with no negative consequence. The tap response is satisfactory although requiring something of a firm touch - some users may appreciate this while others might prefer a lighter touch.* The app is easy to navigate and the preset equalizer settings are numerous. The various settings are unique and have a qualitative impact on sound. This is not a situation where the user changes a setting and struggles to hear the difference. I have had no problem with the buds synching with my device or with each other (e.g., one earbud works but the other does not).* Sound quality is good and provides a good range of tones. I am a bit skeptical of the "big bass," but again the setting does have an impact on sound. An audiophile should probably look elsewhere but sound quality will well satisfy most users.* The range - the distance between my device and the earbuds - is good. I am fortunate to live in a larger than average home and do not lose connection unless I am on the opposite end of the house from my device.* I have not used the wireless charging but have no reason to doubt the function. Otherwise, the battery appears to have a long-life; I have yet to experience running out of charge either with the earbuds themselves or with the case. I typically use these a few hours a day and charge the case every few weeks.* I reserve my opinion about using these earbuds on a phone call because I haven't taken a call. However, I have noticed that when my phone rings, the ringtone sounds tinny. This doesn't bode well for calls, although voices - such as audiobooks and podcasts - have a good sound.After two months of use, I recommend these earbuds and would likely buy them again (e.g., should I lose this pair). However, I paid $20 less than the current list price - a $60 purchase - and found it a very good deal. At $80, a consumer might shop a little more and possibly consider their device (Apple v. Android) and preference for better noise cancellation. Nonetheless, the average listener will be satisfied with the purchase even at the higher price point.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Incredible base, great noise cancellation, needs mute function
author: Scoobi_FreeBSD
content: These are my 1st attempt at using an ear bud-style audio device since trying the wired bluetooth kind probably 5 years ago; those had an ear hook wrapped around my ear to hold them in. Other ear buds I've tried would not stay in my ears, so I've been using over-the-ear headphones.These ear buds fit my ears pretty well; the initial rubber cups that go into the ear seemed to fit pretty well; I tried 1 size up and 1 size down, actually went with 1 size up on the left ear. The buds work themselves out of my ears when I'm chewing (not sure if that's a common problem), but otherwise they stay in place fairly well when sitting at my desk (haven't tried them at the gym yet...guess I'll have to start going again).I read the reviews on the great bass response of these buds, they're all true! I was amazed at how realistic the bass was when listening to TV shows (e.g. the scene transition sound in The Big Bang Theory). Noise cancellation is also excellent; when I turn on noise cancellation with the TV on, it's almost like someone hit the mute button (of course it's not perfect and I can still hear the TV). Noise cancellation can be customized using the downloadable mobile app to cancel specific frequencies, or to pass through voice frequencies. Battery life is excellent, lasting at least 5 hours before the buds notify me with "battery low" every 5 minutes. One bud will konk out first and the other one several minutes later. I can use the buds with a fully-charged case for several days on a single case charge, using them a few (~2-4) hours per day. Microphones are good quality; I have not had any complaints from people I've been on calls with.The buds are controlled via capacitive touch actions on the main outer body of each bud. There are 3 actions one can perform on each bud - single tap, double tap and long press. Each action can be mapped to one of a number of actions - volume up, volume down, cycle through noise cancellation modes, initiate voice assistant (e.g. Alexa or Google Home), next track, previous track, play/pause. Single tap cannot do voice assistant, as of firmware version 02.61.The case is small, about the size of a plum. I've dropped the case with the ear buds in it a couple times, no noticeable damage, but the ear buds will fly everywhere.My only complaint is with the app and a missing "mute" function which can silence all audio from a paired Bluetooth device so I can hear what someone is saying. The app is reasonably user-friendly, and you essentially need it to change noise cancellation mode between all of the available modes (there's 6). Tap actions can only move you between the 3 categories - normal (off), transparency (allow certain frequencies) and noise cancellation. It would be nice if they added a mute/unmute tap action which turns off the audio I'm listening to.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good bang for your buck
author: Katie B
content: This is my first day with them so I will update as I continue to use them.So far Iâ€™m amazed by the noise cancellation. Itâ€™s really strong especially compared to my AirPods. Although the transparency mode on them is not nearly as clean as the AirPods the noise cancellation is superior.The sound isnâ€™t super deep or captivating itâ€™s not crystal clear but it is really good. Music sounds much better than podcasts.These headphones are way better in mic quality than my beats or AirPods. On calls, the mic picks up really well and my family really enjoyed talking to me when I was wearing these over the other two brands I mentioned.After reading reviews, I bought these for the noise cancellation as I clean houses and need it to drown out the sound of the vacuum or carpet cleaner. I havenâ€™t put them through that test yet but will update as soon as I get more time with them.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Impressed
author: Haley R
content: I was skeptical at first but sound and noise cancellation are pretty good.Although using it for a phone call is not recommended as it has a lot of noise :(

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good Deal for The Money.
author: Woody D.
content: I am a former live sound engineer. To me sound quality is the number one concern. My last two sets of buds were actually sold as in ear monitors for professional musicians. One set were wired Sony's and the other Advanced AD3 wireless with a wire between the buds. Both had excellent sound quality. Since I have not had individual buds before and was afraid of losing one, I decided not to break the bank with my first pair. High end buds go for north of $200. I bought the P3s after doing quite a bit of research.When they arrived they were pretty easy to set up. The app you use with them is pretty simple. It includes a customizable EQ so you can tailor the sound to your liking. I use a "dog eared" setting boosting the bass and treble while leaving the midrange flat. The sound is really quite good.I would call the noise cancelling decent but not great. Of course in my opinion the only way you get great cancelling is with full headphones. You have a choice of different NC settings. I find the "indoor" setting works the best at the gym to somewhat drown out the music they are playing. I have not tried them on an airplane yet. As I mentioned I was afraid of losing a bud....so much that I leave them in until I get home and dump them in the charging case. When I leave the gym I just switch to the "Ambient" sound mode and I can hear the world around me pretty well. The buds work very well for phone calls. My wife says my voice sounds perfect when she calls.The controls on the buds for changing volume or tracks work ok, but are not perfect. At time I find myself just reaching for my phone to change track or adjust volume. That may be more about my gnarly fingers than the buds.I am still trying to get the pairing routine worked out. I have them paired with my phone, tablet and Peloton. I know they are supposed to pair automatically to the primary device, but I find I need to put them into pairing mode most of the time. Once paired they are rock solid....solid as in I left my phone on a machine at the gym, went to the other side of the building and they still worked.The buds fit well in my ears. I don't run, but a sweaty in the saddle, out of the saddle Peloton HIIT ride does not pop them out.The battery life seems good, but honestly I do not wear them more than a couple of hours and the rest of the time they live in their charging case.I would recommend these buds for people who want a pair of bud with good sound and don't want to break the bank to get it. They also look pretty cool.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Quality and Comfort for Under $100
author: E. J.
content: EDIT: 7/31/21. I really want to love these earbuds, but the audio keeps cutting out consistently when I use them. Iâ€™ve unpaired them from my phone several times, and deleted the device from my phone with no improvement. I still enjoy these earbuds, but I assume they are a faulty set.*Original Review*Iâ€™ve used these earbuds for almost 2 weeks and hereâ€™s my thoughts:1: Great value for the price.I preordered my pair and got a early bird discount code in my email for 20% off the day they launched. I paid around $65 when I purchased them, tax included.2: Very comfortable.These earbuds have a similar fit to AirPods Pro in the way they nestle on the outer edge of the ear canal. I wear the largest size ear tips and they fit securely. They donâ€™t â€œplugâ€ your ears, but thereâ€™s a slight suction to keep them secure with minimal pressure.3: Sound quality is top tier under $100. Compared to AirPods Pro, thereâ€™s richer bass and clarity in my opinion. I achieved this by fiddling with the EQ on the Soundcore app. The default settings are fine, but the sound profile is much more nuanced and not as compressed when you customize it for your taste. I set mine to the R&B preset and customized it.4: Excellent battery life.On my days off I always have my earbuds in listening to YouTube, Apple Music, etc., and they exceeded my expectations. I only had to recharge once every 2-3 days in the time Iâ€™ve had them. The case is fairly quick to charge and the earbuds themselves recharge fast after using them throughout the day.5: Noise cancellation is decent.The noise cancellation is detectable and can be very useful in certain environments, but donâ€™t expect complete silence while using it. The different modes are useful, but I prefer to use the indoor mode the most. I estimate about a 50-60% noise reduction when I listen to my fridge running while using the noise cancellation.6: Instant pairing.When I get ready to use the earbuds, they pair with my phone before I get to put them in my ears. The pairing and connection range is very strong and consistent.I have some small criticisms too, starting with the audio playback.1: Audio can randomly go mute while playing media for 1-2 seconds at random times throughout the day. It happens maybe 3-5 times a day and isnâ€™t intrusive, but can get annoying while you watch videos. I understand this is a new product and hopefully this will get fixed with firmware updates.2: Touch controls can be finicky (operator error)Thereâ€™s a little learning curve to double tap consistently so the earbuds can recognize it. You have to tap near the very top of the earbud stem or it wonâ€™t work. It puts pressure into your ear when you tap and the video or music may not recognize it every time.All things considered, these earbuds are a great choice for anyone balling on a budget that wants quality and comfort for under $100.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great pair of PC headsets.
author: jesus
content: So I did try to return these. Overall the sound quality is amazing and the sound isolation is not bad. While I'm used to airpods pro 2 and airpods max type of isolation. These are not bad.I mainly bought this as a replacement for my airpods pro 1 generations. As I lost them and find my was not picking up an active trace. I also use both android and iPhone so I wanted a device that essentially runs on both platforms.The case is good with strong magents to hold the ear pieces in. Good sound quality that I think most will enjoy and the features are not too bad.The only issue I had is when I was using them on my phone there was a type of glitch where sound just goes to 100% and I have to click the volume to go back to where it was. What I Mean by this is that let's say I'm watching a video or listen to music at 30% volume. Out of nowhere the audio sounds like it went to 100% which in turn hurts my ears. I then scramble to lower the volume but with one click it goes back to normal. So it wasn't really cranked up to 100% but audio did do that.With this in mind I was in the process with Amazon to return it but while I couldn't return them at the time I figured I'll hold on to them. I went and connected them to my PC and they auto connect and pair and audio plays beautifully. No hickups whatsoever. I think audio though I get more bass and voices like on a discord call while in gameplay is more closer and clear. So like fps games more roomy and bassy but the voice is contrast with clear and close. But overall they are great for PC use. I disabled the touch controls so they are a standalone Bluetooth earpiece that works seamlessly. Once you have put in the other ear in, you are already getting sound from the PC. This is great as while my overhear headsets charge, I use these and audio switches on there own.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Super good!

content: These are great for the price! they fit good super sleek appearance and clear sound super compact and quality is good

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Works, but not great.
author: Anon
content: I got this because the price was okay and it's recommended as a cheap option for audiophiles. It's an okay product, but I really dislike that it doesn't have physical buttons to press when you want to start/pause something. I disabled the touch sense stuff through the app that it works with, and it seems to ignore the settings I have input. It will still start/pause stuff sometimes, even though the buttons are tied to anything. It also tries to launch "bixby", the mobile assistant thing for Samsung. I don't want to use it - I wish it would stop trying to start on its own.They also don't fit particularly well in the ear. They are okay enough that I can run with them in, but I do have to shove them back in, occasionally because it doesn't have a perfect seal around my ear, which causes them to start slipping after a while. I've tired the various rubber sized ear things that come with it, and none of them really worked any better.The battery life is fine. No complaints.They aren't horrible, but I wish they were priced lower. The overall experience is disappointing.

content: Beats I had call clearly no noise people can hear with no problem

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great for the price range but beware the charging case.

content: No major problems with the earbuds themselves. The worst that happens is an occasional hiccup when connecting but putting them in the case and taking them out again sorts them out. Having an app to manage the eq is also great as someone who doesn't want a ton of bass.My main problem has been the quality of the case. The logo on it is just a thick plastic sticker that kept starting to peel off and jab me in the leg while in my pocket. I finally had to just remove it entirely, which only has the downsides of some glue residue and more of a gap where the sticker was.

content: These came with a charger and extra cushion things in the box for your ears, which is nice if you ask me. LOVE the color of them. I got the powder blue/baby blue and it came to be the exact same color as displayed .

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent headphones
author: Flashlight king
content: These headphones have performed excellent for me. Very good sound canceling. I really like the control in the app.What I really would like to add is these headphones are not ear protection. There is I believe a misconception about the difference between noise canceling and noise reducing. If you are mowing or using a blower etc. you need noise REDUCING. Noise cancelling is an artificial noise reduction. It does not protect your ears.I now use a 28db noise reduction over the ear earmuff with the Anker headphones underneath. This works great as I am getting really good noise reduction and still can listen to music. Only need the headphones about 1/3 volume to hear what I want to listen to. Please wear proper hearing protection. Hope this helps.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love these buds
author: Tmata
content: I have tried too many pairs of earbuds, of too many brands, and after reading many many reviews. These are my absolute favorite pair of earbuds. I purchased a pair of these a year ago after reading a Wirecutter review for earbuds in the lower price range under $100. Amazon had them on a deal and they lived up to the reviews in sound, fit and quality. Then unfortunately I misplaced them. Long story short I unknowingly dropped them getting out my car, found them crushed a month later nearby by either my car or the snow plow, the price to replace was too much, and the hunt was on for new earbud replacements. I tried a few lesser from soundcore but they weren't P3s and a few other brands but they didn't have the sound or fit I enjoyed with the Life P3s. If you want earbuds to stay in your ears while eating, bending down, exercising, or just sitting with clear sound and listening to music like it's playing live in front of you, Life P3s are the buds. These were on a "Deal" again on Amazon and I didn't hesitate to reorder a new set and it's worth every penny.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Battery Life is Amazing
author: Corey Helwig
content: Iâ€™m going to compare these to the Apple AirPods Pro, because thatâ€™s what these are replacing for me.I enjoyed my AirPods. But the battery life started off not great, and over time, the earbuds developed some crackling. Finally decided to replace them and these earbuds are what I ordered.The last month or so I used the AirPods, I had to recharge the pack pretty much everyday. The earbuds would drain quickly, Iâ€™d put them back in the the charging case, and the entire charge would be gone within 24 hours.I received these exactly 1 month ago as I write this review. I use these earbuds the same amount I used my AirPods, and Iâ€™m only just now having to plug the case in to recharge it. Itâ€™s completely blown away all my expectations.The sound quality is also much better than the AirPods. The earpieces fit in more securely, and they are equally, if not slightly more comfortable than the AirPods were. I like a lot of bass with my music and these do not disappoint. All around real great quality product and way worth the money.My main criticism is that, compared to the AirPods, the transparency modes leave something to be desired. With the AirPods, I was able to have them in, and be able to hear people talking to me, if I needed to, with the music still playing. With these, I can hear someoneâ€™s voice if theyâ€™re talking to me, but Iâ€™d have to pause whatever Iâ€™m listening to in order to actually hear them. And even at that, the voices still sound muffled in all different transparency modes. So not a dealbreaker, but definitely a little bit of a pain in that regard.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic earbuds
author: A Maurer
content: Our office rearranged the floor plan and I suddenly found myself sitting next to people who are on the phone all day long. I needed some noise canceling earbuds that would block the background noise without costing me $300. Iâ€™ve previously had first gen AirPods and my hustband has the Bose quiet comfort so I had something to compare these to. I also bought a pair of noise canceling jbl earbuds as well as the anker liberty 4 so I could try out multiple and pick which ones I like best.These were the winner for multiple reasons! First off, I genuinely like the look of these over all others I tried (Bose included). The oat white looks expensive and is discrete. Secondly, these fit my ears the best. I have small ears apparently, and the jbls and my husbands Bose quiet comfort were too large and fell out if I turned my head. I found that the anker liberty 4s were slightly more bulky which is part of the reason I ultimately chose these. Thirdly, you canâ€™t beat the price of these. I got a lightning deal that made these only $50. And finally, noise cancellation and sound quality are great! The liberty 4s and Bose block more noise but this was the right amount for me and I like that there are different modes.Highly recommend these! Definitely would not purchase another pair of AirPods again after how great these are!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Doesn't hurt and holds a charge forever
author: Failed frugalness
content: I have gone through so many headphones and earbuds. Even my shokz that don't really go on or in your ears would end up hurting after a bit. I was beginning to think I'd never be able to have Bluetooth earbuds because the weight of them was too much or they fit in such a way as to almost instantly hurt. I've had these for almost a year now. After about 7 months they started falling out more so I got the silicone tips that have sort of 2 layers to them and they stay in well. The thing is, I can wear them all day doing the shopping so I don't have to listen to Mariah sing about Christmas or elevator music, and my ears don't hurt at all. These are the first ones I've ever had that I could say that. I also have only charged the case 4 times since I bought them, and only one of those times did it get below 2 dots out of 3 for the charge! The earbuds themselves have never batted an eye at a 2 hour or more outing either.Granted, the noise blocking isn't amazing but it is fine I think. My son is a musician and he says they are ok, but not amazing. I am not as picky as he is though and I think they sound pretty good. The microphone is a typical Bluetooth microphone. People can hear and understand me most of the time but occasionally it gets overloaded by nearby noise or something and I have to use the phone directly.Overall I think they were absolutely worth it. I don't like to give 5 star reviews because I distrust most of them. I can't really think of a reason to discount one star though unless it is because they don't have the same quality as earbuds that cost more than double what these are...but nobody expects them to!

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works well, IF you can get them to fit!
author: RJM
content: These buds sound okay, but thatâ€™s not why I bought the P3â€™s. My wife snores, and I needed some way to keep my marriage intact.Previously, I had a very old pair of Bose noise cancelling wired earbuds, but the battery died, and Bose is just too expensive. So I know what good noise cancelling is like, but I wanted something at a more reasonable price point.I was pleasantly surprised at the cancelling performance of the P3 earbuds, and the battery life in noise cancelling when youâ€™re not playing music.Unfortunately, there is one problem.: the stock mushroom heads of the P3â€™s are utterly terrible. You need a good seal in your ear for the cancelling to work, and the design of the stock tips is poor. The various sizes donâ€™t work for different reasons: either they are too small, or they deform in a way that doesnâ€™t make a good seal. I think the engineers at Anker spent almost no time on the ergonomic design.Fortunately, though, I have many after market and leftover mushroom tips and I found one set that isâ€¦ well, better. I still have to keep pushing the earbuds back into my ear holes because they work loose, but I can live with that.Not that anyone will listen, but a future version of these buds should go a little deeper into your ear, and perhaps the rubber could be slightly higher density. Just as a side note, you can buy longer mushroom tips that work okay, but then the earbuds wonâ€™t fit in the charger. Dâ€™oh!

The touch controls work well but almost too well and initiate when putting them in or out of ears or adjusting them. title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good bass and noise isolation, fit well, overall a really good value
author: Finch
content: They have a bass heavy default sound profile but you can adjust it in the Soundcore app. I donâ€™t really like the controls but those too can be adjusted in the app. I got them on sale for fifty bucks and for the price theyâ€™re very good.Theyâ€™re just as comfortable and quiet as Apple AirPods Pro. I havenâ€™t tested the ANC bc I donâ€™t really use the feature but I do need the noise isolation and its very good. I wish I never wasted the money I did on Apple AirPods. These are a much better value and have no bugs.The things that I donâ€™t like about these:There is a delay when you use the touch sensitive controls, which is just the section of the earbud with the logo. Itâ€™s not the stem. You press the logo and thereâ€™s a half second delay before it takes effect. When you have to double press it makes you wonder if it worked or not. There is a setting in the app to make an audible chime when you press a button. I enabled that and it helps a little. I just wish it was a little faster.The lid on the case is a little flimsy and isnâ€™t held by a magnet. Itâ€™s just a spring loaded hinge.The sound profile is bass heavy. Adjust the highs up in the EQ in the app and it fixed it.Overall Iâ€™m very happy with them! Oh and the battery life is good, at least without ANC on. I listened to them for at least 4-5 hours straight no problem and the battery gauge said it used about half. That was an audiobook on medium volume.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fabulous Value!

I used them daily for the last 3 years and they have been beaten up, lost, found again, etc. I love the Anker products as my go-to for after market tech products without breaking the bank. The sound is much higher than the price point. They are somewhat customizable for sound and gestures to control them. They cancel noise pretty good but arenâ€™t $400 Bose or other big name brand. Iâ€™d give the noise cancellation a 8.75 or 9 on a 1-10 scale. The true test is air travel and I havenâ€™t tried them on an airplane yet.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love these!!

content: I love these! I have had a lot of different kinds and these are by far the best! They donâ€™t hurt my ears. I can talk through my phone with them and the other person has no issue hearing me. Definitely would buy again and recommend these!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wow, just wow
author: Avalon
content: Preface: I have the Sony XM4 buds right now. Not the XM3, the XM4, the brand new ones. They are the BEST sounding true wireless earbuds I have had thus far, and their battery life is no joke, I canâ€™t kill it. Their current base price is $279.99. (I purchased them for that price)I got the Life P3 for school and just general listening because I didnâ€™t want to risk losing or having my Sonyâ€™s stolen. When I paired and started listening to these earbuds, I couldnâ€™t believe how good they sounded. I actually am starting to have some buyerâ€™s remorse. I like the design of both the buds and the case, theyâ€™re quite sleek and compact. I selected the light blue color, since I donâ€™t like how darker colors show oil from my skin. They fit great and create a good seal which is vital for the best potential bass response. The bass on these buds is no joke, and thatâ€™s coming from Soundcores Signature sound profile, meaning the standard equalizer setting, no customization. Bass is responsive without being too dirty or uncontrolled, mids (where vocals live) are present and clear, and highs are reproduced well without being too sharp. Of course they donâ€™t have the same soundstage or clarity/sharpness as the Sonyâ€™s, but for less than a third of the price itâ€™s almost laughable at how good these buds are by comparison. Let me give you some of my credentials. Iâ€™ve had the:-Sony XM3 & XM4 buds-AirPod Pro-Jabra Elite 75t-Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless 2-Master & Dynamics MW08All of these are some of the best if not the best these manufacturers offer. Music is incredibly important to me and my development as a human being, so I take my sound experience very seriously, doing thorough research and actual hardware/software testing. My three points for a great pair of buds for me is sound/battery/fit. I often listen to music in bed, so fit is important not just for bass. These buds stay in place no problem. The Life P3 companion app by Soundcore is also incredibly useful and modern in its aesthetics and overall design language. It puts the most important settings right in front without being flashy or gimmicky. A great overall experience both for the hardware and software.In short, if you want a great pair of wireless earbuds with great customizable sound, great fit with multiple eartip sizes included in box, good battery life with a case that has wireless charging, and a great app/software experience, look no further. YOU FOUND IT! A great accomplishment for Soundcore and one of the best audio values for consumers.

And I just found them today at my church, buried 10 yards apart. (Because people had parked their cars and driven over them.)I popped them back into the case and 2 minutes later took them out and they both immediately connected to my phone at %100 battery. CRISP sound and no problem noise canceling.Soundcore you have my loyalty, if you ever need poetry about earbuds you know me.Tl;DrEarbuds still work after being lost in a couple of storms and being runover by multiple times by cars. I now write sonnets about inanimate objects.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) Review
author: nachum zlotnick
content: The Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) have been a popular choice among wireless earbud users since their release. Here's a detailed review covering various aspects:#### Design and Build Quality- **Design**: The AirPods maintain the iconic, minimalist design with a white finish. They are compact, lightweight, and fit comfortably in most ears.- **Build Quality**: They are made of high-quality plastic, which feels durable and premium. The magnetic case is sturdy and ensures the earbuds stay in place.#### Sound Quality- **Audio Performance**: The sound quality is clear and well-balanced, suitable for a wide range of music genres. The bass is adequate, though not as deep as some premium alternatives.- **Microphone**: The microphone quality is excellent for calls, thanks to beamforming technology that reduces background noise.#### Connectivity- **Bluetooth**: The 2nd Generation AirPods use Bluetooth 5.0, providing a stable and efficient connection. Pairing is seamless, especially with Apple devices due to the H1 chip.- **H1 Chip**: This chip allows for faster and more stable wireless connections, improved sound quality, and hands-free "Hey Siri" support.#### Battery Life- **Earbuds**: The earbuds offer up to 5 hours of listening time on a single charge.- **Charging Case**: The case provides multiple additional charges, extending the total battery life to more than 24 hours.- **Charging Options**: The case charges via a Lightning connector, and there is a wireless charging case available as an optional upgrade.#### Features- **Automatic Ear Detection**: The AirPods automatically pause playback when you remove them from your ears and resume when you put them back in.- **Touch Controls**: You can double-tap to play or skip forward.- **Hey Siri**: Voice-activated Siri support allows for hands-free control.#### Compatibility- **Apple Ecosystem**: Seamless integration with iPhones, iPads, Macs, and Apple Watches. Pairing is quick and easy, with automatic device switching.- **Android Devices**: The AirPods can be used with Android devices, though some features like automatic ear detection and Siri are not available.#### Pros and Cons**Pros:**- Seamless integration with Apple devices- Good sound quality- Long battery life with the charging case- Comfortable fit- Reliable connectivity with the H1 chip- Hands-free Siri support**Cons:**- Expensive compared to other wireless earbuds- Limited customization of touch controls- No active noise cancellation (ANC)- The white color can get dirty easily- Not ideal for audiophiles seeking superior sound quality#### ConclusionThe Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) are a solid choice for anyone deeply integrated into the Apple ecosystem, offering convenience, decent sound quality, and excellent connectivity. However, if you are looking for advanced features like noise cancellation or superior audio performance, you might want to consider other options or the AirPods Pro.Overall, they are a reliable and user-friendly option for everyday use, especially for those who prioritize convenience and seamless integration with their Apple devices.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars **â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸ Best Wireless Earbuds I've Ever Owned!**
author: Christopher Domenici
content: I recently purchased the Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds, and I couldn't be happier with my decision. From the moment I unboxed them, I was impressed with their sleek design and the effortless setup process. Within seconds, they were seamlessly paired with my iPhone, and I was ready to enjoy my music, podcasts, and calls.The sound quality is outstanding, delivering clear, crisp audio with a balanced bass that enhances every listening experience. Whether I'm listening to my favorite tunes, taking an important call, or catching up on the latest podcast, the sound is always top-notch.The fit is incredibly comfortable, even during extended use. They stay securely in place whether I'm working out, commuting, or just relaxing at home. The battery life is impressive, providing hours of uninterrupted listening, and the charging case is a game-changer. Just a quick charge gives me hours of use, making them perfect for long days on the go.One of the standout features is the seamless integration with Siri. Voice commands work flawlessly, making it easy to control my music, make calls, and check messages without having to reach for my phone. The built-in microphones ensure my voice comes through loud and clear, even in noisy environments.Overall, the Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) have exceeded my expectations in every way. They are the perfect combination of style, convenience, and superior sound quality. I highly recommend them to anyone looking for high-quality wireless earbuds. Well done, Apple!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very practical
author: renee
content: Taking the Apple AirPods at face value, they're a solid headset for the money! If you already have the original, first generation AirPods and just want to upgrade, not a bad option either. The 2nd generation AirPods feature an improved software chip & runs off of BlueTooth 5.0 vs 4.1 (Gen 1). The software chip allows a faster, stronger, and more stable connection with your device(s). This particular item for $139.00 does NOT feature the wireless charging case. This one must be plugged in via USB (cable provided in the box) to an outlet or USB port. The wireless charging case model is $169. Now if you're looking to upgrade to the wireless charging case later on, you can. Apple does sell it separately. If you want the wireless charging option right out of the box, I recommend sending the $169 vs the $139 product here.Sound quality: Straight out of the box, sound is pretty solid. No crackles, static, pops, or any abnormal noises created by the more economic-friendly headsets. You have a lot more adjustability & tuning capabilities if paired on an iOS/Apple device vs using for example paired with an Android OS device. So, ultimately Apple users may or may not get a better sound quality experience.Noise cancellation: AirPods do fit fairly well in the ear without having to be jammed inside your ear canal. Generally they create a snug fit using Apple's "universal" earphone design, it is one size fits most not one size fits all. Some users have upgraded or opted to spend the additional funds on a set of AirPods Pro due to the rubber tips for a better/snug fit. I believe only the AirPods Pro currently has an active noise cancellation utilizing two microphones but I would double-check Apple for accurate information. Also, for Android users. The Galaxy buds by Samsung feature active noise cancellation & wireless charging case on every model so you might want to look into that product before making a final purchase.Battery life: For optimal battery life, I highly recommend charging both AirPods inside the case. The case itself is a battery pack with a life. So if one or both AirPods are low on battery, you can toss them in the case and charge them up. Apple I believe rates 5 minutes of charging time is equivalent to 1 hour of talk/listening time and 15 minutes of charging time is equivalent to 2 hours of talk/listening. I'm sure this is accurate when they're brand new but I'm sure like anything, normal ware & tare might diminish that over time.Warranty: Apple provides a 1-year standard manufacturer's warranty on this product. This ONLY covers defects/defaults from the manufacturer. This will NOT cover physical and/or liquid damages to AirPods, case, or charging cable included.AppleCare: It's $29.00 and 2 years and well worth the extra money. You're already spending this kind of money on a headset, may as well have protection. We get it, accidents happen! But protect yourself and get your AirPods repaired/replaced at no additional cost to YOU! There is no additional fees or deductibles involved.AppleCare tips:You don't have to install AppleCare right away. You have 60 days from the original purchase date to contact Apple by providing your AirPods serial number (on outside of the box) and Apple will tell you if you're still eligible.You can renew AppleCare for another 2 years for the same fee of $29.00 provided you want to keep the same product. If you decide to upgrade to the AirPods Pro or whatever the latest model is, you would have to purchase AppleCare for that specific product.You can go into an Apple store location and get live repair/replacement on your AirPods.Using AirPods with Android:Apple has allowed Android and other non-iOS devices to use AirPods since the AirPods pair/connect via BlueTooth.If you're using AirPods on an Android platform such as Samsung or LG for example there's 2 ways to pair the headset to your device. You either turn on BlueTooth on your device, pop both AirPods inside your ear, find "AirPods" under available connections, and connect. Or you might have to pair manually using the button on the AirPods case to make available, pair, and connect.FAIR WARNING:You will NOT have access to all features that the AirPods have to offer on an Apple/iOS device. You will be limited on functions you can perform.I was able to find an app on Google play store for $1.99 called "AirPopUp". It is a paid application that unlock access to certain/more features of the AirPods similar to what an Apple/iOS device would be granted. Be aware that you will NOT have access nor the ability to have every single feature since you're not on Apple's network. There may be other apps (most likely paid applications) you'd have to find that may unlock more features such as: AirPods battery life percentage, case battery life percentage, programming LEFT & RIGHT AirPods for certain function(s), skipping/pausing/resetting songs, answer/decline/hang up phone calls, find my AirPods, and more.For Samsung users specifically, you might want to look into the Galaxy Buds. They're a little cheaper than AirPods, I believe Amazon has them for $109.99 + $22 3-Year insurance through Assurion that does cover physical/liquid/accidental damage just like AirPods.Galaxy Buds features:Made by SamsungAudio powered by AKGRubber ear bud tipsPair with Samsung device to get the mostWireless charging caseActive noise cancellationComes in multiple colors (black/white/silver/yellow/red & black combo with Star Wars edition Galaxy Note 10+)Includes changing cord and replacement rubber earbud tips.I know if you pair the Galaxy Buds with a Samsung device it will automatically download an application titled "Galaxy Wearable". This allows users to check battery life status of the case and each bud, prompts you for software updates, ability to program LEFT & RIGHT earbuds to do certain function(s), answer/decline/hang up phone calls, pause/skip/reset songs.Apple may charge a lot of money for their products on accessories but they never fall short of being a revolutionary, well-designed, reliable product that works as advertised.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect balance of convenience and comfort
author: Vinay Medishetty
content: The media could not be loaded. I recently purchased the Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) and couldn't be happier with my decision. These wireless earbuds deliver on all fronts, offering both exceptional sound quality and unmatched convenience.**Pros:**1. **Effortless Setup:** Pairing the AirPods with my iPhone was a breeze. The instant connection feature is a game-changer, making it incredibly easy to switch between devices.2. **Battery Life:** The battery life is impressive, lasting over 24 hours with the included Lightning charging case. I can go days without needing to recharge, which is perfect for my on-the-go lifestyle.3. **Sound Quality:** The sound quality is excellent, providing clear, crisp audio whether I'm listening to music, podcasts, or taking calls. The built-in microphone also works well for voice commands and phone conversations.4. **Comfort:** The design of the AirPods ensures a comfortable fit, even during extended use. They stay in place during workouts and daily activities.5. **Portability:** The compact size of the AirPods and the charging case make them incredibly portable. They easily fit into my pocket or bag, ready for use whenever I need them.**Cons:**1. **Price:** While the AirPods are a bit pricey compared to other wireless earbuds on the market, I believe the quality and convenience justify the cost.2. **Customization:** There are limited options for customizing the sound profile. However, the default settings are satisfactory for most users.Overall, the Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) are a fantastic investment for anyone seeking high-quality wireless earbuds. They offer a seamless experience with Apple devices, excellent battery life, and superior sound quality. Highly recommended!

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great Sound and Convenience with Minor Drawbacks
author: Adam Abdou-Gustavson
content: I've been using the Apple AirPods 2nd Generation for a few months now, and overall, I'm very pleased with my purchase. These earbuds offer a lot of convenience and solid performance.Pros:Sound Quality: The audio quality is excellent, with clear highs and balanced mids. Theyâ€™re great for listening to music, podcasts, and making phone calls.Seamless Connectivity: Pairing the AirPods with my iPhone and other Apple devices is incredibly smooth. The instant connection and switching between devices are standout features.Comfort and Fit: They fit comfortably in my ears and stay in place during workouts. I can wear them for hours without any discomfort.Battery Life: The battery life is impressive. I get several hours of continuous use, and the charging case provides multiple additional charges, making them perfect for long days and travel.Siri Integration: Hands-free Siri access is a handy feature, allowing me to control music, make calls, and get information without needing to touch my phone.Cons:Lack of Noise Cancellation: Unlike the Pro version, these AirPods donâ€™t have active noise cancellation. While they do a decent job of passive noise isolation, itâ€™s not enough in noisy environments.Price: Theyâ€™re a bit on the expensive side, especially considering the lack of noise cancellation. There are other earbuds with similar or better features at a lower price point.Fit May Vary: While they fit my ears well, Iâ€™ve heard from friends that they donâ€™t fit everyone perfectly. Itâ€™s worth trying them on before committing to a purchase.In summary, the Apple AirPods 2nd Generation offer great sound quality, convenience, and battery life, making them a solid choice for anyone in the Apple ecosystem. While they lack some advanced features like noise cancellation, they still provide a fantastic listening experience and seamless integration with Apple devices.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great headphones
author: Sebastian
content: I bought these over 2 years ago and they still work great. They were originally a gift for my mom but she ended up preferring wired headphones so I kept them. I use them for the gym almost every day and theyâ€™re still going strong. I recommend everyone get these. The only problem is sometimes when youâ€™re sweaty they will slip out. Other than that theyâ€™re great. The sound quality is fantastic and they last a long time without having to charge.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality and price
author: Ruby
content: Most â€œofficialâ€ websites and stores have these at around $200 when these are the exact same. The sound quality is great and the charging is very fast. The fit is alright but thatâ€™s on Apple, I guess. The volume control is a little weird since the left one is slightly louder but you canâ€™t really tell unless youâ€™re really paying attention to it.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing Upgrade â€“ Worth Every Penny!
author: Casey Kimbro
content: I recently upgraded to the AirPods Pro 2, and I couldn't be happier with my decision! These earbuds are a significant improvement over the original AirPods Pro, and here's why they deserve five stars:**Exceptional Sound Quality:** The sound quality on the AirPods Pro 2 is phenomenal. The audio is crisp, clear, and well-balanced across all frequencies. Whether I'm listening to music, podcasts, or taking calls, everything sounds fantastic.**Superior Noise Cancellation:** The noise cancellation on these is next level. They effectively block out background noise, making my commute and work environment much more pleasant. The transparency mode is also improved, allowing me to hear my surroundings clearly when needed.**Comfortable Fit:** The redesigned ear tips and overall fit are incredibly comfortable. I can wear them for hours without any discomfort, and they stay securely in place during workouts and runs.**Long Battery Life:** The battery life has seen a noticeable upgrade. I can use them throughout the day with no worries about running out of charge. The quick charge feature is also a lifesaver for those times when I forget to charge them overnight.**Seamless Connectivity:** As expected from Apple, the connectivity is seamless. Pairing them with my iPhone and other Apple devices is effortless, and the connection remains stable even at a distance.**Sleek Design:** The design of the AirPods Pro 2 is sleek and stylish. The case is compact and easy to carry around, and the earbuds themselves look great.**Enhanced Features:** The new features like spatial audio and adaptive EQ make a noticeable difference in the listening experience. It feels like the sound is coming from all around me, providing an immersive experience.Overall, the AirPods Pro 2 is a fantastic upgrade that has exceeded my expectations in every way. They offer excellent sound quality, superb noise cancellation, and a comfortable fit, making them worth every penny. Highly recommended for anyone looking to elevate their audio experience!---I hope this review meets your needs! If you'd like any changes or additional details, just let me know.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Seamless Connectivity and Great Sound Quality
author: Candace Pruett
content: I was initially skeptical about getting the Apple AirPods (2nd Generation), but now I don't know why I waited so long. These wireless earbuds have exceeded my expectations in every way.One of the standout features is how seamlessly they connect to my phone. As soon as I take them out of the case, they automatically connect, making it incredibly convenient to use. The wireless aspect is a game-changer, allowing me to listen without any cords getting in the way.The fit is perfect for my ears, and they stay securely in place, even during workouts or when I'm on the go. The sound quality is excellent, delivering clear and crisp audio for both music and calls.Another feature I love is the ability to connect the AirPods to my phone to locate them if they ever go missing. This has saved me from losing them on more than one occasion.Overall, I am very satisfied with my purchase. The Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) offer seamless connectivity, great sound quality, and the convenience of a wireless design. Highly recommended for anyone looking to upgrade their listening experience.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Game Changer for My Daily Commute!
author: misty
content: I recently upgraded to the Apple AirPods (2nd Generation), and I am absolutely thrilled with my purchase! These AirPods have genuinely transformed my daily routine in several ways.Sound Quality: The sound quality is phenomenal. Whether I'm listening to music, podcasts, or making calls, the clarity and depth are outstanding. The bass is punchy without being overwhelming, and the mids and highs are crisp.Comfort and Fit: I was worried about how they would fit since I have small ears, but these AirPods sit comfortably and securely. I can wear them for hours without any discomfort, which is a huge plus for long commutes or work sessions.Battery Life: The battery life is impressive. I get around 5 hours of listening time on a single charge, and the charging case provides multiple recharges, extending the total battery life to more than 24 hours. Plus, the quick charge feature is super handy when I'm in a rush.Convenience: The seamless integration with my iPhone is another big win. The AirPods automatically connect as soon as I put them in my ears, and switching between my devices is effortless. Siri support is also a great feature for hands-free control.Design and Build: The design is sleek and minimalistic, and the build quality feels premium. The charging case is compact and fits easily into my pocket.Overall, the Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) have exceeded my expectations. They are a bit pricey, but the convenience, sound quality, and seamless Apple ecosystem integration make them well worth the investment. Highly recommended!

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fit and lightweight
author: LJA
content: After ordering these, I found out that they are NOT water or moisture resistant at all. I was initially buying them in large part for my workouts so now I have to be concerned about sweat damaging them. I had planned to return them, but I fallen in love. They are so lightweight and itâ€™s great for work because I can leave them in all day without that bothersome earphone discomfort. They do not block out noice but i prefer this for my use. The left one feels a bit loose, but everybodyâ€™s ears are different.I did stop at the Apple Store to try on the AirPod 3 - but I just donâ€™t like the way it feels or fits. The 3 however does sound even better and love the shorter stems. Best of all - water proof. But the 3 kept falling out of my ears too easily. So Iâ€™ve decided to keep the airpod 2 even though its 5 yrs old. While the sound quality is not as good for sure - Itâ€™s still good

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Still Good Airpods Even In 2024
author: Sand
content: This is my first time ordering Airpods through Amazon. I was nervous because even though I've been a prime member since 2017, I usually buy Apple products straight from the Apple Store. But the packaging was new as described and the product meets my expectations all while being heavily discounted compared to the original price.The 2nd generation Airpods may have been released in early 2019, but even today they still deliver great value. I like the sound and the fit is great. They're intuitive to connect to any Apple product and I like incorporating them into my Apple ecosystem. I would recommend these to anyone looking for Airpods who is on a budget.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money
author: Elijah
content: Iâ€™ve personally wanted air pods for a while, so recently Iâ€™ve gotten a job, and now, able to afford them I bought them. And let me tell you they are worth the hours I put in. The sound is great. You have to get used to the comfort. Really easy to use daily, just pop them in and you listening to music, talking on calls, or watching videos. They charge super fast, and the case acts like a backup if the pods die on the go, very convenient. Over all, great product, would recommend.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Almost perfect. Definitely better than 1st gen.
author: Richard
content: I like this particular design as it allows me to still hear my surroundings. I use them to listen to my computer while I play music on my stereo in the background. I also don't feel them in my ear which is super nice. Over the ear headphones get too warm and uncomfortable, and in ear earbuds block out sound and get uncomfortable over extended use, so these are perfect. These also stay connected compared to my first ten AirPods which would constantly drop the connection. My only gripe is when I attempt to stream Spotify on my iPhone to my home stereo the AirPods will take over and connect if I am wearing them while using them for the computer, so I have to go back into Spotify on my phone and reconnect it to the stereo. Not the end of the world, but I wish there was a way to prevent that from happening. It would be great if you could disable auto connect by app. That said, I love these.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Purchased these in Nov 2019 & still going strong
author: Melanie Hawthorne
content: I bought my 2nd gen Airpods back in 2019 and never expected for them to last this long. (In fact, I was a skeptic when Apple first announced how these things would stay in your ears.) Sounds quality hasn't diminished over time. It picks up ambient sound pretty well, sometimes making it hard for the caller to hear you. Sometimes it has a muted sound and the caller will say you sound muffled. So it's not perfect as a mic device but functions well enough most of the time that it's not a problem. Audio quality to me is great. Never have an issue with sound, music, or hearing a caller. They're not really noise-canceling, so if you're looking for that, you'll be disappointed. However, I've found that if I up the volume, it will drown out loud sounds. I don't like my volume extremely loud since I like to be able to hear what's going on around me, but for trains or large trucks rumbling by, the volume is excellent and still retains good quality. (Not that distortion sound that comes with playing music too loud.)Overall, I'd recommend. I've had this for nearly 5 years (bought it for myself as a Black Friday gift!), and I don't regret it. I see no need to upgrade to a Pro. Audiophiles may want surround sound type thing, in which I'd recommend a Pro, but 2nd gen works well enough for me (until prices drop for some of the newer ones).

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far very good
author: User
content: Smooth integration with IOS, they automatically turn on/off so no need to play with settings. People have said the call quality is excellent, and even the battery life of the buds and case (which are different) show up in IOS for a quick reading. Apparently the case gets charged, and the buds charge from the case making it an independent power source for them. Very clever. So far would recommend, especially if on sale.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty good for $80
author: Rami
content: So I owned the 1st gen AirPod Pros but my left bud appeared to have disappeared with the wind, along with the bad battery life it also had, I needed to look for something new.Not looking to blow $200 on a new pair of Pros as I just needed something thatâ€™ll work for now, I saw these on sale and decided to buy them.Now, are these as good as the Pros? Absolutely not. Are they good for the price? Yep. For $80 I really canâ€™t complain, theyâ€™re not amazing but not bad either.If you just need something that works, go for it! If you need something more, you might have better luck looking at the 3rd Gens or the 2nd Gen Pros.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Work
author: Eleanor F. Tate
content: I actually bought them for myself but once again my grandson used his that I brought for him so much that they messed up so now heâ€™s had he has those that belong to me. Itâ€™s a good product specially for kids or teenagers because they use them constantly and youâ€™re buying them constantly, But you do get your moneys worth that is for sure for as much as it is being used

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent!
author: S
content: This AirPod should be the easiest to use and operate, the first thing to do is to connect the airpod Bluetooth to the iPhone, and then it will automatically connect to the phone every time you use the AirPod, the round AirPod is very comfortable to wear, the power can last for several hours, and the voice of the phone is very clear. It also charges quickly

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds are fantastic!
author: cfalkon
content: I recently upgraded to the Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) Wireless Ear Buds with the Lightning Charging Case, and they have been amazing. The sound quality is exceptional, with clear highs, rich mids, and deep bass. Pairing with my Apple devices is seamless and switching between them is effortless.The design is stylish and incredibly comfortable, even for long periods. The wireless connectivity is reliable, and the Lightning Charging Case provides multiple charges on the go. The quick charge feature is very convenient, giving hours of use from just a few minutes of charging.Siri integration and intuitive touch controls add to the overall convenience, making these earbuds perfect for any situation. I highly recommend the Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) for their outstanding sound quality, seamless connectivity, and user-friendly features.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great product
author: Tammy
content: I got these for my daughter for Christmas but unfortunately had to return them. She wanted the AirPods Pro but these were great quality and comfortable. She has little ears and fit her comfortably without falling out. They are super easy to charge with great sound quality. They did block out some noise not completely but they are not noise blocking either so I didn't expect them to. Hope this review helps.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far so good.
author: Marti
content: I have resisted getting AirPods, choosing instead to use the wired ear phones. My reason is that I misplace or just lose things often, and losing on AirPod is fatal to using them - or so I thought. Surprise! I am able to hear the audio even if one has fallen out (or maybe gets lost). This is great.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great Product
author: Misagp
content: I tried many cheaper versions of bluetooth earbuds, but they are all touchy and annoyingly glitchy, compared to AirPods, which are just awesome! Pairs perfectly, just as most Apple products do. You can program them to do various things when you tap them, so you don't have to do everything through the phone. The voice recognition is very handy when driving and you need Siri to do something for you. The mic is a little quiet on phone calls, so I cup my hand to my mouth to direct sound to them when needed.After a while though, my left ear is sore from the shape of the earbud. It's probably just my ear shape. Still not interested in paying more for the smaller, more cushy ones. Hundreds of dollars is ridiculous.I recommend getting the little silicone case cover, as it helps you find the item, clip it to your phone, etc. Keep them clean, don't get them wet, don't store them in pockets and lose them. They seem to survive small drops. They do have a feature that makes noise to help you find them, but only if they still have some charge in their batteries.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent ear buds, except...
author: Ted M
content: I have forever used a pair of noise-cancelling headphones for air-travel. They are obviously bulky, but fit into my briefcase nonetheless. At first pass, I was extremely impressed out of the box! Great sound, bass, and comfort. I then put my new AirPods to the test on a recent domestic flight. Unfortunately, I was unimpressed with entire lack of noise cancellation, and the need to turn the volume darn near all the way up just to hear audible voices in movies.I can't imagine working out in these (bouncing around), but I can see where these would serve well elsewhere. I will make these work for my international flight... using the AirPods as my sole source for music and such. They are incredibly small and compact for travel, and hold an outstanding battery charge. Glad I purchased these... just not my go-to for preferred (again), air-travel purposes.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wireless Freedom and Crystal-Clear Sound - Apple AirPods 2nd Gen Redefine the Earbud Experience
author: Danny
content: The Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) are a game-changer in the world of wireless earbuds, offering a seamless and immersive audio experience that sets a new standard for convenience and sound quality. With their intelligent design, easy setup, and exceptional performance, these earbuds are a must-have accessory for anyone seeking unparalleled audio freedom.The standout feature of the Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) is their effortless wireless connectivity. With the proprietary Apple H1 chip, pairing the AirPods with your iPhone, iPad, or Apple Watch is a breeze. The moment you open the case, the AirPods automatically connect to your device, allowing you to enjoy your favorite music, podcasts, and calls instantly. The seamless transition between devices ensures a hassle-free and uninterrupted listening experience.The AirPods deliver crystal-clear sound quality that elevates your music and audio content. With custom-designed drivers and enhanced bass response, the earbuds produce rich, full-bodied sound that captivates your senses. Whether you're listening to your favorite tunes, watching movies, or making phone calls, the AirPods deliver impeccable sound that immerses you in the moment.The AirPods are designed to adapt to your needs. Thanks to built-in optical sensors and motion accelerometers, the earbuds know when they are in your ears and automatically pause playback when you remove them. This smart feature not only saves battery life but also ensures that you never miss a beat when you need to take a break from listening.Apple's signature Siri voice assistant is seamlessly integrated into the AirPods. With just a double-tap, you can activate Siri to control your music, make calls, check the weather, and more, all without needing to take out your iPhone. The hands-free operation adds convenience to your daily routine and allows you to stay connected and informed while on the go.The AirPods' charging case provides extended battery life, ensuring that your earbuds are always ready to use. With up to 5 hours of listening time and more than 24 hours of total battery life when using the charging case, you can enjoy your favorite audio content throughout the day without worrying about running out of power.The sleek and minimalistic design of the AirPods complements any style. The earbuds fit comfortably in your ears and stay securely in place, making them suitable for all-day wear. Additionally, the AirPods are sweat and water-resistant, making them ideal for workouts and outdoor activities.In conclusion, the Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) redefine the earbud experience, offering a perfect blend of convenience, sound quality, and intelligent features. With effortless wireless connectivity, crystal-clear sound, and seamless integration with Siri, these earbuds provide a truly immersive and enjoyable audio experience. Whether you're a music lover, podcast enthusiast, or simply seeking a reliable hands-free accessory, the AirPods are the epitome of wireless earbuds done right. Experience the freedom of wireless audio with the Apple AirPods and elevate your listening experience to new heights.
