title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Compared to 4 other Earbuds...
author: Connor
content: I bought these earbuds along with 4 other pairs, with the intent of comparing them over a couple weeks and returning all but my favorite. Here were the results:Beats Fit Pro - https://www.amazon.com/dp/B09JL65GNM?psc=1&ref=ppx_yo2ov_dt_b_product_detailsPros â€“ These buds had some great base, and the wingtip gave them a fit that made them refuse to fall out of my ears. But the best feature? Physical â€œclickyâ€ buttons on each one of the buds. You press in and hear/feel the click, rather than relying on a touchscreen-like feature. No need to guess if you tapped them once or twice, you will know.Cons â€“ The wingtip gives a very sturdy fit, but not the most comfortable. I wouldnâ€™t recommend to anyone with smaller ears. The noise canceling was solid, but nothing special. And this may be picky, but I didnâ€™t care for most of the color schemes available. I prefer my earbuds to be hard to notice, and even the black ones have a bright red letter â€œbâ€ in the middle.Beats Studio Buds - https://www.amazon.com/dp/B096SV8SJG?psc=1&ref=ppx_yo2ov_dt_b_product_detailsPros â€“ Very comfortable with the same great physically â€œclickyâ€ buttons as the Beats Fit Pro. Noise canceling seemed slightly better than average. Great base. Classic look.Cons â€“ Tested during a workout, a little bit of sweat had these sliding right out of my ear. The case for these earbuds also was the flimsiest of any I had tested, with a very weak hinge that I was scared of breaking off within the 2 weeks of using.Samsung Galaxy Buds Pro - https://www.amazon.com/dp/B08MWZHHKP?psc=1&ref=ppx_yo2ov_dt_b_product_detailsPros â€“ A neat feature that I noticed only in these earbuds was that it had noise amplification as well as noise cancelation. With one swipe in the app, the surrounding sound was actually louder and clearer than it would be without the earbuds in. Great if you are hard of hearing, or just enjoy snooping on conversations out of reach.Cons â€“ Similar to the Beats Studio Buds, these didnâ€™t stay in during a workout. They were usable, but every 10 minutes I found myself pushing them back into my ear. And this is an opinion, but these are the ugliest earbuds out of the bunch. The shiny black gleam made it look like a large beetle was hanging out in my ear. No visible brand placement either, which makes them appear cheap and generic rather than the quality Samsung they are.Samsung Galaxy Buds Live - https://www.amazon.com/dp/B09TBM1L3S?psc=1&ref=ppx_yo2ov_dt_b_product_detailsPros â€“ Cost effective! I added these to the test group because of the unique shape, and for that they are worth giving a try. If you have small ears and do not like the rubber insert that is standard in most other earbuds, these may be perfect for you.Cons â€“ Poor fit for large ears. These were tested the least of all of the buds, because the fit was so bad for my ear shape that they wouldnâ€™t stay in if I turned my head too fast.Bose QuietComfort - https://www.amazon.com/dp/B08C4KWM9T?psc=1&ref=ppx_yo2ov_dt_b_product_detailsPros â€“ Bose noise canceling is unmatched. If your primary use for earbuds is to cancel out that background white noise, this is the pair for you. The sound quality is great, not too heavy on the base. The case for the earbuds stood out from the rest as the only one that impressed me. Felt very study, and I had no worries tossing it into a gym bag or cup holder. The only case with a button latch to make sure it doesnâ€™t open accidentally.Cons â€“ This was the most expensive pair of earbuds by a longshot, and there were still some things I felt could be improved. The rubber inserts had more of a â€œflayedâ€ shape rather than the â€œroundedâ€ shape that is standard. My guess is that this was by design, because the earbuds were also slightly heavier than others and may need that extra in-ear grip. The flayed shape did make them sturdier, but at the cost of them being uncomfortable in an active situation. They were also the largest earbuds, and stuck out from the side of my head further than I would have liked.My favorite? The beats fit pro! While I wouldnâ€™t recommend this pair for everyone, it was perfect for my routine. My music taste benefits from the boosted base, and the wingtip shape was perfect for any workouts. The feature that really convinced me was the physical buttons, something that I didnâ€™t realize how desperately I needed.
product_attributes: Color: BlackStyle: Studio BudsSet: Without AppleCare+

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Initial review and comparison to other brands
author: philip seitz
content: I love these earbuds. They feel definitely worth the price and a all around great buy. Giving me exactly what I was looking for.For years I have used the raycon E55 and some of the features I loved about raycon was the manual button in the earbuds, excessive bass and great inside-ear fit.Recently however, raycon has gone the way of the worldâ€” they have put sensors on the earbuds in the place of buttons and Balanced out the audio. So I began my search for new earbuds.â€”THE SOUNDâ€”Both the AirPods, galaxybuds and raycons I have tried tend to be balanced and prioritize giving equal notes to all instruments For a clear and concise sound, But to someone who is not an audiophile it sounds very flat and devoid of the punch that I desire. For me- I want it to be great sounding but also noticeably bass heavy. These Beats Studio buds deliver. The company recognizes that your not using these to analyze a song. These are for the people who like bass and want to feel some gravitas in their ears!â€”CONNECTIVITYâ€”These connect effortlessly to iPhone, as if they were AirPods. It was the single biggest factor that blew me away with these. They are incredibly easy to connect. I cannot speak for android but these work great. They do not have a lot of audio adjustments like Bose but I frankly donâ€™t need them to. You can easily see the battery state on both buds and the case from a pop up window in your apple home screen whenever opening the case, just like AirPods.â€”FITâ€”The fit is not as good as the raycon E55 but only by a little bit. They fit snuggly in your ears well enough that they do not fall off when running and working out. Although adjustments might need to be made to them occasionally. (I have small ears, so the fit is review as such)â€”THE CONTROLSâ€”The controls are simple and straightforward. They are just like what you come to expect from earbuds. Single tap, double tap, triple tap.The earbuds HAVE AN ACTUAL BUTTONâ€¦ which I thought was extinct, I personally hate the sensor buttons because adjusting your earbuds in your ears would trigger the controls.While these do have a very sensitive physical buttonâ€” it is easy to avoid while adjusting with practice.â€”BATTERYâ€”The battery lasts me all day, what more do you want?â€”RANGEâ€”Very good, about 30+ feetâ€”CONSâ€”-no MagSafe compatible charging-fit isnâ€™t as perfect as some brands but is really good-if your an audiophile these earbuds are not balancedFinal call-If you like bass, and hate the sensor controls on most earbudsâ€” these very well could be the best earbuds you could get. These are on par with earbuds in the 200$ range. And if your anything like me, you will love them! And if not, they might still be worth it to youâ€”UPDATEâ€”they have a hard time staying in when working out, and so I had to buy wing tips for these. They automatically have active noise cancellation on when you take them out of the caseâ€¦ which I personally hate.And the cases battery is pretty short livedâ€¦ only lasts two days generally
product_attributes: Color: BlackStyle: Studio BudsSet: Without AppleCare+

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Quality sound and build, BUT...
author: Everest
content: After using these for a couple weeks straight, I think it's time to review.I would like to state upfront that I bought these on sale for $75. I bought the black ones because the pink ones weren't on sale.Let's start with some pros:The sound is very good, just about on par with my IEMs. These are definitely catered towards more bassy genres, but in the case of metal, I like being able to hear bass along side lead, and provides some heavy kicks. The physical button instead of just touch is an odd choice, but it works. The package comes with a free trial of Apple music (which I will never use), as well as a tiny usb-c to usb-c charger (so hopefully you have a spare usb-c block), and 3 different sized tips, small, meduim, and large. These have awareness mode, as well as a noise isolation mode. Awareness mode is nice, but noise isolation causes me to have a headache.Now some cons:This may be just my ears, but the small tip is too small, and the medium is just big enough to still be pushed out. The body is very smooth, and if you're someone that produces a lot of earwax (like me), it won't stay put and the only thing keeping it in is the tips, meaning you have to keep pushing them back in, and bumping the button. These sit in a very specific position, but don't really like to stay there. Because of the sound mostly being catered towards bass, some leads and vocals can sound a bit muddy at times. By default, the case doesn't have a loop for a string to hold on to and the case is very smooth, so you have to buy a third party case and put it over the stock case just to make it easier to hold on to. These come with an app, and it's very lackluster. No equalizer, there's a find earbuds feature but I'm pretty sure it's not GPS, and you can't mess with settings if the earbuds aren't connected, not to mention: why do my earbuds need to update?!In conclusion: these are good earbuds and I recommend them, but ONLY IF THEY'RE ON SALE.These are 100% worth the $75 I spent on them, but NO WAY ARE THEY WORTH THE $150 RETAIL PRICE TAG.
product_attributes: Color: BlackStyle: Studio BudsSet: Without AppleCare+

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent -- Budget Friendly -- Good Review from a Beats Fan Girl and Audiophile
author: Mary Trotta
content: Been a few months (May 2024) since the purchase so I wanted to give a nice, solid review.Battery life --- Excellent. 5 starsRange From Phone/Case --- Excellent. 5 starsStability --- Excellent. 5 starsCharging --- Excellent. 5 starsSound Quality --- Excellent. 5 stars (especially if you aren't an audiophile. We're picky and hard to please so don't listen to our complaints as closely. Leave those for the audiophiles to read about.Connectivity --- Excellent. 5 stars.With that said ...If you need something to work out in, live in a hot environment and are cleaning your yard.Nope. Not staying in. And my ears are pretty versatile.Which is why during Amazon Days I just purchased the Beats Fit Pro set.The sound on the Fits... Not gonna lie, huge difference in quality. Wasn't expecting it to be that different. But, alas, it is. Now with that said, these here are super affordable. If you're on a budget get them. The fits, not on sale and on sale, not for a budget audio buyer. So think about what is important as far as staying in your ears. If you're looking for a chill around the house, sure these are excellent. If you wanna run, don't. Save and get the fits.Comfortable. Weight is not heavy. I don't use my buds for calls so I cannot speak on the mic, sorry.
product_attributes: Color: Sunset PinkStyle: Studio BudsSet: Without AppleCare+

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars actually disappointing
author: kimmy
content: bought these after my airpod pros died on me suddenly. i have been using these beats studio buds for about 6 months and the experience has been inconsistent to say the least. first issue: they fall out of my ears if i do simple things like turn my head or chew. i can barely walk or exercise with them in because they just fall out. i looked online and it seems others have had these issues; people were suggesting swapping the size of the actual ear bud and even wearing them in reverse (with the left bud in the right ear and right bud in left ear). neither if these worked for me. really made me appreciate the airpod design.it was fairly easy to connect the very first time but every time after that is almost always a pain. if the case is dead but the beats themselves are still charged itâ€™s like it doesn't recognize that the beats are still working and refuses to connect. even if the case is charged sometimes it just will not recognize that the beats are in range of my phone, even if they're sitting right on top of each other. if itâ€™s not straight up refusing to connect itâ€™s disconnecting randomly. if i open my car door - even with the car turned off - the beats automatically disconnect from my phone as if it expects me to connect my phone to carplay. there are many times i have been talking on the phone using my beats and suddenly they will disconnect.the controls only kind of work. you can use the default preset controls like pressing twice for skipping songs and once for hanging up calls and the like. however you're supposed to be able to customize these controls to in your phone settings but they only work as long as the beats are disconnected. as soon as you put the beats away and disconnect everything goes back to default settings the next time you reconnect. noise cancellation is a joke, it sounds the same as when its on transparent mode or off.the case feels like cheap plastic. i got a silicone case because i was afraid of scratching it up. not much else to say about it.the color of the beats are great. i got red and it looks super cool. i think the sound quality is on par with my old airpod pros. when i am on the phone others have not had a problem with not hearing me or me coming across muffled, so thatâ€™s a plus.overall, these earbuds are nothing special. i got these around the holidays when they were almost half off. glad i didnâ€™t pay full price for these as they are disappointing at best.ETA: as of july 2024 i ditched these and bought another pair of airpod pros. literally no regrets.
product_attributes: Color: RedStyle: Studio BudsSet: Without AppleCare+

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely Awesome
author: Tyrone Johnson
content: After only using over the ear headphones for years, I thought about it and thought about it because of concerns about sound quality and fit. After reading the reviews of these buds and more thought, I went ahead and order these. Received them a couple days ago and I'm blown away. Not only do they fit in my ears like a glove, but the sound quality is superb. Pairing them with my Samsung Ultra was quick, smooth and effortless. Rich sound with highs and lows that stand out. Very decent bass. Cannot hear anything going on around me. I had to mow my grass after I got them so I decided to use them to listen to music while mowing. I could not even hear the mower and had to take them out once or twice to make sure that the mower was running. title: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Perfect Storm!!! Flawless execution of what SHOULD BE
author: TheChrisSimon
content: 2 years ago I was I acquired a pair of the Galaxy Buds+. I would have never I have purchased them myself, as spending top dollar for a pair of earbuds or headphones to me was not something that I would have spit my money on. I had no instructions, just a little black case in the bottom of a drawer, that someone had left behind. What I discovered, was a piece of technology, that made my life better, and it's quality, simplicity, and joy that it bestowed upon my soul.I only had that unit for a period of maybe 2 months. During that time I use them to live. The full sound l, flawless amplification of surrounding noises, everything about these was amazing. The fit in my ear, the simplicity of touch controls, everything made them something I didn't know that I couldn't live without. Through sheer negligence, I I dropped the right bud into a toilet, and flust it before I realized what had happened. There was a period of grief. And that left bud sat in its case and a drawer for 4 months, as I did not have the disposable funds to go buy a new pair, until it occurred to me to just buy a replacement for the lost bud. Purchase of the second hand market I could never get it to pair and it just sent me further into sadness.Set that time I have made an emission, define a worthy replacement. I have spent conservatively $1,800 and tried every brand from generic to Apple to the Samsung's themselves come and nothing matched the pure perfection of the plus. Well what are you going to do they don't make them anymore. And then on prime I saw that Samsung was selling them, for more then they're top of the line current model. How's this possible? They quit selling them years ago?My theory is that the human ear, Is only so big. There was a team at Samsung that put this bud into the Universe, and those in the upper echelon know it is the Alpha qnd Omaga. I planned up the lessons, and the perfect bargain earbud does not make for the quarterly Prophets jump where the marketing team happy. So they have hidden this, for those that are only in the know. Hey now you know, I bought and Amazon refurbished pair, as well as the buds FE. As a birthday present. The buds FE arrived 3 days before the plus, and I did not unseal the package, because I knew in my heart. I went to my Amazon locker 3 days later with speed and haste that not felts in years. Went home and let them sit for a good I don't know hour and a half as I twittered about my apartment. And when I put them in my ear? Yeah, that's the stuff. Look no further. I mean wait I don't want you to take them all, keep your secret between us. Don't tell anybody about me, we will be the ones the know.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Hard to beat, but get aftermarket tips!
author: Thunderlizard
content: For the money, these buds are fantastic! Call qaulity inbound and out is good, with teh exception of an occasional improper insert in my ear making my voice sound like a walkie-talkie...simple repositioning fixes this.I noticed ambiant sound blockage was not that great with the stock eartip, but I purchased an aftermarket set of tips that has a multilayer construction (Diofit Premium) for next to nothing and they now block almost all but the harshest outside sound. Quite impressive. Now on to playback - in classic Samsung fashion, these buds sound fantastic! Highs are crisp (not hard with earbuds) but most impressive is the rich, deep bass. So enjoyable to listen to music, because the sound quality is great and now the background noise is almost non-existant. Hard to beat in this price range!

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good buds!
author: David D
content: I recently purchased the SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds FE True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds in the Graphite color and I have been extremely impressed with their performance. As someone who is always on the go and constantly listening to music or podcasts, having a reliable and comfortable pair of earbuds is essential for me. The Galaxy Buds FE have exceeded my expectations in both of these areas.First and foremost, the comfort and secure fit of these earbuds is top-notch. The wing-tip design ensures that they stay in place even during intense workouts or when I'm running errands. I have tried many other wireless earbuds in the past and have always struggled with finding a pair that stays in my ears comfortably. The Galaxy Buds FE have solved this problem for me and I can wear them for hours without any discomfort.The sound quality of these earbuds is also impressive. The audio is clear and crisp, with a good balance of bass and treble. I have used them for both music and phone calls and have been pleased with the sound in both scenarios. The touch controls on the earbuds are also very convenient and easy to use. I can easily pause or skip a song without having to take out my phone.One of the standout features of these earbuds is the auto switch audio. This allows me to seamlessly switch between my phone and laptop when I receive a call or want to listen to something on my computer. It's a small feature, but it has made a big difference in my daily routine.I also appreciate the built-in voice assistant feature. I can easily access my virtual assistant with just a touch of the earbud, making it convenient to make calls, send texts, or get directions without having to take out my phone.The battery life on these earbuds is also impressive. I can use them for several hours without needing to recharge, and the charging case provides additional battery life when I'm on the go. The case is also compact and easy to carry around.Overall, I highly recommend the SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds FE True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds. They offer a comfortable and secure fit, great sound quality, and convenient features that make them a must-have for anyone looking for a reliable pair of wireless earbuds. Whether you're a music lover, fitness enthusiast, or just someone who wants a hassle-free listening experience, these earbuds are definitely worth considering.The only drawback is that the case is not wireless charging. Losing the one star.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars No Way
author: Dillon
content: Mother of GOD these are good.1) Super comfortable and secure. I can't even get them to fall out with the most ridiculous of abrupt head movements.2) Easy as hell to set up with my Samsung Galaxy phone. As soon as I opened the case, my phone woke up and was like, "Eeeey, these yours?" And I was off to the races.3) Feature rich as all getout. Disclaimer. I am not somebody that likes very feature rich things. I like my audio devices to play audio. Nothing more. These changed my mind completely. It works so seamlessly with the phone it feels like an expansion pack or something. Answering calls is easy and has incredible mic quality. Not sure how. Playing, pausing, and playing next and previous songs all uses one touch surface and it's way easier than expected.4) My absolute favorite thing about these. Audio quality. I'm absolutely blown away by how good these sound. I didn't think it was possible to get such huge sound out of earbuds. These lil things are the size of a roided out bean and they absolutely dominate my entire skull. Most people are going to be like "Yo the bass is fire. Riz and bruh and other sounds," but it's so much more than that. They deliver rich and clean audio across all frequencies. Yes, bass included. Very very f****** included. I listen to a lot of metal, which can be really demanding of speakers. The genre often includes a wide range of audio input simultaneously. These handle anything you throw at them no problem.In short, buy these. Go. Do it. Begone.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome earbuds. Great battery life.
author: Alfonso
content: Picked these up for 79 bucks. They look and sound great. Much like the buds plus, but, with better bass. Battery lasts all day. I can use these while I fall alseep.While the Buds2 Pro sound better, the Buds FE are half the price. That's the trade off.My solution; get an equalizer app. I use a free one off the Google Play store. Also, play with your equalizer/dolby atmos settings, if your phone has them.From there you can download the Galaxy Wearable app. Set up your earbuds. I find the normal sound setting to be best. Dynamic setting's bass is too heavy. Also, you can set the touch controls to raise or lower volume from the app.The Galaxy Buds FE are a great pair of earbuds for the price. I have even seen them go as low as 69 bucks. Maybe keep an eye out for a Prime Day deal. ðŸ‘€ðŸŽ§If you need to replace your Buds+ or your Buds2 Pro battery keeps dying, the Buds FE are a solid inbetween. 5/5

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Phenomenal.
author: Dani
content: Everything about these earbuds is amazing. I am a massive nerd for bass and things being loud. The bass is full and heavy.I was a bit skeptical because the newer models don't fit in my ear as well as the old Galaxy Buds Plus but these... these are amazing. Their so comfortable I could probably sleep with them in comfortably.As always, they were extremely easy to connect and the features are fun to play with.The battery life is amazing too. Please consider getting these earbuds.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Everything ðŸ™‚
author: C.
content: These are the best buds I ever bought. Touch pad on the buds. The nlise cancelation is great and the ambient sound is insane. You can hear how the both modes switch. Great buy plus i got them on prime day for a great deal. Great size for the case and buds. If you have a samsung and love samsung like i do purchase these buds!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simply great!
author: SC
content: I have always had issues with discomfort from earbuds and them falling out when I move too much. These solved that problem. Those little wings on top might not seem like much but those and the overall shape helps for verrrry comfortable fit. You don't even have to stick them far inside your ear.The sound is really lovely... smooth, velvety and rich. Personally, I go for a heavy bass and I love that I could choose different equalizer settings.The noise canceling is great also. You can turn on ambient sound if you so desire to zone out.I have a samsung phone so pairing was super easy.Overall I really have nothing negative to say.Get them.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works great!
author: Amazon Customer
content: I have a samsung phone so I ordered these for that reason. The sound is great when listening to music or media. It has a surround sound to them. As for phone calls I can hear pretty clear on them except once there was static but I'm not sure if that was the earbuds or the phone. Sometimes the person on the other end can't hear me very well, I've been advised that I sound muffled which I'm assuming it's from having the earbud pushed so far into my ear, but I like to make sure that I don't lose them like I have in the past because they are so small and falls out of my ear. But overall I like them alot.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Samsung Wins! No Question Ask...
author: Pony She
content: Two years ago, I spent about $200 on Amazon to buy a pair of BðŸ˜¨se ear buds, but unfortunately, the left one broke after I only used it five times! The reason is that failure will occur if the battery is completely exhausted without charging. After Google online, I found out that this problem has always been there but the manufactur never done anything about it. Sigh! Unable to return it, I can only scrap it and try to get a new pair. This time I stopped being superstitious about top brands and bought this pair of Samsung. I was very happy after receiving it because not only the sound quality is much better, but also no hidden flaws. This pair of Samsung buds is really great! I am very pleased and I am willing to recommend it to everyone!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best out of all the buds!
author: s.g.
content: I'm a FE (Fan Edition) person when it comes to Samsung. I've seen the buds pro 3 that just came out and it's giving Apple. I feel like each model got worse. My Buds 2 kept falling out of my ears and the sound wasn't great. These buds, however, stay in my ears comfortably, block out any outside sounds, connect easily, and unbelievable quality in sound! Great bass! They should have never changed the look of the buds. I love these. Get them.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beat all of my expectations!
author: antonio calderon
content: After a failed trial run with the Amazon Echo Buds (which were a waste of money), me and my wife gave these a try. And let me tell you, we LOVE them! These are the first pair of buds with true ANC that ACTUALLY worked and worked very well. Ambient mode is great also, so I can wear 1 in my ear at work and still be able to hear everything around me perfectly, while still listening to my music. Was a little weary about the bad reviews for them not staying in the ear well, but they actually stay in great for the both of us. She was more worried because she has a LOT of piercings in and around each ear so finding good buds that fit comfortably AND stay in is very hard for her to find. The sound in them is also pretty great. I'm no expert but all i have to say is the sound is crisp. Really surprised we were able to get something with this type of quality and functionality for only $79. Super happy with our new ear buds!

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good ear buds
author: C. Brown
content: My last pair of Samsung ear buds were amy favorite. These are ok but I'm petite and they a bit big. After I wear them a while my ear gets sore. But if you have normal sized ears you will like them. I miss being able to skip or play back my songs with a touch of the earbuds. My old Samsung buds (from 2020) would do that and were about the same price as these. Good battery life. Not as great as the older version. About the same for phone calls. Callers complain of background noises.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Best for the price only issue is charging in case can be finicky.
author: Amazon Customer
content: I love these earphones and I'm quite satisficed with my purchase. The only issue I have with them is that charging the earphones in case disconnects with any small movements. The left side doesn't connect to the pins as well as it should. I have the patience to work with it but I am not so sure for other customers.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Impressed
author: J. Heil
content: I am impressed at the fit, ease of use, and sound quality of these Buds. I got them on a Prime Day deal and couldnâ€™t be happier. Note, I have not tried these while running, but I did wear these on a hot and humid walk where I got sweaty, and these buds stayed in my ears just fine.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great quality for money
author: Rick Corum
content: I absolutely love these earbuds! Great sound and plenty of bass in them. I am able to use them at work all day with no discomfort and still able to hear ambient sounds when necessary. The only downfall that I see overall would be that the case doesn't charge wireless (I knew this coming into buying them) and the other would be the water resistance level. Other than that, completely loving these buds!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars The ANC on these is amazing
author: Jeremy
content: I was disappointed that the galaxy buds live never got a revision so I bit the bullet and got these to replace them. I'm no audiophile but the sound was good, the fit was pretty good out of the box but the Active Noise Cancelling on these are amazing. It was like muting the world so now I can listen to my music at a lower volume and drown all of the New York hustle and bustle.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best sound quality per dollar. Period.
author: Temur
content: PROS:I've tried probably 30+ headphones and I've got to say these headphones are the best sounding. Lows and mids are perfect-- not muffled together. Highs are just crisp enough to not be annoying-- they shine through perfectly from the nice smooth lows/ mids.I think the sound signature of these earbuds are very natural in it's core while packing a punch.My favorite headphones all time is the audio technica mth m50x-- these earbuds remind a lot of m50s!.CONS:Fit and comfort over a long period of time. Initially-- the fit is great within the first hour. However, for long period of time-- the earbuds themselves start to sore the inside of the ears--- leaing to user to take breaks by taking them off.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars They'll fall right out of the case but have great sound
author: sukajai
content: The buds have very weak magnets and thus will fall right out of the case if dropped. Not amazing, but at least the sound quality is excellent, likely best in class, and the noise cancellation is also great. The battery lasts a long time in the buds themselves, but I've noticed that the case tends to lose battery after a few uses. Not a huge deal, but something to keep in mind considering how small the case is.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good price.
author: Melissa Nattress
content: I like these ear buds. I think they have been durable. The only thing I don't like is the fit. I have small ears. This bud makes my ears sore with extended use. The product itself is great. I just thought saying ear size could help another consumer make the best choice for them. I would recommend this product.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good Product
author: Ms.  LC
content: I like that they give you a two band option because I have small ears. I keep my phone on silent an they alerts me of incoming messages. I like that when you insert the Bluetooth you have to twist it to secure it in the ear.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great over all
author: Jewel
content: I love the sound quality. It was very easy to set up. They're lightweight and came with many earbud cusions and wing tips. I love the fact that the buds actually stay in my ears without falling out. The magnetism is strong. My only complaint is that it wasn't the color I ordered.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great noise cancelling.
author: Blood dreamer
content: These are great headphones, I've had them for a few months now and haven't had any issues with them. The noise cancelling feature is amazing and the most used, especially when my family is fighting and I need an escape. Just great to turn my music on and create a silent zone to not hear the screaming..They're also apparently drop resistant, I had one knocked out of my hand and it went flying a foot or two almost into a river, no damage and works perfectly. Was scared I was going to have to replace it too. Was shocked to see it was fine.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wow
author: Dalton
content: These earbuds are amazing for the money, they're comfortable, the sound quality is better than any other earbud I've ever had before, and nomatter how much I shake my head I can't get these things to fall out.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars THESE ARE AMAZING ðŸ˜
author: Iriana McGowan
content: First off their hefty they have a good weight nothing rattles or is loose everything looks expensive and good quality. As soon as I put them on it's like I was sucked into noise cancellation world everything around me when I put them in with no music playing sounds like you're underwater which I love cause I don't wanna hear anything outside of my earsbuds! The music sound is crisp no static no muffling no gurgling just clear sound and it's loud their amazing I love them will most definitely buy again!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome buds for the price!!!
author: Candygirl
content: I just received today I can't put them down. Sound quality, fit, ease of use 10 out of 10. Now, full transparency I have never paid more than $20 for headphones, so I may be easy to please. They even let you know if the bud isn't positioned properly. I'm in love. I will update my review when I experience the battery life.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars These earbuds are pretty much perfect
author: vacuums
content: I had a pair of Galaxy Buds from years ago that I really like but were starting to act up. I looked at a lot of different options and even tried a set of Anker buds that I ended up returning. I came back to these, which I think are the newer version of what I had. Things I like:-The buttons are very easy to tap and double or triple tap. There are a lot of different options to customize what that does in the app.-Sound quality is great.-The fit is fantastic for me. I love the ear "wings". They make a nice secure fit that and it never feels like they are in danger of falling out.-Changing case is compact and these charge easily by dropping them in.-There is an option to set either the right or left earbud to toggle between noise canceling and ambient sound modes when you long press. Both these modes work great. Noise canceling is enough that I can mow the lawn without needing separate ear protection and I can quickly switch to ambient mode if I need to hear someone talking to me.-The biggest upside is that these are quite a bargain. Quite a bit less than some of Samsung's other models of earbuds.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money
author: Travis
content: I got these earbuds to replace my Skullcandy earbuds and for the 10 dollars more they are worth that. I wish I would've bought these 1st.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Buds
author: Mark/Sharon H.
content: Great buds. They fit well, easy to setup for bluetooth and works great. Get the warranty. When you buy a page pops up saying buy this Charger don't buy it one comes with.

La conexiÃ³n Bluetooth es estable, sin cortes molestos.Lo que mÃ¡s me gusta es lo cÃ³modos que son. Puedo usarlos por horas sin que me molesten, y el estuche de carga es muy prÃ¡ctico para llevar en el bolsillo. title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Convenient
author: keiserdog
content: I love these, sound is great, my one complaint is that they're not loud enough but I've never used a pair that were. They are comfortable and they stay in well.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Big fan- I'm an ear bud convert
author: Liz S
content: I hate ear buds but these make me hate them less!! They paid so easily with my Samsung phone and laptop (my JBL cheapo ones were always struggling) and the battery life is stellar. I like the noise canceling feature and the ability to turn that off (i.e. during biking or hiking). Range is so so but my old JBLs had bad range too so I don't know how to compare.The wing tip is really what converted me because it stays in my ear!! I liked the ear clip kind previously but now I'm all in on these. Woohoo!

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good ear buds.
author: BaddAzzYellaBro
content: Pairs easily with my Samsung Galaxy phone. Nice fit and easy to use app.Edit: After using a few times. Very short battery life, even on standby. Keep the case handy to re-charger if you plan to use for an extended time. Knocked off 1 star.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best ear buds I've ever owned
author: Alexandra D.
content: I'm extremely happy with these earbuds. I love that the software helps you fit them to your correct size that way you get the perfect fit which truly makes a difference. They're so comfortable and it's pretty much impossible for them to fall out of your ears. They connect right away and the sound is amazing

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Samsung Buds Fe
author: Andres Gutierrez
content: Excellent since I made the purchase they arrived ahead of time. Excellent headphones, very good sound, easy to pair with the cell phone and the watch.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars So Happy I Chose These!
author: Summer
content: I love these guys! Amazingly snug fit! Great sound options and quality! I was torn between the FE and the true wireless. These were $45 cheaper, fit much better and have all the same sound options and quality. So happy I went with these!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars They are small fit perfectly
author: Dante
content: Great earbudsThe SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds FE are Great choice for music lovers and sports people. These earbuds fit snugly and comfortably in your ears, with easy touch controls for a hassle-free experience.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Better to buy new and Best with Samsung phone
author: Julie
content: This is a bit long but I feel it provides good info regarding your phone or electronic device to be paired with earbuds and purchasing new vs used earbuds. If you have questions about these topics please read!I purchased these for my boyfriend. He has a Samsung S22. I have bought him multiple types of brand new earbuds in the $70-$80 range in the past. He had to charge all those daily in order to used for 1.5 hrs while he walked. I wanted to buy him something nicer so I bought these. I chose to buy a used set in hopes that they were in great condition and maybe the box was just torn. I changed them overnight on accident (I prefer not to charge too long). Then paired then with my iPhone. I have owned several versions and pairs of iPods and Beats Pro (over the ear). So my first reaction was disappointment because the sound quality did not compare and little things didnâ€™t work the same. For example when you take your Beats out if your ear whatever your watching stops. That is not the case with these. Also when a call comes in, I had to manually change the option to the ear bud on my phone screen vs just answering by touching my ear. However, I still gave them to my boyfriend for Easter and when he paired them with his galaxy he was prompted to add an extra app that gave him different features than I had with my Apple. Initially he was not too impressed with the sound, he expected them to be louder. The noise canceling was so good, he had to take them out to hear me talk to him. What he loved about them was the length of time he was able to go before charging the case. Remember I charged them one time, then he used them off of my original charge after sitting in the box for a few days. He wore them everyday for 5 days without charging the case. At that point he was really happy with them. Enough to overlook the sound quality since it was not what he expected. Unfortunately when he charged the case he was not able to get the Right earbud to charge. We tried different troubleshooting methods. Unfortunately none of them have worked. We will be sending them back. I donâ€™t have experience using Apple headphones or buds with Samsung phones but I feel if I had bought these brand new, he would keep them vs buying headphones like mine. Iâ€™d rather pay an extra $50 to get new products going forward. Please air on the side of caution if you buy used or refurbished version of these ear buds. Hopefully this helps someone trying to decide between new or used and Apple/Beats products vs Other earbuds to pair with an android phone.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Will not fall out, good sound isolation
author: MarkC
content: I have purchased three or four off brand earbuds over the years. Why I didn't get a quality pair like this first I'm not sure. Very comfortable in-ear and the little wing hooks into your ear Channel when you rotate the earbuds slightly. They will not fall out and are much more comfortable than the style with the over the ear hooks. Much easier to get in too. Sound quality is very good to me I'm no audiophile. I've been part of the Galaxy ecosystem since way back. These fit in perfectly with Samsung's software and other products. Don't hesitate.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Compatibility issues
author: Mr.E
content: App doesnâ€™t work with apple

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Jury is still out
author: ShaunMar
content: Jury is still out on these. I think if my phone didn't have Samsung Sound Assistant to eq the sound, it would fall short of expectations.Surprisingly, these sound louder & more bold on my iPhone. Back on the Galaxy, the bass is less pronounced than my old buds live. You could argue that's a more 'balanced' sound, but if you want more bass, you want more bass.They do seem to stay in ear better than the live & the BT signal connection is much improved over the live. The live was straight garbage when it came to holding on to the BT signal.One thing I dislike is no good way way of seeing battery levels.Other features are cool. May update this review later after I've had it for longer. One thing is I wouldn't pay a dime more than I did for it. It would be a better value at a lower price.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not great
author: Ibuy
content: These are fine at best. But I only bought because I list my pro models. When I found the pros again and compared, it was such a huge difference. These are less comfortable and the sound quality is so poor in comparison.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love them
author: Y
content:
I don't regularly buy headphones that don't have additional support lining my ear because my ears are very small and don't hold back hearing aids with this style. The story is completely different with these. I live with them on, because of my type of work I need to be connected and in constant movement. The only flaw, but it's small; the recharge is only with a cable, so I can't recharge it with my wireless charger such as the watch and the phone.
As for quality, I'll summarize it by saying... IT'S SAMSUNG QUALITY and they have never let me down.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Best earbuds I have ever used
author: Carolina De La Ossa
content: I purchased this earbuds because I was tired of using some cheap SkullCandy ones that really hurt my ears. These are the most confortable buds I've ever used, specially for me since I have tiny ears. I also love the fact that they stay in place when using them for workouts and jogging sessions. The noise cancellation works wonders. I'm not particularly fan of the ambient noise feature, it amplifies the ambient noise to much, even when setting that to "low". If I take these to the office, I end up accidentally eavesdropping what my coworkers are talking about from a mile away, which ends up been distracting. The idea was to notice if someone was talking to me so I didn't have to continuously take the buds off. Also, Mac support isn't the best, but I'm sure that's Apple's fault haha.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars They Stay Put
author: Justin Stephenson
content: I had the more expensive pro buds and they CONSTANTLY fell out no matter how I had them in my ear. The wing makes a huge difference, and the sound quality it excellent.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for Small Ears!
author: makaylag
content: I have VERY small ears. I have tried many different earbuds over the years and none will even go into my ear. I have tried a few amazon off brand ones, JBL vibe flex (which are the next best fit, but still dont stay in), the samsung galaxy buds, studio buds, and a few others. The sound quality is great, although I don't have much to compare to because these are the only ones that I have been able to get into my ears and stay for more than 5 minutes. I am so happy I have found something that fits my ears that isn't a $500 + pair of custom molded earbuds.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars As advertised
author: Kindle Customer
content: Work fine as advertised

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Noise cancelling
author: Matt
content: Love everything about these especially the ability to isolate sounds and how easily they connect to devices.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Battery doesn't last as long as I would like

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars  It has good sound
author: RSC 12353 Noelis Moya

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Entry Level Samsung Earbuds
author: Matthew Depew
content: There are definitely cheaper brands out there, I own a few, but for the privlce, these earbuds are great. The noise canceling was a huge plus for me, especially at this price point. Big upgrade from my non-Samsung earbuds I was using previously. I am not an audio expert, nor am I super picky with my earbuds, but even I noticed an improvement over the sub $100 ones I am used to.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice
author: Lionheart

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Happy with the Sound Quality and Battery Life
author: Cody
content: I purchased these to replace my Raycon Everyday earbuds because I thought the Raycons sounded shrill at higher volumes. These sound so much better and also have better battery life for around the same price.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Don't stay in my ears!

I ended up buying another cheap pair of over the ear buds that stay in place when I work out and they have a battery life that literally last for weeks.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Samsung ear buds
author: Chris McWain

These don't have that problem. Highly recommend!

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great ear buds
author: Amy Mouskountakis
content: For your users, that like great value war buds, Samsung earbuds are great. I recommend these to everyone.k

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars These are pretty cool.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Outrageous sound for price

content: I happened to come across these on Rtngs review. Their test resulted with high scores on bass, midrange & treble. But for its price I thought the test numbers were typos. Bose, Apple & Beats have excellent sound but are just not loud enough for me, and the price of this Samsung buds are fraction of their prices. Very happy with this purchase

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars A gift

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best purchase I've ever made
author: Ava
content: I used to have wireless $300 Sony headphones and dare I say, these are a thousand times better for 1/3 of the price. They are comfortable, they have incredible bass, treble, and overall performance. I love the ease of connecting them and the fact I can switch them between different phones in seconds. They fit perfectly in my ear. I love these things. My only reservation is I wish the battery was longer but the case can charge it to full like 4 times before it needs to be charged again.

content: I was not expecting the sound quality that these produce. Yes you could spend $200 - $300 or more and get an expensive pair of buds BUT why? These sound great, clear, easy to adjust, easy to use and set up, and did I say sound great. If you want a great pair of buds for $100, these are the ones to buy. Highly recommend.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wings!!!!!
author: Robert M.
content: I've missed the security of the wings on my buds. I had the original ones then upgraded to the buds pro 2. Those had great sound and ambient mode in the gym was perfect to block the world out, but they would feel like they were always slipping out. With the wing feature it locks in place and never falls out, even on a run. Still great sound. FE vs buds pro 2, I will choose the FE and give my kids the pro or sell them. 69 bucks for the FE is amazing.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Basically the airpods of Samsung

I can listen for 10 hours at work with a half our recharge at lunch and I dont even get close to running out of battery. The case loses charge fairly quickly but I charge it every 2-3 days for an hour or so and it's good to go again.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love them

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice for the Price
author: D. Conrad
content: I really like these Samsung earbuds. They fit great, sound great, and the price was nice. The only drawback for me is this: I like to listen to music thru them to fall asleep, but, I'm a side sleeper and they keep turning off. However, using them throughout the day, I love them!!

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not overly impressed
author: Amazon Cutstomer
content: I've only had these a day but there are not many reviews so I'll give my 1st impressions. I wore them for a few hours doing yard work (using my Samsung S22) and tried them with some of my favorite test tracks connected to my PC and using Amazon HD music (using Exclusive mode)The first thing that surprised me was the white case... I ordered black, and at first thought they sent the wrong ones but opened the case and the buds themselves were black. I don't like white, but whatever.Looking at the case there is not much indication of what is the front and it's a bit fiddly to open. The magnet to suck the buds into place is not very strong, so a bit fiddly to lay them in the case.I don't like wearing buds much, but these were pretty comfortable right out of the box. The insertion was not quite as deep as I like but they stayed in well while I was moving around and I did not feel the need to keep adjusting them.How do they sound:I want to emphasize these are first impressions.These have a polite sound that would probably please many people. I'm not one of them. When I got the Lypertek buds for the same price I told people "I can't believe how good a sound you can get for $100 these days". With these, I would say "They are ok, most people would like them".They are "fine" for having something playing in your ear while you do something else but they did not bring out any joy in the music for me. Nothing stood out about the sound. Ordinary comes to mind or, nothing wrong but nothing right. I'm not into 'soundstage' the the lack of one while listening to live tracks actually stood out to me.The sound is a bit congested, the instruments kind of bunched into each other. There is no 'air' around the instruments. I found myself pushing the volume louder than I normally listen to "wake them up a bit".Detail retrieval is decent, but you are not going to notice the reverb, the grind of a distorted guitar, the 'ting' of the drumsticks on a cymbal, breath sounds, etc. The overall presentation is smooth enough from low to high, with no glaring holes, or peaks. If I had to fault the frequency response it would be male voices. Just a bit in your face at times. Bass get a bit tubby if you try to push it much. In "normal" mode I found it just about right.Let's see what I can 'fix' with EQ. The EQ in the App has 9 bands, cool! But that hardly matters if there is no custom EQ option. Seriously Samsung? The Sennheiser App only has 3 bands but at least they let you set a custom EQ, name it, and save it.There are 7 presets, but none of them really gave me something I liked. But there is enough variety that most people would find something they like.I'm mixed on keeping them. The sound is good enough for what I want them for. listening to music while I do something else. They are comfortable and stay in well, but I am not impressed with the sound. It's "fine", it's "okay", and "good enough" but not impressed with the sound for the $100 price point.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sounds great

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Music to my....

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars They're just okay.
author: Bethany Graham
content: They paired immediately which I always like. Sound quality isn't anything to write home about, but it's good enough. Has an ambient noise feature that I like. The case is magnetic so it's easy to put the buds back in; however, I've dropped the case twice (three foot fall onto carpeted floor) and both times both earbuds fell out which is concerning. Battery life is decent and I have yet to have them die on me. My longest session with them in was about 4 hours. Additional features like tapping to pause media can be a bit finicky and there's been an instance where the buds didn't recognize I was wearing them, so I had to put them back in the case and put them in again to make the right bud turn on.Minus one star because if I wear these for more than 2-3 hours (like when listening to audiobooks) my ears start to hurt.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sounds great. Doesn't fall out. great value.
author: FlyinG
content: These buds firmly stay in place while running and doing situps. Ambient sound pass through is nearly as good as nod buds at all. I frequently leave them in while on conference calls. Noise reduction is sufficient for ear buds. Battery life is enough for about half a day of full time wearing.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best earbuds I've owned.
author: Amazon Customer
content: They're comfortable, great bass, connects automatically to my Samsung Galaxy phone, fits well in my ear and they have a premium look and feel.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Can you hear me now?
author: Son of Sam
content: I had high hope for these buds. The fit was much better than my Samsung Buds Pro. The battery life(5-6 hrs) comes nowhere near the Pros which last a full ten hour shift with no problem. The sound quality is pretty good when listening to music or phone calls. The noise canceling ability is good for the price paid. For me, these buds fail during calls for the people on the other end. I get constant requests to repeat what I just said or people telling me they can't here me when background noise is high. Sick of asking callers, "CAN YOU HEAR ME NOW?"

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Galaxy Buds fe
author: Marty53
content: These are the best buds I've ever had. I love them. They stay in my ears and the sound is great. Charge lasts. Connected to my Galaxy S21 and Galaxy Tab 8 right away.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable but terrible for calls
author: jsf
content: Pros:I have very small ears and it is difficult to find any sort of headphones or ear plugs that will stay in. These have these little wings that hook in under the ear and stay in place. So I was glad to find something that would fit my ears and didn't fall out when I moved around. The sound quality is fine although I'm not a very discerning audiophile.Cons: I cannot use these for calls because nobody says that they can hear me when I'm using them. I'm going to stick with my wired headphones for phone calls. I would not buy this if your goal is to use them for calls. If that was my goal I would have given this one star.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars as good or better than 2 pro, cheaper to replace when I lose them

content: I honestly believe that these sound better than the 2 pros, probably because they fit better. And at half the price, cheaper to replace, because I frequently do.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than the original in almost every way
author: Michael Barnes
content: Got these when I lost my Samsung Buds, and they're definitely an upgrade. Fits about the same, but the mesh on the silicone tip makes them easier to clean and harder to clog. The earbuds themselves last about 6-7 hours on a full charge, and the case has around 2.5 charges stored, a lot better than the original (5 hours and 1 charge). Ambient sound works way better too, and they have decent noise canceling. The sound is amazing, I can almost feel the bass with some songs. The only thing that's "worse" is that they don't do wireless charging.
